<Author>MHanco
<Content>Great Hotel We booked into the affinia based on other Trip Advisor reviews and weren't disappointed. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was large, clean and comfortable. We had a small kitchen area, with fridge, microwave, cooker etc, a good sized bathroom with Aveda toiletries and a huge bed. The hotel offers a 'pillow service', so you can request different types of pillows for a good nights sleep! It's well located on East 34th street, so a stones throw away from the Empire State Building, Macey's, 5th Avenue etc. There's The Barking Dog restaurant attached to the side of the hotel, which serves enormous breakfasts. They have tables outside. It seems to be used by locals as well. We flew into La Guardia, which is closer to the hotel but were flying back from Newark. We asked the hotel reception how much a taxi would be and they said about $80. They told us about a shuttle service which only cost us $38. All in all a great hotel.  
<Date>Aug 22, 2008

<Author>SeanHickey
<Content>Affinia Rules! My wife and two boys, ages 6 and 8 stayed at the Affinia Aug1st thru the 4th. We reserved thru Quickbook for avg $330 per nite.Check-in took about 4-5 mins. The elevator delivered us to the 34th floor in another 4 mins. The room was very large. It included a kitchen and fullsize refrigerator. The bathroom was nice size. The shower pressure was perfect. The mattresses were just right on the firmness. The pillows were the comfortable feather type. The views included midtown towers. Walk out of the hotel, take a left and you are on the way to a mini market, Murray hill diner, subway, and the empire state bldg. Walk out of the hotel to the right and you're on the way to a block full of restaurants. Avoid Blockheads. The doorman recommended the italian place and it was very good. After walking the city all day, it was nice coming back to a comfortable quiet room. We never heard anything next door. This was first hotel experience in NYC for me since the 70's. My wife was impressed. As a former flight attendant, she's experienced a few dumps in NYC. I'm glad we didn't stay near 42nd street. The Affinia location seems to have a more residential feel to it. I recommend the beast, little italy, yankee afternoon game, 30 rock, and look for the Croation sensation around the plaza hotel. This guy from Croatia took us on his bike around Central park. It was clear he was outworking all of his competition. He studied the history of Central park and gave you a very informative tour. I wish I remembered his name. I would like to stay at this hotel again. The service from all the hotel employees was excellent. The only negative which I could think of was the hotel did not have a large lobby, bar area, restaurant.  
<Date>Aug 15, 2008

<Author>DrSpook
<Content>Marvelous! Marvelous hotel, great location, will stay here again.Stayed 7th Aug for a few nights. I added a high floor room pls request when booking with expedia but that hadn't reached the hotel - no problem, they changed the room to 28th floor corner room straightaway. The rooms are spacious, traffic noise not a problem, the staff were very helpful  the large fridge was a god-send.The in-room drinks  snacks are overpriced as you'd expect, but there's murray hill market to the left  duane reed (like a large corner shop for UK types, don't be put off by the drug store name) over the road to the right and a slightly larger shop round the corner (north) on 3rd ave.We didn't eat at the Barking Dog. We tried Penelope's (lexington  30th) for breakfast and found it ok if not special. EJs luncheonette on the upper east side was our fave breakfast place, or Celeste's diner at the brooklyn end of the brooklyn bridge.We used the subway a lot  would recommend the $25 weekly metro card if you're here for a few days. The subway stop is close (park  33rd) as is the empire state building.UK types: on your first morning, get up early (you'll be awake anyway)  do the statten island ferry  ellis  liberty island trips (buy tickets the day b4 for the trips). The first ellis trip is at 8am but the queues form around 730.We used taxis to  from the airport (they did try to push their car service a few times but backed off when we declined).

<Author>beckmars
<Content>We liked this hotel Our family of two adults and two teenagers stayed here for 3 nights. We had a junior suite which was spacious and exceeded our expectations.The hotel staff are friendly and helpful.We looked at the gym, which we didn't have time to use, but it appeared of a good standard.We used the Barking Dog restaurant next door for breakfast - it was good. We would have liked a bigger lobby - there are no real communal areas, but it wasn't that big a deal.Location is good - walking distance to many attractions and Fifth Avenue shopping. We used the subway nearby to get to Battery Park for the Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty tour.

<Author>Fred26
<Content>Great Stay Great Staff Booked this hotel through a website but had stayed at another affinia in manhattan. From the minute we pulled up to the door with our vehicle the service was fantastic. Check in was great and the doorman and the porter were awsome with the kids and made us all laugh. He delivered the bags to our room, recommended restaurants in the area, made sure we got the right pillows that we wanted to try (they have Ipod conected pillows with built in speakers for the kids...WOW were they in heaven) we had a choice of four or five types of pillows at our request. He came by later to make sure we got everything we needed from housekeeping. They took our vehicle away and brought it back without any issues. Expensive parking for a large SUV but worth the time and hassle saving of just unloading at the front of the hotel and giving them the keys and bringing it back when we checked out right in front of the door... really impressed with the staff and the cleanliness. Not the most central location but it depends where you want to go.

We had no hassles with check-in or checking -out, it all went very smoothly. I was keen to pay extra for a good hotel, I am so pleased I chose Affinia Dumont.. i will return and I did love New York!

<Author>superspiders100
<Content>Fabulous views and huge rooms We stayed at the Affinia Dumont inn March 2008 for our honeymoon and it did not disappoint. We booked a junior suite and we were really impressed by the size of the room. Room size seems to be a bit of an issue in New York but it is not a problem at the Affinia Dumont. We also had the most fantastic view - two enormous windows, one looking right over to the Chrysler Building and the other down to the East River. It was great to watch the city light up in front of us in over a bottle of wine.The space in the room came in very handy to store all the shopping too! There is so much to see and do in New York and we did most of it on foot. This made the extra big and extra comfy bed in the room very welcome at the end of a really busy day.We did not eat in the hotel restaurant, prefering to go out for the evening in Greenwich or East/West Village. This was really easy because there is a subway stop about 5 mins walk away. We did eat in an Italian restaurant just around the corner from our hotel on our first night which was very good. It was called Da Ciro and is great if you are too tired from the flight to venture out any further! A travel tip for anyone flying into JFK is to get the AirTrain from JFK to Jamaica Station. You can then get the Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) from Jamaica to Penn Station. Penn Station is about 10 mins walk along 34th St (past the Empire State Building) to the hotel. The trip from the airport only takes around 35 mins and is probably quicker than a taxi (and cheaper). You must remember to buy a separate ticket for the LIRR as the Metrocard is not valid on this line.  
<Date>Jul 27, 2008

<Author>Coops60
<Content>Wow, what a fantastic hotel We stayed at the Afinia in late June and were lucky enough to have a corner room on the 34th floor with views of the East river and the Chrysler Building. We often use Trip Advisor to help choose a hotel and I think the reviews here are fair. The hotel itself is good, the rooms are big, the beds are comfy and it is useful to have a kitchen area if not just for the huge fridge. The real reason to stay here is the location, it is great. A couple of blocks further up 34th and you start entering the hustle and bustle of the city, however it is relatively calm in the hotels district. There are countless restaurants and bars all within walking distance and having a Duane Reed across the street helps. We ate at the Barking dog, once for breakfast and once in the eve. The breakfast was OK however the evening meal was not up to much. Beware if you sit outside as water drips off the top of the building even if it isn raining and the staff seemed adamant that the customers were crazy! With all of the choice just outside the hotel the Barking dog should really be given a miss ?go to Penelope instead if you want the freshest and tastiest food for both breakfast and dinner! Some people have commented on noise, and yes there are a few ambulances in particular because of the two big hospitals that are just down the road. All I can say is that if you think this is noisy go stay in a central hotel and then compare it!All in all the hotel itself is very nice, the staff very helpful and yes the room is a little dated, but you know what, every thing worked and was spotlessly clean. The location is the main reason to stay here. We will stay again!  
<Date>Jul 27, 2008

<Author>Seorita_Kate
<Content>A Good All-rounder We stayed at the Affinia Dumont at the beginning and end of our two week tour of the North East of the US. Our first stay was for 3 nights in room 1804 which was fine. There was a problem in our bathroom which we called reception about, and within minutes, Dave from Maintenance was knocking on the door to sort it out. He fixed the problem and even sorted out some fresh towels from housekeeping for us. Aveda shampoo, conditioner and moisturisers are nice touches. Was a bit disappointed about the Internet access though, it's not cheap ($5 for 15 mins!) and there's no wireless in there either so you're a bit stuck. Jaeselite (or something like that!) in Reception was really lovely and helpful. She organised the best room for us for when we returned to NYC for our last night. This was 3704 - on the top floor and the view of the Chrysler building lit up at night was spectacular! The location is great, well placed to meander to most places and there;s a nice little minimarket on the corner to stock up on bits for the kitchenette. We had some breakfast at the Barking Dog on one of the mornings which was nice.Would definitely stay there again, everyone was friendly, the location was fab, and the bed was massive! The pillows were some of the most comfortable I've ever slept on!

<Author>egvacation
<Content>Beautiful, clean hotel We went to New York for a week to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday and high school graduation. We booked the Affinia Dumont based on TripAdvisor reviews and loved it! Initially, I was worried about the cleanliness of hotels in New York City, but the Affinia was exceptionally clean and stylish. The staff was also wonderful-so friendly and helpful. My daughter loved the sound pillow and complimentary iced tea. The hotel offers many amenities, such as bathrobes and specialty pillows, but you have to ask for them. We ate at the Barking Dog next door a few times-the food was okay. Although we took a taxi to Times Square and used the subway often due to the hotel's distant location, I highly recommend the Affinia Dumont. You won't be disappointed.

<Author>libraryladyDallas
<Content>Couldn't have been better!!!! What a fabulous vacation! The staff at the Affinia was absolutely fantastic!! Everyone that we dealt with was super helpful and friendly. The room was extra clean, comfy and so roomy. We loved the little kitchenette. Perfect for having breakfast in the room and then heading out for the day. The hotel was in a perfect spot-in a quiet neighborhood but still close to subways and attractions. You can pick up the Grey Line Tour bus just a couple blocks down from the hotel at the Empire State building. There is a little market right next to the hotel that is perfect for picking up groceries. We were there over the 4th and the hotel opened up a room that looked out over the East River to watch fireworks. We had the best view!! We will most definitely stay here again and most certainly recommend it to anyone!

<Author>ccmacy
<Content>Excellent Family Hotel. We love the Affinia Dumont We had a fantastic stay at this hotel in mid June. All of the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our suite was very large, and accommodated our family of 5 very comfortably. It was very clean and the Aveda products are great! The kitchenette came in very handy especially for breakfast and late night snacks. The restaurant offering room service was reasonably priced and decent. Not the best food we've had but the pizza was perfect for the kids. There is a great fitness room which my husband and sons raved about. (unfortunately I never got a chance to go...). This is a top notch hotel and perfect option for a family or large group. Perfectly located just 2 blocks from the subway, within walking distance of lots of sights. I felt safe in this neighborhood even walking alone at night. We will definitely stay here again and I give it a major thumbs up!

<Author>petermc01
<Content>Loved the Affinia We stayed for three nights in June at the Affinia Dumont and found it to be just perfect. On arrival we were greeted by Alex doorman/concierge who took care of our luggage and helped with my wheelchair as N.Y, cabbies don't seem to like helping with these. Check in was very efficient and the receptionist supplied us with maps and info for our visit. Our room was on the 25th floor with great views of the Chrysler Building, thought the pillow menu excellent idea but we stuck to the feather and down pillows, bed and pillows very comfortable. The hotel was in a great location and we were able to walk to Empire State building, Macy's and Central Station. Took Alex's recommendation on where to eat on our last night, a little Italian restaurant just around the corner, he didn't let us down it was lovely. Overall we had a great time and would certainly stay here again if we come back to New York.

<Author>Kathw
<Content>Amazing views, friendly staff, great location - highly recommended! We booked the Affinia solely on it's rating on Trip Advisor and I'm pleased to say that you all have excellent judgement! We only stayed 2 nights as we decided to spit the stay between here and a cheaper place as finances were tight, but I'm really glad we did as it was a fabulous place to end the trip. We stayed in a junior suite on floor 33 (or something around that number) and we got an amazing corner room. You can't determine the exact room when you book so it's partly luck of the draw, but we booked a fair while in advance and asked for a room that was high up with a good view and preferably on the corner and they obviously made the effort to meet our wishes.The room was huge - if one person was on the sofa and the other on the bed, you had to speak up slightly to be heard! The bathroom was impeccably clean and well fitted out and the spacious kitchen area was an unexpected bonus. Everything was spotless and the cleaners even washed up our dirty cutlery (which I felt very guilty about!). But by far the best feature of the room was the breathtaking view - you only have to look at the pictures here on trip advisor to see what I mean. The hotel is in a great location - not smack bang in the tourist district, but close to most attractions on the subway. The staff were friendly in a very genuine way, especially our lovely porter who was really helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but were advised that there are many places nearby (hundred yards or so) that are nicer  better value. We ate breakfast at a great coffee place about 1min from the hotel and there was a great 24hr grocery store nearby on the corner with a lovely deli (the lemon chicken was to die for). With a kitchen in the room this means you can actually save quite a bit on eating out. All in all we had a wonderful stay, and would definitely recommend it to anyone who wants a luxury stay at a reasonable price in central New York.  
<Date>Jul 12, 2008

<Author>Nicolaas
<Content>Watching the 4th of July fireworks in a great hotel The past few years I only select hotels based on the reviews in TripAdvisor. Again we were very pleasantly surprised with finding and chosing the Affinia Dumont hotel located in Murray Hill on this website. We first searched the big hotelwebsites, Expedia's, Kayak's etc. to find a good deal, but in the end the best deal was on the hotel's website itself. As a matter of fact I cannot remember when I booked a hotel or flight through one of these big sites for the last time. I am afraid they are losing their value-add for me.We also followed the advise of a previous reviewer to go to Penelope's (Lexington Avenue) for breakfast: great place and staff. And the Affinia advised us two great restaurants: Jackson Hole (for a good American hamburger - down PArk Avenue) and Daciro (Italian - also down Lexington Avenue). All very close to the hotel which does have a restaurant next door (Barking Dog - also okay), which also delivers for the room service of the hotel. I am not sure whether this is part of the hotel as such - if so, maybe they should be more clear about this.For the 4th of July the hotel made a suite available for its guests from where we could view the fireworks. Great since it was raining and nearly impossible to access the viewing points (we we walked back after several attempts to get there; we were stopped everywhere by the police). We had a large one bedroom suite with all we needed for our one week stay. We were on the 29th floor and traffic could still be heard, but not in a way that it kept us awake.So: great!

<Content>Great place! I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I will definitely stay at the Affinia again next time I'm in New York.

<Author>kreplech
<Content>Very nice. Booked through travelocity - flight and hotel $2500 for 5 nights. my wife and i stayed in the junior suite (room #1001) which was clean and pretty large. kitchen included a dishwasher (which the maid ran with all our dirty dishes every day), a large fridge, dishes, pots and pans, microwave and coffee maker (unfortunately they give you puck's coffee wich is just terrible). living room has a very large desk, pull-out sofabed, a couple comfy chairs, huge mirrors, stereo, tv, internet connection and cable, decent view that isn't really anything to write home about. the bedroom is a decent size - you can move around the room very easily despite a king size bed. lots and lots of closet space including a walk-in but also several drawers and two more closets for hanging. failry typical-but-clean bathroom accessible from bedroom only. thermostats adjust to 70 degrees automatically fairly early in the AM which was pretty annoying given the summer heat. the attached restaurant was very nice and not terribly expensive for NYC. all service was very nice - however, the maids are borderline OCD about the do not disturb signs and might yell at you if you don't use them. the spa and workout facilities are really what make this hotel so fancy... you should plan on using them. the hotel is located 8 blocks south of grand central. a quiet area that you'll feel safe in but probably wont really want to hang out in. several 20-something bars and a couple decent restaurants just 2 blocks away.

<Author>TeamPhillips
<Content>Huge rooms in the city! The Affinia Dumont was overall a wonderful place to stay in the city. One block from the 33rd St. subway stop. We arrived early, and the hotel was very accomodating with our baggage. After we returned to check in, the process was quick  painless. We had a junior suite  regular suite connected by an adjoining door; which formed a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite. Tons of places to eat nearby. My husband was annoyed that WiFi cost an additional $49/wk (or $10/day); for the price it should have been included. He also hated the in room coffee pot; minor inconvenience but worth mentioning to him :) A shopping market was located 2 doors down from the Affinia Dumont, so we were able to pick up a few things for our kitchen, which was very convenient. The hotel staff was very helpful  friendly; we had a party of 5  a ton of luggage. The concierge arranged for limo transportation to the airport at a rate close to cost of one taxi ride (and we would have needed 2). Overall a great experience!

<Author>schneije
<Content>Gem in a Non-Touristy Area We booked based on online reviews alone and were not disappointed. I like to find places that are not full of your typical tourists and most people don't know about this place. We got great service, a great view, a terrific location and a few other things that are unusual for big city hotels (e.g., the pillow menu and the emphasis on physical/health activities). I was told that visiting professional sports teams often stay here and that there is a private gym in the building for them. I can see why -- nice accommodations and privacy out of the prying eyes (mostly) of tourists. I want to stay here again.

<Author>CosmoSanDiego
<Content>Great stay at the Affinia First trip to New York with my husband and 3 young boys. We had a fantastic time and really enjoyed our stay. The beds were really comfortable. We used the kitchen a lot and we were able to bring leftovers from Grimaldi's in Brooklyn and eat it the next day. The Murray Hill Market on the corner has a great deli. We would buy omletes and pancakes for breakfast and eat in our room. The suite even had a dishwasher and stove plus the refrigerator.  Everyone that worked there was very friendly and helpful. If I requested anything it was taken care of right a way. I have had to wait more than an hour at other hotels for a pillow or anything else. It was clean and we felt safe walking around the hotel. The doormen were very, very nice to my boys. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Grand Central Station and there is also a subway station up the street. We would definitely stay at the Affinia again. It was perfect for a family with young children.

<Author>moeflip
<Content>Would stay at the Affinia Dumont again and again I stayed at the Affinia Dumont over the weekend of 6/28  6/29 2008 with my two daughters, ages 12  18. We all loved it. Staff was great, we had a corner room on the 36th floor with a spectacular view of the East River. Very clean. The only fly in our proverbal ointment was a broken very large balloon shade. A staff member safety pinned it in an up position as to not impede our view. We would stay again, in a heart beat.

<Author>Hopwoodc
<Content>Good hotel, great room, fantastic view, friendly staff This is a good hotel in a good location.Stayed in a studio suite for 4 days (20th/06 - 24th/06) on the 27th floor and the room was large, clean, well equipped and the staff very friendly. Had a fantastic view of the city .It's a little expensive (although isn't everything in NYC)!A great gym and use of the sauna in the spa in a nice touch.My only comments for improvement would be as follows: Check in - problematic. Was checked in, only to be given the key for an occupied room. When we did eventually get an unoccupied room we were disturbed approx. 3 times in the 1st 30 mins by various staff wanting to check the room (which was frustrating as we were napping after a long haul flight). On the 4th knock we asked the person to come back later to be told 'I haven't checked the mini bar so if you get charged it's not my fault' - hardly professional (plus this should have been carried out BEFORE we were checked in)!So I would say there are a few area's for improvement. But on the whole very good.

<Author>HoneyBunny811
<Content>Very Nice Hotel We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was located at the front door, away from the sleeping area of the room. The hotel is on 34th Street, so you're not right in Times Square or the Theatre District, but we enjoy walking so it wasn't a big deal. We throughly enjoyed our stay at the Affinia Dumont.

<Author>sleepladypalmdesert
<Content>Another great stay The Affinia Dumont was once again a wonderful facility for our 6 night New York visit. My 22 year old daughter and I requested a high floor with view of Chrysler Bldg. We arrived late and our room was ready as requested. The pillow menu is wonderful. I selected the Swedish temperpeudic and my daughter fluffy down pillows. The bed is very comfortable. The best part for me is the location. It is in a fairly quiet part of the city in Murray Hill. The 6 subway is just a short 2 block walk which takes you past a Starbucks. Empire State Building is easy walking distance as is Macys. The Murray Hill Market is right next door for those breakfast items and to pick up things for the room. A full kitchenette is in each room, so it is very handy to keep things fresh. Of course we would never cook while on vacation...being able to keep fresh juice, milk, half and half...perfect. I can't say enough about the staff. The doormen and desk staff are wonderful. They warmly welcome you back each time you arrive. Iced cold iced tea and fresh fruit are available at the front desk which is so nice after long walks around the city. For the price this is a great deal for New York as far as room size and facility. I call the Affinia Dumont my New York home.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2008

<Author>LoTr1985
<Content>Terribly Overrated I picked the Affinia Dumont for our party (4) because I had read the reviews and had seen such terrific compliments. In fact, I recommended it to people based on what I'd seen on this site. There ended up being several people from our group who stayed there b/c of what I'd seen on TripAdvisor. I had never been to NYC before and was looking forward to staying in a quality, smoke-free hotel that (apparently) had great service. What a disappointment!The disappointment started right off the bat when we were put into a room that was obviously not used very much (on the 3rd floor) even though we checked in early and stated that we would be willing to wait for something to open up so we could get a decent room. We had booked this hotel months in advance and had asked repeatedly for a nice room with a view. We didn't get that. The view I could live w/out but I expected a nice hotel room. The room we were given was musty and moldy smelling and it had a horrendous view of apartment buildings in the back. That wasn't too bad until I found out that several other people staying in the hotel had booked after we did, had the same # of people in their party, and got a great room. Didn't make me happy. Because of the mold and must, two of us ended up getting incredibly sick and were coughing throughout the entire weekend.During our stay, we had the toilet break down and it wasn't fixed until the next afternoon and only until after we'd called twice in the morning to see if it was going to get fixed, after being told that maintenace apparently doesn't have any type of emergency service after business hours. So we went all night w/out a working toilet. 4 women sharing a toilet that didn't work for over 24 hours? Not good. I ended up using someone else's bathroom on the next floor up.We also asked repeatedly for extra towels and blankets and had to keep calling and asking to get them. If they were having trouble finding these items, all they had to do was say that the hotel was booked solid and that they were looking. The front desk just kept telling us that they were contacting housekeeping as though they'd forgotten that we'd just called 10 minutes earlier.One of my roommates also had significant trouble with her internet and called twice to try and get it sorted out. Everytime she tried to bring up the internet, it kept asking her for credit card information all though she had already given it and her 24 hours wasn't even close to being done (same day). This hotel is getting five star reviews and all I can say is that I hope that those people were/are being treated better than we were and that they get a room that is actually used. I won't be staying @ this hotel again.  
<Date>Jun 24, 2008

<Author>Neil_Cooper
<Content>Fantastic Hotel This was our first trip to New York and like so many other people used Trip Advisor to decide where to stay. We weren't disappointed as on arrival we were shown to our suite on the 33rd floor where the views were just astounding. The room was huge with a king size bed plentiful on-suite bathroom, sofas, an office desk plus a kitchen. The room was very clean and tidy which is what you'de expect from a hotel of this calibre. The staff were very friendly and helpful when requesting directions or ideas. The Affinia Dumont is in a super location, on East 34th Street within easy walking distance of the Empire State Building and Macy. The Barking Dog restaurant next door is a perfect place for breakfast lunch or dinner as we had all 3 at some point during our stay and enjoyed each one.I had let the hotel know in advance that it was my wifes 40th birthday treat and on arrival found a complimentary card and cake in the room which was a lovely touch.We would definitely stay at the Affinia Dumont again and fully intend too when we return in a couple of years time

<Author>gglg
<Content>Highly recommend this hotel The hotel on 34th St is located a short walk from the Empire State Building and Macy's. Penn station is a few blocks away. The junior suite overlooking 34th St was very clean, well maintained and spacious with good quality fittings and furniture including living room space, office desk, phone/fax and computer facilities. There is plentiful wardrobe space and an in-room safe for valuables. The bathroom (good size) and kitchenette were well appointed and the king bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel does not have a dining room facility but a small restaurant bar is located directly next door. There is a mini market, supermarket and laundry facility if you need these nearby. A number of good quality, reasonably priced restaurants and bars are a short walk away in and around 3rd Avenue. Ethos (Greek) or Hudsons Restaurant and Bar are recommended. We booked directly through the hotel website and paid in advance receiving the best available rate. The hotel was ideal for a six night stay in New York and we would certainly stay at the Affinia Dumont again.  
<Date>Jun 21, 2008

<Author>Stark71
<Content>Affinia Dumont - Short Review To confirm previous guests experiences. Staff were helpful - moved us up the the 34th floor once a room was available. <Author>fc1
<Content>Great place! The Affinia Dumont is a great base in New York. It's a tiny bit off the beaten track and in an area that, in countless trips to NYC, I hadn't been to before. This didn't detract from our experience at all - in fact it was great seeing a new bit of the city. The Affinia Dumont is a few minutes from the Hudson River and about 10-15 mins stroll in a straight line to Macy's and the Empire State. Since it's in mid-town it's perfectly located if you want to go either downtown to the Village or uptown to Central Park and the shops at the top of 5th Avenue - both are a relatively cheap cab ride away. My biggest recommendation is to stay local for breakfast though. When we first arrived we staggered out to find somewhere to eat and stumbled across Penelopes, the cutest little cafe/diner a few blocks away (turn left out of the Affinia, left at the top of the road and it's on the corner of 32nd or 33rd). Go early or late for breakfast at the weekends because it fills up FAST but don't miss the nutella french toast and definitely throw the diet out for a night and try a burger for dinner, one of the best I've ever had...Back to the hotel - beds are SUPER comfy, the size of the room is great, bathroom is all you'd expect with lots of lovely towels, on-site gym is a really great bonus and staff are very helpful (we asked for a cot for my niece and, unlike in some other hotels we looked at, were told that this was no problem at no cost). Ask for a room on one of the top floors and get a fabulous view of the Hudson at night too.My only gripe with the Affinia is that I turned 30 while I was there and my dad had read that they treat you to a cake on your birthday and mentioned it in advance. Thankfully I didn't know this so didn't expect anything but no cake ever appeared so don't expect one if you too have also read about it and go to NYC for your birthday!  
<Date>Jun 17, 2008

<Author>KIMBAMarino_Dublin
<Content>Comfort and Convenience - Affinia has it all After much research via tripadvisor reviews and the tripadvisor forums which are great for finding information, reviewed over a period of a few months, I finally settled on the Affinia Dumont. True to other people's reviews it truly was a nice, comfortable and central hotel in New York City. We stayed here May 4th to May 10th. Prior to arriving I telephoned the hotel to request a floor change to a higher floor, and because of the professional manner of the reservation person dealing with my request I felt reassured and was looking forward to my trip . I was delighted to receive a room on the 35th floor, overlooking 34th street, with of view of the Chrysler building. With time difference we awoke the first morning at 5am to a fantastic sunrise.we booked a one bedroomed suite, myself, husband and 14yr old daughter. Glad we done this as my daughter was able to go to bed whilst we stayed up to watch TV.Beds are extremely comfortable and very large. Not enough clothes hangers though. There is also full size ironing board and iron, plus a laundry service available. No teapot, or kettle but you could boil a pot of water on the full size cooker. Suggest you bring a small teapot with you if you like to make tea. Coffee maker was great with coffee replenished each day by the maid. And daily newspaper left on door handle each morning was nice. I also asked reception for a bath rubber slip mat which was delivered promtly within 10 minutes to our room. Yes decor is alittle dark - browns and creams but no damaged furniture, or torn wallpaper so overall to me rooms are fine. But I am not into hotels with flamboyant colours and retro furniture. We paid approximately $350 more over the full week for the one bedroom which was well worth the extra. And compared to other hotels the prices are average for the Affinia Dumont. I compared many hotels using TA prior to my decision.Staff:Friendly and doorman advised us to watch our backpacks especially around Times Square. My phone charger would not work there and a Manageress, I think her name was Grace brought me to the basement area and found a charger for my phone which I returned on leaving at no extra cost. This was very much appreciated by me.Would definitely consider returning to Affinia Dumont again. Hope to get back next year.  
<Date>Jun 16, 2008

<Author>kmiller1k
<Content>Nice Hotel in Midtown Location Stayed here with two girlfriends for our stay in NYC. We chose the Dumont based on reviews on Tripadvisor and weren't disappointed. The room was large as was the bathroom. The small kitchen was a nice amenity. We ate at the Barking Dog resturant a couple times for breakfast and dinner and was very happy with the food and service. Nice to have the little market next door as well. Hotel is one block from the Green Line subway and walking distance to Macy's. This is a great location in midtown in the Murray Hill neighborhood.My next trip I will stay in the Upper East side as it is where all the museums are and Second Ave restaurants.However, highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a midtown property in NYC.

<Author>Corry8
<Content>Great Staff - Hotel OK. We booked the Affinia Dumont after reading the reviews on this site, and we were expecting to give it another five star rating. After staying there for our long weekend, we just don't think it deserves it though.Yes the staff are absolutely outstanding and do everything they can to make your stay perfect. For instance we'd requested a high floor room which of course can't be guaranteed and unfortunately we were given a room on a lower floor. The staff were happy to move us next day and we spent the rest of the stay on the 28th floor. The lads on the door remember you and always had a smile.Reception always had fruit juice available and also morning coffee.But we just thought our doubled bed studio was just ok. Yes it was large with plenty of space for our clothes, but is it any better than a British Lodge/Inn? We didn't think so. We've stayed in rooms which were cleaner and these days most hotels give you free internet service - the Dumont charges $10.My only explanation for all the 5* ratings is perhaps, if you need a room for four people or a seperate lounge and bedroom, then this could be the place for you. If you are a couple just looking for a room, perhaps you might find something better/cheaper.  
<Date>Jun 9, 2008

<Content>Thank you for the view We have just returned from a stay in New York and would like to thank the Affinia Dumont Hotel for a wonderful stay. The position of the hotel was ideal providing easy walking to the Empire State Building ( 5 mins ) Macys ( 10 mins ) and Times Square ( 20 mins ) and superb subway links throughout Manhattan. Thank you to all the staff for a fantastic stay in your wonderful city!!!

<Author>dinanicj
<Content>Big rooms, great location, bad reservations / room booking experience My family spent a weekend at the Affinia Dumont. The rooms are big and the location central, though the hotel completely messed up my family's reservation by guaranteeing (in writing) one room-type then not having it available when I got there. Of course, I was traveling with 4 people and they ended up putting us in a room with 1 bed and a pull-out couch. I was very upset and it put a blemish on our weekend. Initially they didn't seem to feel bad but after I expressed extreme disappointment they did apologize.I also had been very impressed when making my reservation that they provided many options - you could reserve a crib, your pillow type - all sorts of preferences - NONE of them were in the system when I got there! So, word of caution - double confirm your reservation!!!While the rooms are huge and the location is great, the rooms however, are a bit tired around the edges (the carpets are a bit worn, etc.), but, they are so big that I can live with that. But, at some point soon they will need to attend to details.I'd consider going back, but I'd first do a price comparison vs. other Affinia hotels in the midtown and uptown areas and I'd consider trying one of their other properties first.  
<Date>Jun 5, 2008

<Author>ScotsThistle
<Content>Best Hotel Ever! My Husband and i stayed for 4 nights in a Junior Suite on the 37th floor! The room was the best in the hotel as it had views of the Chrysler building from one window and views over the river to rooklyn and Queens from the other! Amazing to see the views everyday and watch everything light up in the evening! Candace Cortez who works at the hotel organised the room for us and also a bottle of champagne which I requested was waiting in our room on arrival on ice! There are loads of restaurants within walking distance. We tried Blockheads mexican restaurant which was nice and not expensive. We also ate at El Ciro (Think thats the name!) italian restaurant just round the corner from hotel which had lovely pizzas. The Murray Hill market next to the hotel was very good for drinks , snacks etc to keep in your fridge. We would recommend this hotel and would def stay here again if we go back to NY which I hope we do as it is a wonderful city! Thanks again to Candace.

<Author>HeckyBoy
<Content>Fantastic Place, Fantastic Location, Fantastic Staff We stayed at the Affinia Dumont from 15th to 18th May in Room 3103. After requesting a view of the Chrysler Building from a high floor, we were not to be disappointed and had spectacular views of the building. We could also see the Hudson River which was a bonus. If it hadn't been for previous reviews on Trip Advisor we wouldn't have requested this room and would have missed out on a treat. We were also left a complimentary bottle of wine which I presume was down to us celebrating Birthdays / Wedding Anniversary while we were there.From a location point of view, it couldn't have been better. 10 mins walk and you could be at Grand Central Station in one direction or virtually Times Square in another. The Empire State Building was only a 5 minute walk along 34th Street. We didn't go up the Empire State and elected to go for the Top of the Rock - this was only a 10-15 minute walk away and didn't have the horrendous lines the EPS had - it also gave a fantastic view of the empire state itself and great views of Central Park.Everything within the Hotel was great and the front desk staff were genuinely friendly and made you feel wanted from the moment you stepped foot in the place (larger chains should take note)This was our first stay in NYC and we loved the place. We do want to return next year and on the basis of this visit would only consider booking the Dumont.

<Content>Well worth it! My husband and I stopped at this hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of it. <Content>Truly Enjoyed - Great Boutique Hotel This a great boutique hotel. I would say a solid four star. The rooms are nice size. <Author>KeelyEdwards
<Content>Great hotel outside the bustle of the city New York was the last stop of our three city tour. After opting for cheaper accommodations in Boston and Washington, we (two couples, no children) were happy to spend a little bit more money in New York for a comfortable hotel. The Affinia Dumont hotel was lovely and we were very happy with our choice. Our rooms were massive - bigger than some studio flats I've lived in and nicer than some 5 star hotels I've stayed in - with kitchen (oven, microwave, coffee maker, crockery, cuttlery, glasses), bathroom and comfortable chairs to lounge on. The room service food and drink comes from the restaurant/bar adjacent to the hotel and was reasonably priced.The hotel takes an interest in health and comfort and so offers free lemonade and fresh fruit in reception, and a selection of different pillows are available. There is a spa in the hotel, but with only three nights in New York and so much to do and see, we didn't have time to use it.Although there is no breakfast provided at the hotel, there is a lovely diner round the corner from it on 33rd and Lexington (Murray Hill Diner I think). For those of you who can't eat a big fried breakfast in the morning, try the cinammon toast.Location is usually the most important factor when I select a hotel, but this time I opted for the quality vs cost instead, so the hotel was a little more out of the centre of the city than I'd usually go for. However the area surrounding the hotel was nice and it felt safe to walk around without the hustle and bustle of Times Square and the likes. It is only a few blocks from the Chrysler Building, and a few more blocks again from Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building. Although further than that, you might want to consider a taxi or the underground.Our room was 12 floors up and we could hear still hear the street traffic, although as we were very busy during the days, it didn't keep us awake for long. The other couple on the 17th floor couldn't hear anything.Travel hint - there is only one boat tour company allowed to land on Liberty and Ellis islands and tickets sell out so look to buy in advance before you go to avoid disappointment and print out the internet voucher they send you. You can buy tickets for just transport to the islands, or you can add a monument tour (the base that the Statue of Liberty stands on) and/or an audio tour. If you opt for both tours, I recommend catching the first boat out in the morning and head straight for the monument tour when you land otherwise you'll spend a long time in queues. The audio tour for Ellis island is handy as it directs you around the building and saves you having to read the masses of information dotted around the place.  
<Date>May 28, 2008

<Author>DMMBH
<Content>Over rated Travelled from UK to Orlando for a wedding and then on to NYork for 4 nights stay at the Affinia Dumont with my Parents - their first time in the States.On arriving at reception the girls were friendly but not warm, one girl asked me 3 times was this my first time staying at the hotel!! Had booked direct months in advance and had requested quiet rooms on high floors. My Parents got a room on the 4th floor and our room was on the 14th floor. The rooms were huge which was a plus but no way near quiet. After the first night I suggested to my Parents that they move rooms but they didn't want the upheaval of it all.On the third night there were road works all through the night directly outside the hotel. We complained the next morning and we received apologies and were asked if we would like a free breakfast which we declined as we had already eaten.The hotel is expensive for what you get. I agree it is in a good location within walking distance to Empire and Macys which was great, but the little extras that you needed to pay for were silly. I also agree that there should be no charge for use of the internet when most other hotels offer this service for free.I had a look at the Spa prices which I thought were high but then some people are obviously happy to pay.When checking out of the hotel I spoke with a really nice guy who was very helpful, I mentioned to him that we were not happy about the noise and he give us a $100 discount between the 4 of us.Overall, the hotel was nice but not good value for money.Myself and my Husband are returning to New York with 6 friends and we won't be staying at the Affinia. I really don't know what all the hype is about!!!

<Author>ispeakbelgianese
<Content>Nice stay, but neither fitness nor luxury, some rough edges The hype of this hotel is totally lost on me. Don't get me wrong, the hotel was nice and rather warm and pleasant for its size (though not particularly memorable) and fairly well-located. Perhaps I was wrong to assume that the service would be a cut above other chains or perhaps we were just a bit unlucky, but the little things did add up for us:- it was raining so we asked the bellhop to hail us a cab for five (e.g. the Toyota vans, but a lot of Escapes and even Crown Victorias will do it, too). He simply said no, without explanation. We then asked him to call one for us, he again said no, then walked away. We just hailed it ourselves then. (To be fair, in the same situation the next day, the other bellhop was very nice and got us a cab for five in less than a minute)- we chose the hotel partly because two people in our party were preparing for a marathon. The complimentary running kit advertised on their web site and on the night stand was eagerly awaited, but eventually none were available during our entire 4-day stay. This kit, among other things, consisted of such things like a wet towel upon arrival, stretch bands, a NYC running map, etc. Even if you run out of such things, at least they could have procured more or assembled part of the kit. Instead, they told us to try again tomorrow (until tomorrow became the day we checked out) For a hotel that labels itself fitness, I don't find this acceptable.- despite a specific request in the online reservation and calling ahead to confirm, the sofa bed was not made up and we eventually had to request that they prepare it after arriving at night.- the shower changed temperatures from hot to cold and vice versa continuously, so you had to change the setting constantly to make sure not to freeze/burn. Very low water pressure also (OK, I'll sacrifice something for the 30th floor view)- I had authorized another member of my party to check in before me, and when I called the hotel to see if he had arrived, they said no; he ended up waiting for me for two hours because he had in fact arrived already.- Lastly, any hotel that still charges for wireless internet doesn't fully merit a five-star rating in my opinion. At least most chains (e.g. Westin) will give you free use of the business center internet or lobby internet when they charge for in-room access, but not even that at the Affinia Dumont. I don't understand how hotels can seem so committed to the customer's experience yet charge for something so basic. The result is we didn't use the Internet (a minor inconvenience) and the hotel didn't make any money from us, they only inconvenienced us a bit. Same deal for the $7 water bottles in the room.Again, these are small things, but to be worthy of such high tripadvisor rankings/awards and rates around $500 (even in NYC), you have to do better than what we experienced at the Affinia Dumont. I can think of a few other hotels like the Sofitel and even the Tower level of the (Ramada) New Yorker where I've had better stays in the same/lower price category.To end on a more positive note, my favorite parts were the view from the 30th floor (no complaints there, gorgeous Chrysler building views) and the generally helpful staff (e.g. when we wanted a vase on Mother's Day, it was brought to the room immediately). It was also nice that we had a mini-kitchen with a big fridge in the room.I guess my two cents are that the Affinia is a pretty good choice for a city hotel, but there are a range of other options out there, too!  
<Date>May 20, 2008

<Author>Winegirl921
<Content>Always a great stay! I frequently visit NY for business and always make it a point to stay at the Dumont whenever possible. By NYC standards the rooms are very spacious and the staff is always extremely helpful. I always sleep very well in the comfortable beds and enjoy the selection of pillows they have to offer. The gym is large for a hotel (have not been to the spa) and the Barking Dog downstairs is always a sure bet for a decent meal at a reasonable price. The hotel is convenient to the subway and 3rd avenue has a great selection of restaurants.If you are a light sleeper I would recommend requesting a room on a high floor, as the street noise can often be a nuisance.

<Author>Benjii
<Content>Room with a view! Stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 5 days at the end of April 2008. I haunted the forums of trip advisor for months trying to choose the right hotel and I wasn't disappointed! It was hard decision choosing a hotel as we had a decent budget and we found that there wasn't allot in it price wise for the top rated hotels-except the Affinia it was the only one that offered a significant saving on the others which swayed us! We booked direct and they also offer non-refundable rates which offer even greater savings. We'd requested a room on a high floor with a view of the Chrysler building which we got. Wow what a view! Walking into the room and seeing that view is just something I'll never forget. The rooms are large and very comfortable. The bed was large and comfy and the kitchen was an added bonus having coffee making facilities. Although we never cooked in there the fridge was handy and the ability to have a quick slice of toast with your coffee first thing was also great! As others have said this hotel isn't opulent but it doesn't charge rates which reflect this either. To be honest it was as nice as the rooms in which we stayed at in 5* hotels in Las Vegas later in our trip. We have very little interaction with staff in general on our holidays unless we have a problem which we never did however all the staff from the doormen to the cleaners were friendly. the location of the hotel is quite residential with the barking dog next door which do breakfast lunch and dinner all at a good price and I found the quality good/expectable for what you paid. There is a little market next door too where you can get milk, wine, etc if you like. There are a couple of dinners close by too and bars and restaurants close by if you don't want to stray far. There is a subway stop about 5 mins from the hotel and this was our preferred method of getting around the city. The ESB is about 10 minutes walk away and Flatiron another 5 mins away. To me the location wouldn't be important to me if I returned as everywhere is accessible and you're never going to be close to everything. The Times Square area would be the only area that I wouldn't be interested in staying in and around just not my scene. This is a great hotel, my favourite thing was the view and if I were to return to NY I'd certainly check the rates for the Affinia and stay again!  
<Date>May 15, 2008

<Author>Ciskey
<Content>Affinia Dumont is THE place to go!!! We had a great stay at the Affinia Dumont: 4 nights in April and 2 nights on our way back in May. We had room 3606 both times (thank you Affinia Dumont staff!!!), which had a great view almost all around because it's a cornerroom (2 double beds studio). We had more than enough space, while travelling with 2 adults and 2 children. The children loved the sound pillows! Check in was quick, our suitcases were brought to our room immediately. we ate breakfast at Guy and Guillard on our way to Macy's. Almost next to the hotel (first corner) is one small store of them but if you just walk a little further towards Macy's there is a bigger Guy and G. This one we liked more. If you like eating sushi or Teppan Yaki you just have to go to Aji Sushi. Just cross the street from the hotel to Duane Reed (convenient to buy some drinks) . It;s just 2 minute walk from the hotel and we ate our best sushi ever!!! It was our first time in NYC and we liked it very very much. The view from the other side of the Brooklyn bridge is AWESOME! To see the Manhattan skyline this way impressed the 4 of us. NYC was much more appealing to me than I thought it would. Felt safe and secure and just love to shop in the big city. On our way back we had too much luggage to fit in a taxi. We got an offer through the bell boy to go by limousine for USD85 including taxes and tip to JFK. Cheaper than 2 taxis and WOW, what a nice closure of our fantastic stay in the big city. I can't wait to go back to NYC and we'll definately will stay at the Affinia Dumont again: great staff, beautifull luxury room and great location!  
<Date>May 14, 2008

<Author>lovestotravelHouston
<Content>We were "WOWED" This trip was for myself and my 2 daughters-in-law. I have traveled to many places in the world and stayed at many 5 star hotels. The budget did not allow for that this time. The location of the hotel, the price and the fact that I could get a room with 2 queen beds was extremely important to me. Most NYC hotels have very small rooms, let alone suites with a kitchen for the price of this hotel room. I did weeks of research online and selected this hotel based on your website and reviews of the hotel on other travel websites. When we arrived we were first shown to a room with a king size bed, when I had reserved a room with 2 queen beds. The problem was immediately solved and we were shown to a suite with a wonderful view of the Chrysler Building. I must say that all three of us were wowed by our room, the view, and the friendliness of the staff. Having a seperate living room, bedroom, and fully equiped kitchenette was priceless. Alex our bellman and Donald the doorman were always friendly and helpful. We looked forward to the lavender scent that greeted us when we entered the hotel lobby. It was very uplifting after a long day of wandering around the city. We loved the location of the hotel, the neighborhood and the many little stores nearby. Anything we wanted or needed was within a block from the hotel. Even though the weather for the first few days of our trip was dreary and cold, the hotel was warm and welcoming. Sure, you could hear some honking horns and sirens at night, but come on, this is New York CIty. The spaciousness of our suite made us feel very at home. If we are lucky enough to return to NYC in the future we will definately stay at this hotel.  
<Date>May 8, 2008

<Author>bassisland
<Content>Love the Affinia Dumont I was placed at the Affinia Dumont by the company I was working for in New York for two weeks. I hadn't heard of it, though I lived for many years in Manhattan. I LOVED the hotel. The service is as good as it gets in the U.S.---and not the fake attitude of service that a lot of pricey places try to substitute for the real thing. The staff at the Affinia Dumont all delivered wonderful, cheerful, genuinely helpful service. Our suite was cozy, well appointed, had real separation between the rooms, and a perfect little kitchen. Right next door and across the street are delis and sandwich shops so it's easy to stock the kitchen if you like. The fitness center has plenty of machines, and supplies headphones for the TVs that are on all the treadmills and elliptical machines. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get everywhere in the city from there---lots of cabs in the neighborhood. We were on a high floor and it was quite quiet. I would stay there again any time. A pleasant surprise.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2008

<Author>DavidCon
<Content>Nice BIG rooms We've just arrived back from a short trip to NY and stayed 3 nights at the Affinia Dumont.We selected the hotel based purely on TripAdvisor reviews and have not been let down. The location is very good (Lexington and 34th) so everything is quite close by and check in was painless (although it did look a little busy in the morning). We had 2 studio rooms (one with king bed and one with two queens) and the rooms were huge in comparison to a typical NY hotel. To my surprise they also had a fully functional kitchen which was great if you want to eat in for breakfast/dinner.Admittedly the rooms did look a little dated (regualr TV vs plasma and a typical 'hotel' style carpet) but they were clean, the beds were very comfortable and there's a choice of 6 pillows! You even got mouthwash in the bathroom which was a first for me and a must after a big night out. Saying that if you are looking for a hotel with a wow factor I wouldn't say this is the one for you.The Affinia is billed as a fitness style hotel and I was able to order my yoga and running pack for working out. I believe you can get a free training session from monday to friday but I couldn't as it was the weekend. One word of advice- the hotel was listed as sold out on expedia so I called and booked direct and got a good rate.All in all a nice stay- I'd go back for sure.  
<Date>Apr 30, 2008

<Author>jtemple12
<Content>Great location for walking around Manhattan Great hotel - we stayed 3 nights April 2008.The hotel staff were the friendliest we've encountered in years - we got a free upgrade to a suite overlooking the East River. They also recommended several restaurants that were superb (try Il Cortile in Little Italy).The rooms are clean, well equipped and spacious. The heating/aircon systems could do with a bit of maintenance and the bathrooms are ready to be refurbished but the overall package is good value for money based on the hotel location. There is a mini mart (Murray Hill) almost next door so you can keep the fridge well stocked.We walked to Central Park (45 mins) so you don't need a cab for most of the main sights - Times Square, Grand Central and 5th Avenue shops are all less than 30 min walk.

<Author>jonandam
<Content>3 nights in April - a bit dissappointed;-( After reading all the reviews we thought this sounded ideal and didn't mind paying that little bit more for it. The location was excellent and the people working there were great, very helpful but the room itself was very tired looking. We had a 2 bed queen suite on the 23rd floor but the wall paper was patched, and the kitchen was old and tired. Definately not luxury by any stretch of the imagination.Although coffee was free, everything else was charged (including $7 for a bottle of water) but there are some nice little deli's nearby so just make sure you take your own water!They are very geared up to fitness, which as tourists was not what we were looking for.The room was a goodsize and was clean but could do with redecorating and freshening up. After spending two weeks travelling around the states this was the most dissappointing of all the hotels we stayed in, including JFK airport hotels at $150 less per night.

<Author>CatherineSurrey
<Content>Little gem in the centre of Manhattan On TA advice, I sepent 4 nights at this hotel with my teenage daughter. Although there had been a problem with my initial booking for the first night (we had a floor on only 11th floor in spite of my request for a high floor room), for our 2nd and subsequent nights we had a room on 34th floor. At night it was just wonderful - fab views of NYC including our favourite, the Chrysler Building.The rooms have fully equipped kitchens so that you can buy breakfast foods and eat at the hotel before sight-seeing - very useful if you are trying to avoid enormous American breakfasts.The location of the hotel is superb , turn left out of hotel, 10 minutes walk to Macy's, Gap, Old Navy, Hennes etc and the heart of NY shopping, turn left for good restaurants. Lots of good small restaurants and dinersin the area. Easy to walk everywhere from the hotel, subway 7 minutes walk. All felt v.safe. Staff at hotel nice and helpful - offering good advice and annotated maps.Really a great hotel, we'll be back, as Arnie says.

<Author>glenthornEnfield
<Content>simply the best Stayed for 5 nights and it lived up to the reviews on tripadvisor(i checked tripadvisor before i booked it). We stayed on the top floor 37th and wow what a view. Im scared of hights, but i wasnt in the room or looking out of the windows. The size of the room was enormous the room service was excellent and the staff were really helpfull and friendly and always had a smile for you. The barking dog next door was really nice although i warn you one plate would feed two of you. If you want a good steak go to the Rare Grill in Murry Hill (ask for directions its a five minute walk) the food is fantastic and try the cowboy steak, its the best steak we have ever tasted. Macys is 10 minutes walk away and well priced, Bloomingdales worth a visit but a bit pricey, Century 21 is great for mens clothes but not womens although the bags, belts are good. One department store that i have never seen advertised (and should be) is Lord and Taylor on 5th Avenue, a few blocks away. Fantastic and well priced like Macys. Hop on Hop off bus is great, if you buy the ticket off one of the touts its fine but they tell you the 48 hours start when you get the first bus, its not, its when you buy the ticket. We will definatly stay at the Affinia Dumont when we return to new york.

<Author>ChesterT_40
<Content>Lovely hotel exactly as described Just stayed at Affinia Dumont for three nights 11-14th of April, fantastic! First time in New York to celebrate my husbands 40th and can't wait to return! Like many others we booked the Affinia Dumont because of the reviews. Hotel is exactly as described, no surprises all good! Arrived early evening shattered after delay with Virgin. Reception very quick and efficient, made us feel relaxed and at home straight away, gave us keys and maps and information. We had a one bedroomed suite on the 32 floor, I had asked for a very quiet room as was worried about sleeping and that's what we got, all that could be heard were the distant sounds of the sirens, no noise from any other room and they were occupied. This was a surprise trip and had told my husband to expect a small room (the norm for NY hotels so I am informed). He was amazed when we entered our suite, large room with sofa, two chairs, desk, tv, midi system, books, mini bar snacks etc. Small but very adequate kitchen inc. dishwasher, coffee maker with free coffee! Microwave, toaster, oven and hob, full size fridge/freezer stocked with mini bar drinks, all the usual plates etc, everything you need! Separate bedroom with very comfortable huge bed and three lovely pillows (chosen from pillow menu). Bathroom good size, full bath and shower, sink and toilet, plenty of soft white fluffy towels and toiletries. The whole suite was immaculate, even the taps and grout, (I had read a lot about grotty bathrooms!) We were on the side/rear corner overlooking the East river, uninterrupted views! Beautiful to watch the sun rise before setting off for the busy streets! Ordered room service that night as late, huge pizza for 7, more than plenty for two adults.The hotel is situated in the lovely residential area of Murray Hill, with local diners including Barking Dog (really missing their food)! and markets (corner shops) with hundreds of beautiful fresh flowers for sale outside! This was the only place we saw this in NY and it added a sense of wellness and sophistication to the area. This is a lovely tranquil area to return to at the end of the day. Checking out is noon but as our flights were in the evening we checked out early and Affinia kindly stored our bags for the day, I knew that they offered this service free of charge from the other reviews, this gave us the whole of our last day free from luggage, we did see many people walking around with theirs! When we returned we had free use of the spa changing rooms/toilets to freshen up before leaving. They arranged a car to JFK for $65, taxi to the hotel had been $57, so it was very reasonable. Nothing was ever too much trouble for this hotel, the staff were always there for us. I know these reviews are read by the hotel, so thank you Affinia Dumont for a wonderful stay. Tracey T, Bournemouth, England.  
<Date>Apr 16, 2008

<Author>ILLINIFANChicago
<Content>Great Value in Midtown New York We stayed at the Affinia Dumont in January 2008 and had a very nice room on an upper floor which gave us views of the Chrysler Building and the East River. The rooms were large and comfortable - and even had a full kitchen. The pillow menu is a nice touch. For the price and location you cannot beat this hotel and we would stay there again.  Be aware that the Affinia Dumont is not really a luxury hotel (3 star max). There is no restaurant in the hotel - a real pain if the weather is bad and there was no concierge to assist us with dinner plans. The front desk did give us a list of the restaurants in the vicnity...but could not give any specific guidance.  
<Date>Apr 10, 2008

<Author>EssexStefan
<Content>Half century winner Stefan L from Essex writes:Have just returned from a five day break in NY with family including four sons and wife who celebrated her big 50 whilst away. Hotel and staff could not be faulted. Concierge and reception team just wanted to help in any way possible and yet still had time to chat with guests to make them feel special and welcome. Our three suites on 21, 33 and 35 floors were superb and large enough for our four sons to chill out en masse. Family used the gym whilst I explored the local Murray Hill facilities and shops(and the Barking Dog next door).Great location in quieter (if there is such a thing) part of Manhatten. Would recommend the baseball in Central Park on a Saturday afternoon for a restful hour in the sunshine. Visited Empire State Building late in the evening and no queues but still busy- a result. and a great view.Had special meal out booked at the Maze (Gordon Ramsay venue) which was really special but could not fault food anywhere including Chinatown and local tratorria just down the road. Local coffee and breakfast venues all brilliant.Will be returning to NY and will most certainly book to stay at the Affinia again. Thank you all.

<Author>WorcesterWoman
<Content>Good location We stayed for 5 nights in a one bed suite in March.Overall the hotel was very good - but it gets such amazing trip advisor reviews that I think it is difficult not to build up your expectations too much. It is a very comfortable hotel, extremely well situated and provides the facilities you need in your room. It is not however a truly luxurious hotel, and is in need of some updating / refurbishment. The suite was large - especially by NY standards. The kitchen was well equipped, and the sofa bed adequate for the children. The bathroom however was tiny - too small really for 4 people. We were a little disappointed on arrival at 1am local time to find that the sofa bed had not been made up for the children, despite my e-mail stating they would be with us. We had to wait with very tired children for sheets to be delivered, which were just handed to us with a comment that 'you know how to make up the bed' - housekeeping were unavailable, but this was not really the service level we had expected. Similarly there were only towels for 3 people in the bathroom - when clearly we were 4. Minor points, but illustrate that this is not the mega pampering service level some reviews would have you believe.We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfasts at the Barking Dog - and contrary to some reports felt they were very good value - $40 for people to eat huge amounts of pancakse, eggs, muffins etc seemed a great deal.The hotel lobby arranged a car back to the airport for us, which was no more expensive than getting to the hotel - a good service.Overall, I do think the hotel was a good choice, and may well stay there again, but just don't think people should go expecting everything to be absolutely amazing.  
<Date>Apr 9, 2008

<Author>bongokoala
<Content>Perfect stay! We arrived at the Affinia Dumont on 1st April after an uneventful flight with Virgin.We were slightly early for check in, but were given access to our room straight away, which was a nice touch. The room itself was lovely. On the 37th floor with views of the Chrysler Building. Must admit before we went I was a little nervous about being a little out of the action, but found that I relished the (relative) peace and quiet the hotel offered. Found everyone who worked at the hotel to be lovely and helpful. Even when asking random questions about locations of different shops etc. We got them to organise us a car to the airport at the end of our stay and this was $75, which I didn't think was bad. Only dissapointment was they tried to charge us for two movies which we didn't watch in the room. We didn't actually touch the pay for view part of the TV. This was resolved quickly and easily though. All in all a wonderful stay and if we were going back we would book it again without question.

<Author>deeaw
<Content>Lived up to the hype I picked this hotel because of its reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. First, great location - walking distance to Grand Central or Penn Station, Empire State Building and Times Square but still reasonably quiet for New York (there will be sirens at night wherever you are!). We were near the top (35th floor) and had an unbelievable view of the Chrysler building. Decor is a little 80s but rooms are huge, beds comfortable, everything worked and if we had been staying longer, mini kitchen would have been a plus. Gym is small but functional - ten or so machines of the treadmill, cross trainer, bike variety and similar number of Nautilus weight machines plus free weights. Reception friendly and helpful. Only complaint is that room service food was poor and staff in the Barking Dog seemed overworked. Not cheap for a hotel which Expedia rates as 3.5 star but we were only there for a couple of nights so wanted to splash out and didnt regret it. We had a two room suite and it looked just like the video tour on their website.

<Author>35cerd
<Content>A good place to stay Two adults and two boys, ages 11  13 spent 3 nights at the Affinia Dumon in March 2008. It was a nice experience. The hotel is in a nice area with grocery, delis, restaurants  a Starbucks a block up the street. Duane Reade drugstore is across the street. Empire SB is a few blocks up the street, and Times Square is a bit of a walk, but doable. Hotel lobby is fairly small and compact. We asked for an early check-in and a nice view and were told upon arrival that we could check in early but a nicer room with a view would be available in a couple of hours, which was fine with us. At the recommendation of the conceirge (all wonderful) we went around the corner to Patsy's for lunch. A great find: terrific pizza, outstanding salads, liquor license, Zagat rated. Another great spot a few doors up is Jackson Hole, a burger joint which is not to be missed. Enormous burgers with every topping imaginable. Liquor licence there too and I think there are a few of them in the city. Zagat rated too I think. We had a spacious corner room on the 23rd floor with a view of the East River-not the Chrysler Building but quite nice all the same. Comfortable beds and nicely appointed bathroom. The kitchen was basic with fridge, micro, stove, plates, etc. but only a sauce and fry pan, so don't expect to cook up a pasta dinner. I suspect these kitchenettes are designed for quick breakfasts and keeping beverages cold, which in the end suited us fine. We didn't use the gym or spa, but it was one of the most complete ones I've seen in any hotel. It's on the 2nd floor with windows looking out onto 34th St. My only suggestion to management would be that the in-room carpeting and hallways are not up to par with the overall hotel appointments. It looks like its good quality carpeting, it's just starting to look a bit worn. New carpeting would make the place sparkle!We would stay at the Dumont again. Nice location with large comfortable rooms.  
<Date>Apr 5, 2008

<Author>spiceylife
<Content>Great hotel, great location We stayed in the Affinia for 4 nights in March 2008 and can recommend its great location and practicality. We are a family of four and it was great to have a little kitchen (breakfast next door at the Barking Dog was a little steep) where we could have cereal in the morning, or get a sandwich from the great deli next door to have in the evening when we were exhausted from walking. The room was clean and good size although the bathroom was a little small. The gym was great - unfortunately, didn't get to use the spa. We had a problem with the heater which was noisy but someone came and shut it off for us. The location is great for sightseeing as it's pretty central and of course getting a cab is always easy. We were on the 18th floor but with all the other tall buidlings around it didn't seem high.

<Author>UkTim2008
<Content>Great hotel, really spacious Totally recommend this place for business or with family.I've stayed in maybe 10-15 NY hotels for business or with family. They seem to be in three types. 1) Ridiculous and expensive with 20 staff jostling to move your bag from one bellman to the next 2) Tiny, tiny rooms overlooking AC units. 3) The W type trendy ones where they have painted the tiny room purple and made the staff all wear hugo boss (but the rooms are still tiny!)I've now stayed at the Affinia around 5 times and it is great for business people who really just want a big modern room and helpful staff that act like real people. There are nice touches like fitness packs and welcome drinks, but really this hotel is just the perfect neutral space for a trip, where it all works, everyone is nice and you look forward to checking in.There is no restaurant, but in NY that is a definite non-issue as there are plenty of options around and the kitchen is well suited to juice and bagel type breakfasts.  
<Date>Apr 3, 2008

<Author>jimCincinnati_Ohio
<Content>A good value. We join others in praising this hotel. It is well maintained and the staff are friendly and helpful. Our double studio room was decently large for NY and had a very useful kitchen. The weekend AAA rate was $252 per night. The Murray Hill neighborhood has many good restaurants (Cosette's and DiCiro's especially) and is just far enough away from the theater district and the midtown glossies to give a sense of peace after returning from a visit to those locations. We are happy to recommend the Dumont to our friends.

<Author>DarVicBelfast
<Content>Great hotel and location We just returned from Affinia Dumont and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed for 4 nights before traveling to las vegas and then stayed again for 3 nights on returning from vegas. The hotel looked after our bags while we where in vegas which was a big help. The rooms are big and very clean with a nice little kichenette.The staff were great ,and very helpful and polite. It has a great gym and spa which are well worth a visit. The mini bar in the room is very expensive but why use it when there is a 24hour grocery store next door selling all you need. There is also a diner round the corner on 34th street which is great for breakfast any time off the dayThere is a tube station round the corner on 33rd street which will take you to grand central where you change for the time square shuttle all for $2 or you can walk. Maceys and other shops are only a 10 min walk from hotel.Great value for money as most hotel rooms in NYC are very small. Ask for a high floor as the views are fantastic. We got the 28th floor facing the chrysler building and what a view.On our next visit to NYC we will be staying here again.  
<Date>Apr 1, 2008

<Author>M_M_EBelfast
<Content>Perfect Hotel My family and I stayed in the Affinia Dumont on 150th  34th St from March 26 - 29th. The hotel is great. We had a suite with 2 queen beds, small kitchen, bathroom with a great shower, plenty of towels etc. The kitchen was equipped with coffee, washing liquid, microwave, Fridge and full cooker. Although we did not really use any of the kitchen facilities, except the fridge, it was convenient to have available.The staff were very helpful with good recommendations for nearby restaurants etc. The restaurant - the barking dog - beside the hotel has great food and is good vaule for both dinner and breakfast. The location beside Murray Hill was great with a subway just 5 mins walk. When I stayed in New York in 2002, I had stayed near Madison Sq Garden and I hated the noise from traffic etc. The Affinia Dumont is approx 15 mins walk to Madison Square Garden, but the difference in traffic noise, especially at night is greatly reduced and is a big plus.I would recommend this hotel for all types of singles, couples, families.I also used a limo service called Double Diamond in New Jersey for transport between Newark and Manhatten and would strongly recommend it for service and price. They are available through the web.
