<Author>Wedding06
<Content>All the reviews are right - this is a GREAT hotel I just wanted to say that I can completely understand why this is rated the #4 hotel in New York.We stayed here for 4 nights in mid-November.Pros -Staff:friendly and helpfulLocation:Absolutely fantastic - literally 5 mins to Empire States and MacysA 24 Deli right next door with ATM and great sandwiches, a 24hr pharmacy across the road. Great diner across the road (cinema cafe), restaurants and pubs literally on your door step. Plenty of cabs around whizzing past, so easy to hail one. I know most first time visitors want to stay in Times Square area, but I cannot stress enough how much better it is to stay in another less hectic area. In New York, everything is a taxi ride away. Here you are midtown, but well located to go both uptown and downtown. Times Square is great for a visit, but having stayed there before, I can definitely say this is far better - less noise, less manic, Times Square still within easy walking distance, or a 2 minute cab ride.Rooms:HUGE rooms- and we had the smallest type. 2 big queen beds, loads of room for suitcases etc, a desk area, kitchenette, large bathroom, these rooms were big by normal hotel standards not to mind New York. After staying previously in teeny rooms in NY, this was a pleasant surprise.Noise Level:This is New York and it was SO QUIET! couldn't believe it. we were on the 20th floor and could barely hear sirens etc. It was fantastic!!!!!Cleanliness:Hotel bathroom and rooms were spotless - no bad candid photos here as there were none to take Elevators:Never had to wait for themPillow Menu:This is really fun - you can choose what type of pillow you want. We tried the sound pillow..you plug in your ipod and there are tiny speakers in the pillow so you can listen to music as you sleep!Gym/Spa:We didn't use them but they're there for those who want themyou can also get massages etc in your room!Checking out:although we couldn't get a late check out as the hotel was full, they stored our luggage for the day, didn't mind when we took over the lobby packing and unpacking last minute shopping and then ordered a car for us to the airport. tip* get the hotel to order the car, we did and they sent a black stretch and we only had to pay $65 for it.Anyone considering staying here, feel free to contact me with questions. This really is a GREAT hotel, I will never stay anywhere else in New York.  
<Date>Nov 23, 2007

<Author>Mum0f2
<Content>Good Hotel Have just returned from my stay at Affinia Dumont. The hotel is in a great location, same street as Empire State and Macys. There is also a subway close too. There are a few places to eat around the hotel for a quick breakfast. On arrival at the hotel, the lobby smelt very clean and the staff at the desk helpful. The room itself (2903) was on a high floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building, large living room area, kitchen and bedroom with 2 queens. The bathroom was ok, my only gripe would be that the shower area and shower head were a bit grubby. However, this did not spoil my stay here as everything else was immaculate. The staff in particular, the doorman, were very helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel to others.

<Author>CCBMT
<Content>We'd definitely stay here again ...... We've literally just returned today from NY, staying in a suite on the 34th floor of the Affinia Dumont which we booked due to the great reviews read on Trip Advisor. We were absolutely delighted: Paul on the front desk checked us in and allocated us a fabulous corner suite with a view straight over to the Chrysler Building. All staff were really helpful, the gym (24hrs) was great, hotel location was superb: easy to get to the subway or just to walk right to the shops. Wear comfy shoes:it's amazing the distances you cover. The Barking Dog next to the hotel is great for breakfast (around $25 for two people) or to have an evening drink. Bed was huge and really comfy too made up with really good quality bed linen. There are a couple of grocery shops just up the road where you can get your basic provisions if you do book a suite with a kitchenette area. We didn't actually use the kitchen much but it was useful to have the option and we really felt the benefit of having the extra room space as we had quite a large lounge and study area too. We would definitely stay at the AD again. (Review by CCB + MT)

<Author>lisajbell
<Content>fantastic excellent bargain fab location friendly staff clean tidy Booked this hotel through last minute.com, arrived into New York and got a cab to the hotel took about 30 minutes.Greeted on arrival with ice teas and got straight up to our room,we booked a studio suite as there were 4 of us going only 3 came in the end.Walked in to a large open spacious room 2 huge queen beds, large desk and tv with chairs and side table.Lovely kitchen with a mini bar if you wanted to use it we just filled up the fridge with stuff from the corner shop.Bathroom was a great size with all sorts of stuff in the bathroom for you to use, coffee making facilities in the kitchen washing up liquid,cloths,tea towels all provided.Safe located in the wardrobe at no extra cost, iron, ironing board coat hangers lots of wardrobe and drawer space more than enough room for 3 of us.Lots of towels changed daily fab shower and bath too.Hotel lobby small but intimate with lots of sofas and coffee in the morning.Restaurant next door the barking dog did excellent food and sooo cheap too really good and you could have room service from them too.Located right by everything only 3 blocks too empire state building and 4 blocks to macys and victorias secret great amazing location for the price this hotel is a bargain.We decided too book a town car for getting back to the airport we left it kind of last minute we booked it the thursday night at 9pm but we were leaving the following morning at 4.30 am so only 7 hours notice it was $65 agreed over the phone and when it pulled up we got a huge white limo amazing great way to end the holiday.Staff couldnt do enough to help it was amazing and we will without a doubt be going back to this hotel.Thanks affinia dumont for making our holiday!!!!!

<Author>rmtn
<Content>Wonderful Hotel...Amazing Price!!! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! This was my 4th trip to NY, but the first with my family, so I was tasked with finding a mid-town NY hotel with a little bit of extra room. The studio bedroom was ENORMOUS my NYC standards. The room contained 2 queen beds (a 3rd queen would have easily fit), a desk (bigger than the VP's of the bank I work for), and a sitting chair and ottoman. The bathroom and kitchen was bigger than the ones I've seen in an average NYC apartment. The location was great too. There's a deli on the corner, Starbucks one block away, and a Duane Reade 2 blocks away. It's close to subway stops and taxis are plentiful.I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Battery Park and the Plaza Hotel, and neither comes close to the overall value and service of my experience at the Affinia. The staff is wonderful, whether its giving directions or finding last minute tickets to a show, they will stop at nothing to make sure you are satisfied.I did have a couple of billing issues, but both were resolved very quickly once I contacted the hotel.Great hotel for families or small groups of travelers who want to stay together.  
<Date>Nov 16, 2007

<Author>MattBatt
<Content>Great apart from minor points Agree with all the comments. Won't bother repeating the accurate info on the subway, deli next door, location in general - all excellent. Worth adding that a right turn out of the hotel and you have 3 or 4 excellent well priced restaurants within a minute's walk. One slight downer - booked on the hotel website and requested a high floor room. Also sent an e-mail to verify after reading all comments on this site. On check in was even asked if we preferred a high room; we said yes - but ended up on 13th floor without much of a view and with (generally tolerable - this is NYC) road noise. Also, the junior suite is described as having a separate sleeping area; in fact this means it's in a separate part of the same room; I had anticipated some sort of screening off to offer my sister and my wife and I privacy.Having picked up on the above, I'd definitely re-visit the Dumont for the location, the excellent staff attitude and the large room with comfortable beds. A gem.

<Author>O2BMi
<Content>Major screw-up resulted in much disappointment When we arrived at the Affinia Dumont, we found out that the room we reserved was not available. For my husband's birthday, I had made a non-refundable reservation via phone almost 2 months in advance of our trip for a 1BR suite w/2 queens. We had a15YO, 5YO, and toddler w/us. The man I spoke with via phone was very helpful, but the manager said he should not have told us that we could get 2 queens. The manager said they over-booked the rooms and we would have to get a king-sz bed with a pull-out sofa. This was a big problem - our toddler needs to sleep separately from people or he will be a terror. And he was, as a result of their screw-up. They tried to make up for it - better rate, free breakfast, the correct room on the following night that we wouldn't have to move our luggage to. It was not enough when the result was being kept up most of the night by a toddler  then our teen says she had the worst night sleep ever because of the uncomfortable sofa. We had to pack up our stuff - 45 mins of a waste of time (lots of stuff w/3 kids) - then they neglected to move our items to the new room. We learned that this over-booking situation happened to at least 1 other party. The 3 grown women (sisters) ended up sleeping in the same king-sz bed. There were other minor things. The new room was better, but we already had a sour taste in our mouth. Our massages were mediocre. On the plus side - the rooms were clean  relatively spacious, the beds/bedding were comfy, the amenities were nice, the bellmen were personable, and location decent.

<Author>clano76
<Content>great hotel, good location Stayed in the Dumont for 4 nights in late October. The staff are very pleasant and helpful, particularly the front desk. They organised tickets for us for an ice hockey game one night in Madison Sq garden.Rooms are very large by NY standards, very comfortable, clean and quiet. The bed in our junior suite was great to fall into after long days sightseeing and shopping. We were on the 13th floor (of 30-something) and were able to sleep no problems. To be fair it is probably not the noisiest area of Manhattan. We didnt go into the Barking Dog, after reading the hilarious mouse story in another review, so can't comment on it. We got breakfast every day in the Murray Hill Diner on the next block and it is cheap, cheerful and very tasty!The location is 2 blocks from the Empire State building and a little further on is Macys. for transport, the hotel is one block from a subway station (green lines 4,5 and 6), so there is no problem getting around. Would recommend this hotel to anyone or definitely stay there again. Overall, it is well worth its lofty perch among the top hotels in New York!  
<Date>Nov 7, 2007

<Author>Pubway
<Content>This place is Fabulous!!!! The location of this hotel is great. It's an easy walk to the subway and to many tourist attractions. The staff is very friendly and go out of their way to help you. The smell of lavendar greets you as you step in the lobby and instantly relaxes you. The elevators are fast, the rooms were huge, beds and linens extremely comfortable and it was great to have the use of the little kitchen in our suite for breakfast. We ate brunch at The Barking Dog restaurant next door, which is not actually part of the hotel, and the food was very good. (No evidence of Minnie or Mickey visiting on the Sunday morning that we were there, but there were plenty of other people waiting to have brunch.) I would definitely stay at the Affinia Dumont again and would highly recommend it to anyone.

<Author>travelbum16
<Content>Fantastic Dumont What an incredible stay at the Affinia Dumont! We experienced fantastic service, from the doormen to the reservation staff, to the wonferful housekeeping crew. We were kindly greeted upon arrival, a bit too early for checkin, and were told that our room was worth the wait. Indeed, it was! We were on the 35th floor, which in itself was awesome, but when we opened our door, we discovered a corner room with views of the Chrystler Building and the East River. For our first visit to NYC, this was enough to make our whole trip worth while. The room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and had all the comforts of home (big tv, comfy sofa, large desk and plenty of room to store clothing). The location was perfect - just a block or so away from the 6 train, which takes you uptown or downtown with convenient stops, yummy restaurants closeby, and a lovely market next door. Don't miss this hotel. You will not be disappointed.

<Author>Coffeeman1960
<Content>A great choice! We chose the Dumont when it was rated #2 in New York on Tripadvisor. The reviews didn't lie. What a choice! We travelled with two teenagers and had a double bedroom suite on the 34th floor for 4 nights - fantastically comfortable with the superb pillow menu and views looking north that will live in the memory forever.We found the city amazingly busy and noisy - the Dumont was conventiently located but away from the action. Why stay in Times Square (post-apocolyptic in our view!) when there's the Dumont? That said, light sleepers will still be disturbed by sirens and horns so bring the ear-plugs!The staff were great and friendly, arranged airport transfers and checked us in online for our return flights. In a city where we found service to be somewhat patchy it was refreshing to come home to the Dumont.The Barking Dog restaurant gets mixed reviews in these pages though we found the food and value good. We tried the Cinema Cafe on 34th and 3rd for breakfast - quiet and good but pricey - yet the Italian restaurant next door was very good and very busy on a Saturday night.Other than that we did all the major must-sees; Top of the Rock IS better than the Empire State, the Staten Island Ferry IS the best value trip (Free!) and you must take a helicopter flight, though we flew Liberty Helicopters and experienced a long wait and surly service.Do not hesitate to chose the Dumont, it made our stay and we'd go back in a heartbeat.  
<Date>Oct 30, 2007

<Author>dta0307
<Content>What a great place to stay In a city with a thousands of choices where to stay what a relief to fall lucky and find a gem at a reasonable price. Against this hotel you have street noise on the lower floor rooms (where wouldn't you in New York!) and the in-room movies weren't working in our room. On the positive side I could go on for hours, great location a couple of hundred yards from 33rd st subway where you can take the 6 train to the north or south. The staff are great, so much so I did feel slightly guilty for not having enough dollars to leave a reasonable tip on leaving. The rooms are big and ours included a small kitchen area although we didn't get chance to use it on a 3 day stay. All in all a great value for money place to stay

<Author>MissAberdeen
<Content>Great Stay in a Great Hotel We have just returned from a holiday to New York where we stayed at Affinia Dumont. The hotel was perfect and the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful.We were in New York to get married and had decided to have the ceremony in our suite so choosing the right hotel was very important. When we booked the Affinia Dumont through Expedia I e mailed the hotel to request a room on a high floor. This was obviously listened to because we were given a room on the 32nd floor. It had L-shaped windows so we were able to get married with views of the Chrysler and the East River and Brooklyn Bridge.We had a bit of a nightmare with delayed luggage and the staff went out of their way to ask about it and offer help.After the wedding we went on a dinner cruise and when we got back the staff had scattered rose petals in our room and left us a bottle of wine and card. It was so thoughtful and over and above the call of duty. It was such a nice end to the day.Hopefully we will be back in New York to celebrate an anniversary and I would definitely stay in the Affinia Dumont again.

<Author>Lyndy-Lou2
<Content>Fantastic Views My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend 19th-23rd October 2007. It was our 10th Wedding Anniversary/40th Birthday treat to us and it was fantastic.I would always recommend contacting hotels/airlines if you are celebrating something special. We got an up-grade with BA and when we arrived at the hotel we had a wonderful corner room (3406) with views of downtown New York and the river. The hotel also left a bottle of champagne for us. We couldn't have asked for a better start to our break.Chris, the door man was really friendly and all of the staff were happy to help with any questions we had about taxis or restaurants.The menu at the barking dog was limited so we did not eat here during our stay, but we would recommend a diner just around the corner on Murray Hill, great service, food and prices. You need a good breakfast before you start your shopping/sightseeing! We also would recommend spankys steak house and the little French restaurant just behind the hotel. The owner was really friendly, the atmosphere romantic and the food great!If you want to go up the Empire State building then I would recommend you get there around 8am otherwise the queues can be 2-3hours long. We went to the newly opened 102nd floor and the views were amazing. Yes it was an early start to the day, but we went straight in without any waiting.Macys was great for shopping (ask at hotel reception for discount vouchers) and although we didn't find them, we were told by some locals about great out-let stores for even better bargains. You are in New York and even on the 34th floor you can hear the sirens at night and the cars below, but if you walked around like us you will not find any problem sleeping at night!We did use the underground to get around. You can buy tickets in the stations for about $2 and that will get you down to the (Bowling Green) stop were you can catch the boat out to Liberty Island ( well worth a visit great views for $12).I hope you enjoy your stay in New York as much as we did!!  
<Date>Oct 25, 2007

<Author>Traveler62
<Content>Nice place with noisy aircon We, a family of four, recently spent 4 nights at the Affinia Dumont. I chose the hotel because of the great reviews and its location. Unfortunately, we did not get the high floor room we asked for when we reserved 10 months ago.The studio we got had a comfortable size for the four of us, it was very clean, and the beds were comfortable. Service and friendliness of the personnel was great. What really turned me and my husband off, was the very noisy and drafty aircon. Since we had more than 80 degrees Fahrenheit and very humid weather, we had to leave it on over night. It was placed under the window, so my husband who slept next to it was in a constant draft of cool air. We did, however, not bother to ask for another room, because we could not imagine that the Affinia would have different systems in other rooms. Nevertheless, since everything else was good, we would probably stay there again next time.We definitely do not recommend to dine at the Barking Dog next door. While the servce is friendly, the food is not good, the table was not even with plates sliding to one side, the personnel carried all sorts of beer kegs etc. through the restaurant constantly bumping into one of our chairs ... It was by far the worst eating experience on our 12-day-trip to the Northeast.Just go 15 steps to the corner of 34th Street and 3rd Avenue: there are several nice restaurants there. We can especially recommend Patsy's pizzeria across the crossing: best pizza we ever had (thin, crispy, not greasy)!  
<Date>Oct 24, 2007

<Author>LanLondon_UK
<Content>Made my trip to NYC complete My fiance and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont from 6th to 11th October. It was my 30th birthday and his first time in New York and this hotel helped make it an amazing stay. We requested a suite on one of the higher floors after reading reviews from this website - what we didn't expect was a corner suite which offered even better views of the NYC skyline. The room was huge, the kitchenette well equipped, and the bed very comfortable. The staff were always very helpful. It's just a few blocks from the nearest subway, the Empire State Building, and if you're a shopping addict like me, close enough for more than a few visits to Macys and the shops on 5th Ave. There were lots of food supermarkets around so we could easily stock up on bottled water and deli food when we weren't up to eating out. Blockheads was the biggest bargain when it came to local restaurants - great Mexican food with $3 frozen margheritas, Cinema next door was a bit pricier but also nice. Check out Century 21 if you love bargains - although be prepared to rummage a bit. And if you can afford it, go to the River Cafe for dinner under Brooklyn Bridge which is very romantic, classy and has stunning views of the city. Walk across the bridge on the way there and get a swanky car back to the hotel (what I did on my actual birthday!) I loved Duane Reade too - it's a pharmacy but if you're from the UK you'll find lots of cheap, good quality makeup, some which aren't available in the UK. I'd definitely recommend Affinia Dumont.  
<Date>Oct 23, 2007

<Author>YDFreeborn
<Content>Lived up to our expectations. We have just returned from a long weekend stay at the affinia Dumont hotel in New York. As always I choose the hotel by the reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed.The hotel is in a very convenient position with the Empire State Building in the same street and 4 blocks away. We had rooms on the 31st floor and we had a spectacular view of the Chrysler building. The room was one of the biggest we've ever had, spotlessly clean with a huge kingsize bed, roomy bathroom and lots of hanging and drawer space. I had booked 2 rooms with king beds but the girls wanted singles (These were huge too!) and the girl at the desk changed the rooms to suit and made sure they were very near one another. Nothing was too much trouble and all the staff were very helpful and courteous.We ate breakfast at The Barking Dog next door which was very reasonable and did the best pancakes!!The Red Lobster 5 Times Square is worth a visit(do book or you may have an hours wait) and we had a fabulous meal there. I can highly recommend the coconut covered battered huge prawns and crab legs!!! Again, a reasonable price.We had been told by a friend in Queen's to try Patsy's Italian restaurant 236 W 56th Street which we booked for Saturday evening. It was like walking into The Sopranos!!! but again the food was excellent but a bit more expensive, around 120.00 for four with drinks.Where ever you eat the portions are huge and the drinks seem to be doubles!We had a fantastic time in New York and saw all the sitesand the girls gave the credit cards a bashing! The taxis are very cheap too and worth using.Will certainly stay at The Affinia when we return Thanks for making it a great break.Yvonne and Dave Freeborn and girls.  
<Date>Oct 17, 2007

<Author>J0anneH
<Content>Enjoyed our stay at Affinia We have just returned from 5 nights at the Affinia hotel, NY. We chose this hotel as it couldn't be beaten on price and the reviews on trip advisor were very good. I've never visited NYbefore so haven't experienced any other hotels in the area but can say that it's location was brilliant. We were very central to all the attractions, which were in walking distance or there were nearby tube and bus stations if you want to use them. Our hotel room was huge however we were hardly in the hotel room. The bathroom was average and the kitchen was average as well. Our view was absolutely fantastic as well. There was an air conditioning unit in our room, which made a noise but this didn't bother us at all. We were on the 24th floor and could just about hear traffic outside but I think this would have been the same in any hotel in NY and again it didn't bother us at all. We felt as though the hotel and rooms needed modernising but apart from that I would definitely recommend it. Although I would not recommend the Barking Dog, which is the hotel's restaurant. We went there on our first night and didn't return. The food tasted processed and I ordered lasagne which had been warmed up as the middle was freezing cold and had been made with sour cream! We could also see mice running around in the seating area outside, which put us off going back as well.  
<Date>Oct 17, 2007

<Author>ld
<Content>Good value, great space, excellent service. I booked this hotel on the strength of the reviews and the space it offered three visitors in a one bedroom suite. Its good value, has spacious rooms and the staff are first class. Our rooom on the 20th floor had a view but not one to rave about. The room was comfortable, clean had everything in it you could wish for, but some of the furniture was looking a little tired. The fridge is well stocked with items, if a little pricey, but the free Coffee is a nice touch. Staff really are first class, acting promplty to fix a broken TV in our room and providing extra linen for the sofa bed on request. However, there is no getting away from the first impression of getting a hotel room with a broken TV and where you have to ask for extra linen when the booking if for 3 people and there is only one bed. So its the staff that make this place as does the space it offers. These are the two main reasons in my opinion to stay here. Its loacted about 5 mins from the Empire state building in a relatively quiet location for NY. Its close to the major attractions / shopping, but if I'm honest I prefer to stay in the mid 40s off 5th avenue as I like being able to walk to Central Park within mins and up museum mile - but its a well located hotel none the less. We ate at the barking dog and it is pretty poor quality. I didn't think the prices were too high, just the food was prepared badly with over cooked fries and a charred burger. We ate one night at a nice little Italian call Da Cira I think, right around the corner on Lexington. The deli on the corner of 34th and Lex is also nicely stocked should you wish to catch a quick breakfast in your room.  
<Date>Oct 16, 2007

<Author>bostonbound
<Content>great stay Just returned from New York and the Affinia Dumont was one of the highlights. We stayed for 2 nights and everything was top notch. The location is great although it should be noted that the hotel is in a more residential area. Nevertheless, it was very easy to walk everywhere and the subway is 2 blocks away. The rooms are very spacious, nicely furnished and equiped with a kitchenette There's a market/deli on the corner which is a nice alternative to eating every meal out. The Murry Hill Diner around the block also offers great breakfasts.The only disappointment was that we requested a room on an upper floor, were told that our request was granted but were given a room on the 11th floor. So, we really didn't have a great view and it was a bit noisy due to street traffic.Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

<Author>JAB33
<Content>It's True, AGreat Place to Stau We recently returned from a spending a week in NYC at the Affinia. I had done a lot of research and consideration before choosing this hotel and after our stay I'm convinced it was the best choice considering our priorities. The criteria I considered when deciding included the following:Type of Facility - there are a lot of choices from large full service hotels to small boutique hotels to bed and breakfast/guest houses. I like to have all the essential amenities (private bathroom, room service, sufficient bedroom and bathroom floor space, comfortable bed and linens, etc) but don't need a fancy lobby, prestigious name/address and so on. The Affinia Dumont delivered. More than enough space, very comfortable bed, linens and pillows, nicely furnished, kitchen with freezer space is a real bonus.Location - Midtown, central location, great subway access, relatively quiet neighborhood, nearby shops and restaurants. Safety and cleanliness - very safe neighborhood, very clean room, always got good maid service, even when sleeping in late.Good value - a nice room in a decent hotel in a good location in NYC doesn't come cheap. You can pay less but you're going to get less in one or more of the criteria above.Read the reviews and you'll get a good idea of what you will get. I could say a lot more but most of it has already been said by other reviewers. Some personal experiences - Book ahead of time as much as you can. I booked about four months in advance. The room type we booked was not available and it had gone up about $80/night as we got close to our travel date. I had requested an upper room at booking, when confirming about a month before, and was told we were set for a room on the 30th floor (I think) when I called two days before our departure. On check in I was given a room on the 17th floor. Not exactly what I expected but it was a corner suite and it was high enough to escape most street noise but not high enough for a great view, so I didn't pitch a fit. Also, had problems trying to get a pay-per-view movie one evening. They had a technician up to the room in minutes. He was able to determine that the service was out for the whole building, called the service provider, got them to reset the service and I was watching my selected movie in no time. That type of service that is hard to find anywhere.I highly recommend this hotel. It truly deserves its high ranking. I would especially recommend it for family trips where you need more than one bedroom and you want a safe neighborhood.  
<Date>Oct 10, 2007

<Author>M5Driver
<Content>Affina Dumont is great! We are a well-travelled family of four - two adults, two teenaged daughters - and we really enjoyed our recent visit to the Affinia Dumont. Centrally located in Midtown near the 33rd Street / Park Ave. subway station, it served as a wonderful, reasonably-priced oasis. Very spacious, comfortable, clean, and quiet room with large bathroom and nice complete kitchenette. Great beds, and the girls went crazy over the pillow menu, offering a choice of six different pillows ranging from buckwheat to contour foam. (I went with the magnetic therapy pillow and slept like a baby.)Wonderful in-room spa amenities and use of a very nice fitness center are complimentary - unusual in Manhattan.The entire staff - bellstaff, front desk, housekeeping - was unfailingly polite and helpful. They bent over backwards to accommodate our every request. They appear to actually enjoy working at this hotel!Just around the corner on 3rd Ave. at 33rd St. we found the best coffee / bagel shop / bakery in town - Bagel Du Jour. All pastry homemade on site, wonderful Italian espresso.Without hesitation, we will return to the Affinia Dumont on our next visit to NYC.

<Author>willisjw
<Content>Excellent New York Hotel We just returned from a New Yorker Festival Weekend (Oct 5-7, 2007) at the Affinia Dumont near midtown Manhattan. I can't say enough good things about the hotel. It's well appointed, has modern bed  bath, and a friendly staff. The rooms are unusually spacious for New York, including a lovely modern desk and a functional kitchen in our studio king. The location is a good starting point for a lot of activities in New York. You can easily walk to the Empire State Building, 5th Ave, the library, Penn Station, etc. The nearest subway is the number 6 on Park Ave. which is not the best, but works ok to get downtown.

<Author>bethke14
<Content>Loved the Affinia Dumont! My mom and I visited NYC for my dream trip in August, and the Affinia Dumont was fabulous. I had contacted the hotel via email about a month prior to the trip, letting them know that it was a special vacation, and that if possible, we would appreciate having a room with two beds on a high floor (our original reservation was a king room). They happily met our request! We stayed in a double queen studio suite, and the room was very large. We absolutely loved having the kitchen! There are a lot of delis/grocery stores in the area where we could get cheap breakfast. The room was also very clean and had nice white linens and comfortable beds. We loved the neighborhood. The front desk staff as well as the bell staff was FANTASTIC and very, very friendly - always willing to help with directions, and always wished us a pleasant evening. It was nice to be able to grab a piece of fruit and some iced tea in the lobby as we returned. We didn't try the room service, but I was surprised at how reasonable the prices were. Overall, a great stay. I will certainly look to stay here on future trips to New York!

<Author>suemaxster
<Content>A Wonderful Stay at The Affinia Dumont My family has just stayed at the Affinia Dumont as my daughter was getting married in Central Park.The hotel staff could not have been more helpful or friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. From surprises for my daughter and her husband to be, and for me and my husband as we were celebrating our 30th wedding aniiversary - such nice touches.The hotel itself is well placed for the ESB (and Macys) and is only a 15 minute walk to Times Square - or a taxi was only app 7-8 dollars + tip.The rooms were large and clean and the housekeeping was extremely efficient. <Author>LCR12
<Content>Great Hotel This is a great hotel. The staff were helpful  our room was spacious  very comfortable. Good to have a fridge to keep drinks etc. Only slight disadvantage is that the air-conditioning can be only on or off, can't turn the temp down/up.The doormen were particularly helpful when we thought we had lost something on leaving. They will get you a limo to the airport if you ask - better than a taxi  not much more expensive, you can agree the price in advance which is even better if the traffic is bad (it was terrible to JFK so leave plenty of time at peak hours).Close to Empire State Building so get there early or better still book in advance  by-pass the queues.

<Author>theloft
<Content>Best value in NY We are from England and the last time we stayed in New York City we had a terrible hotel. After researching reviews on Trip Advisor and getting prices we chose the Dumont and were so pleased with it overall. OK. the foyer looks a bit jaded, but the staff are helpful and the rooms are clean and spacious, comfortable beds, good bed linen, bathroom etc. I think they would go up a further notch if they supplied bathrobes but that's just a niggle. It is really central for all attractions and shopping. We booked with Quikbook.com and got an excellent rate.

<Author>J_Bolowski
<Content>Difficult to beat As with other reviews this hotel is indeed in a great location. For those with a disposition for walking it is well placed to walk to most places on Manhatten within 60-90 mins. For those who want to use public transport there is an underground station 5 mins walk away and there are several bus route pickups close to the hotel.The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a suite which was pretty large with a lounge and well equipped kitchenette.One downside was when we ordered breakfast in our room. The quality of the food was poor and overpriced. For those who want an alternative location for breakfast try penelopes on lexington within 5-10 minutes walk

<Author>hotelhoppa
<Content>Nice Stay in NY This hotel is a really lovely hotel and I'd recommend it if you're going on your hols to NY. The rooms are really quite large and it's great that they have a fridge aswell. The staff were really helpful through-out our stay and the barking dog cafe next door is great for snacks and breakfast. The hotel is just 4 blocks down from the Empire State Building and is fairly near to all the main tourist attractions(Macy's, Times Sq, Madison Ave, 5th Ave, United Nations). The room is fairly well equipped for all your needs - and they have a variety of pillows which you can try each night. If you're feeling energetic there's also a fitness suite!A word of warning though - this is Manhatten where they just luuurrrrve their sirens - so if you're a light sleeper take ear plugs - no matter what floor you are on!

<Author>ItsaPartyof5
<Content>Loved the Affinia Dumont! All the great reviews here about the Affinia Dumont are correct! This hotel is just great, especially by NYC standards (where I expect the rooms to be small and very noisy). The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. I had a beautiful corner room on the 33rd floor that was huge, with views of the East River and gorgeous buildings. It was so much quieter than other NY hotels I've stayed at. The doormen - Don with the hat especially! - were so kind and helpful. The location is wonderful - very safe, yet near so much (Lexington, Madison, Park Avenues... easy walk to Macys and more). I will definitely stay at the Affinia Dumont again. On another note: I used Dial 7 car service to/from JFK and had very nice drivers in clean comfortable cars. Also, we went to the meat packing district one evening and ate at the Spice Market restaurant - really different and fun, plus such great people watching!

<Author>LondonJonathan
<Content>Mice in the restaurant My mother and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont between 11th Sept and 19th Sept. We went to eat in the hotel's restaurant, The Barking Dog on our third night, and suddenly saw a mouse running around the floor of the restaurant. It had a long tail, so it was either a mouse or a little rat. We immediately told the waitress, who said oh yes that's been here all afternoon, we can't get it out and walked off. A few minutes later, nobody seemed to be doing anything so we asked to see the manager (we were the only people eating in the restaurant). The manager said that the mouse / rat had come in from outside because they had the outside doors open. She said that this particular mouse frequently came in (obviously it hadn't occurred to her that there might be more than one mouse). We said that we were appalled, in the UK a restaurant would at least stop serving if a mouse was running around. She said that she'd called her boss, who told her to continue serving food. The mouse continued to run around the restaurant for the duration of our stay there. Our food came, needless to say we hardly ate anything, and asked for the bill. The bill was brought to our table, no thought of any reduction for the mouse. Eventually we spoke to the manager again who decided that as a special gesture she would cancel the bill. We felt honoured. We immediately spoke to the duty manager of the Affinia Dumont who said that despite the fact that the Barking Dog is advertised on the hotel's website, despite the fact that the restaurant is recommended by the concierge as you arrive and despite the fact that all the hotel's room service comes from the restaurant, it has nothing to do with the hotel. Evidently the hotel leases it to a separate company who do the catering on an agreement with the hotel. The next day the restaurant was still serving food, and there was no talk of room service being suspended. I saw the same manager we'd spoken to on the Sunday evening (three nights later) who said that she had contacted the owner of The Barking Dog, who had said he was too busy to do anything about the mouse / rat. She said that there would be a meeting about the rodent the following day, so she suggested that the hotel had done nothing about this and allowed guests to continue eating food from the restaurant for three days. The next day, she said that she'd just found out that evidently a rat-catcher had come to the restaurant the day after we saw the mouse, and they had a clean bill of health. She offered us one night to be deducted from our bill. I saw Jennifer Baldwin, a Director of Affinia Dumont as we were checking out. I said that I was surprised that we were being asked to pay anything for our stay. I had never eaten before in a restaurant with rodents running around, and was disgusted that this was treated in such a cavalier way. She apologised, but said that New York has a rodent problem, as though what had happened was kind of normal. She refused to refund more than one night of our stay. She said that the rat-catcher comes every Friday to the hotel and restaurant (even though the other manager didn't realise this happened). She said that the kitchens were clean and there was no risk of us having eaten food which was contaminated by rodent faeces. How would she know? How does anyone know that this was a single mouse and not a family? If there isn't a rodent problem, why do they have a rat-catcher come as often as they do? I thought mice were nocturnal, and I thought they preferrred living inside in warm dark places rather than outside so how did they know that this wasn't a colony living under the floorboards? And, given that it had a long tail, was it a mouse or a rat? In reality, I don't think they really cared. I was checking out, we hadn't told anyone about what had happened, and the hotel was full that night. Ms Baldwin did say that she would help me with rates next time I stayed at the hotel. I cannot imagine why she thought I would return - I would not be seen dead in a rodent infested hotel, irrespective of the price. Throughout all of this, I had to start all the discussions. Neither the first manager, nor Ms Baldwin, made the effort to contact us, on the three occasions I spoke to them I had to go and find them. If they were really bothered, why would they not have made an effort to get in touch with us? We paid 1800 for 7 night's stay, so this wasn't exactly a cheap hotel. My mother is 71, she was wearing a dress on the evening concerned, and the mouse was literally inches from her legs. She's still having nightmares about this, I would imagine any woman wearing a skirt would do. So, unless you have a passion for rodents, and love bottom of the rung service to go with them, I would take your 250 a night and invest it in a better hotel in NYC - there are lots of other options and I'm sure at least some manage to keep mice and rats out.  
<Date>Sep 30, 2007

<Author>mike_York_UK
<Content>Good Location We stayed here for 4 nights during September. It is a good location being in Murray Hill and only takes 15 minutes to walk to Times Square and 5 minutes to the nearest Metro. The hotel does not have a traditional reception and bar / restaurant area. As you walk in the front you are faced with the reception desk and then the lifts to the rooms are behind that. In place of a standard bar and breakfast/dining area there is a bar and cafe adjoining the hotel called the  Barking Dog  which you can use for breakfast etc and charge to the hotel via your room card. The staff are friendly enough there and it is reasonable value, but for anybody who likes a draught beer in the evening there are only bottles.I would suggest you insist on a high floor floor room as we were stuck on floor 4 with only a view of a brick wall. The rooms are spacious enough with a kitchen area for those who require that sort of thing. We didn't use ours as we were in New York to get about not sit in the room and cook.All in all not a bad place to stay but if I were going to New York again I might think again about something more traditional in its layout.  
<Date>Sep 29, 2007

<Author>HibbsyJ

<Author>lgoldstar
<Content>Healthy-sized rooms at the Affinia Dumont The Affinia Dumont is marketed as a fitness hotel, and its many accoutrements reflect this philosophy throughout its experience. It's only from these various thoughtful features, though, that you'd guess it was a fitness hotel, since the guests look the same as any other medium-to-high-end hotel in Manhattan, not exclusively the lean, low-cholesterol, somewhat toned specimens you might expect.We were greeted on entry by a couple friendly faces at the front desk, surrounded by a canister of iced tea and a bowl of fresh fruit (because they're healthy). A set of free weights in a plexiglas cabinet looked less out of place than you would expect. As it was in the morning and our room wouldn't be available until 3p, an extremely robust bellhop named Christian took our luggage and promised to keep it safe. We had no doubts.The rooms are enormous by NYC standards. You could easily roll out a yoga mat or two and do your sun salutations while meditating on the downtown skyline (ask for a south-facing room on high floor if this is appealing). Most shocking to my eyes was the desk in the corner with a Herman Miller Aeron chair. Paradise! If you need to do any kind of work in your hotel, this is the place to stay. It would be perfect except for the daily usurious internet charge of $9.95. But you'll pay it with a smile as you relax in the Aeron. After you're done working (or stretching), you can fry up an omelette (egg whites only, of course) in the kitchen, equipped with a gas stove and full-size refrigerator. Several menus were in the room. A room service menu from the restaurant next door; a fitness menu describing some sort of fitness kits; and a pillow menu with at least seven (!) kinds of bed-based head support options, including buckwheat, feather, hypoallergenic, memory foam, magnetic, and other alternatives that I've never heard of before. Also available was an intimacy kit in case all that yoga on the Aeron chair gets your chi flowing - very thoughtful.In my bleary-eyed state, I failed to notice that the fitness theme had stretched even into the elevator, where a small monitor played kickboxing, yoga, and pilates videos in the morning. Everyone in the videos was smiling, beautiful, and taut. I think they change the videos to ESPN in the afternoons.The bathroom was of good size, spotlessly clean, and well appointed with Aveda products (my favorite). Also included was a 100x magnification mirror so you could monitor the health and fitness of your pores.Overall this was a great hotel in a decent midtown location. Highly recommended for anyone, but especially those who value health and wellness, spacious rooms, or Aeron chairs. The staff are friendly and always bid you adieu not with goodbye but be well!  
<Date>Sep 22, 2007

<Author>vacation joie
<Content>Beautiful, classy, great location! You'll love it! We can't stop raving about our stay the the Affinia Dumont; we stayed for 3 nights in May 2007:SERVICEThe service was impeccable! From a quick check-in and extremely courteous and helpful bellmen and front counter people, we were recommended some nice restaurants and my husband even had a good conversation with one of the doormen about baseball! FUN STUFFThey have a pillow menu where you can choose from a variety of special pillows (buckwheat, magnetic, down, etc) free of charge. It was fun trying out different pillows although we often opted for the regular down pillows in the end!There's also exercise packages that you can borrow...they include pedometers, cd players, weights, etc that you can check out. We checked out pedometers to see how far we walked in the city. This service was also free of charge.There's also free fruit and yummy iced tea in the lobby.ROOMSThe rooms were extremely large- we had 2 queen size beds, a lounge chair and an executive size desk with all too much room for just two of us! We had a beautiful view of the city from our large, multiple windows-- it was great at night with all the lights!The bathroom was beautiful with marble, granite and brushed stainless steel fixtures.LOCATIONA great location for catching the subway or the bus...just a few blocks to any transportation. There's some small shops along the walk if you need to pick up anything. GOOD EATSPizza 33 was recommended by the concierge and we loved it! We tried almost each type of pizza (by slices or whole) while we were there. We even brought some with us for our plane ride home!There's a small cafe/deli that's on the corner before you get to the hotel. I dont' remember the name, but they have special coffee drinks, a full deli (soups, sandwiches, salads), smoothie bar...and FREE INTERNET (the hotel charges a daily fee).Overall, we loved our stay at the Affinia. Great location, helpful staff and a very classy hotel overall.  
<Date>Sep 18, 2007

<Author>abbymacs
<Content>Wonderful stay at the Affinia Dumont After reading the many wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked the Affinia Dumont for a 3 day stay (9/3-6) prior to our cruise out of NYC. The many positive reviews were absolutely on target. Upon check in we were asked if we wanted a suite on an upper floor (we said of course!) and were given a corner suite on the 24th floor. What a magnificant view of both the Chrysler building and the East River! The room itself was spacious, quiet and so very comfortable. The bed ws superb, and the full kitchen was great (especially with the market 3 doors down, where we could buy food to cook or goodies to store in the refrigerator at pretty much any hour).The staff was friendly and very helpful too. We loved the location (especially with the taxi strike on Wednesday) since we were within walking distance of many key locations, and 2 blocks from the subway. We would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to others, especially anyone with a family who needs a bit more space then the average hotel room.  
<Date>Sep 16, 2007

<Author>HoboWhitstable
<Content>Clean and comfortable, recommend it. We stayed at the Affina Dumont 150 East 34th st from the 29/08/07 - 05/09/07. We can reccomend this hotel without exception, the location is good for all your travel locations or activities. The rooms, we had two on the 21st  24th floors were spotless, comfortable and quiet regarding hotel type noise and the kitchenette was particually useful. The staff were always helpful and the door staff were an unlimited sourse of information and some of the nicest guys you could meet. If you want meals just around the corner from the hotel is the murray hill diner excellent food, clean and good prices and service.About new york: This was our first time and we used Greyline city tours (London open top buses) on a 2 day ticket to get our bearings the info given saved us tthe cost of the tickets and some telling us where to shop for bargains in Union sq at a shop called Filene's Basement ([--]) my wife bought a handbag and a shoulder bag by Ralf Lauren for about 45% off the Maceys price and they were current stock. A chain of bakery/coffee shops called au bon pain are good for cake, rolls, soups and coffee. The Radio City tour is a must, what a place. Tiping a pain as your obliged to do it for everything. If you are downtown by ground zero and wall st pay a visit to St Pauls church on broardway about 3/4 blocks up from wall st very moving place this is where the emergency personel went for rest breaks I am a 53yrs old man not religious and very cinical the place put a tear in my eye.The taxi's from JFK to Manhatten are a fixed price of $49 45 plus 4 for a tunnel toll. Lots more to see for another trip.

<Author>EmmMc
<Content>Fantastic! We booked the Affinia Dumont after reading the reviews on trip advisor. We were not disappointed. On arrival we were greeted by very helpful staff who checked us in early and were even willing to change our room the next day to a room with a view! Our room was clean and spacious. The location is excellent as although Murray Hill is a more residential area you get the best of both worlds. A 5 minute walk to the Empire State building and fantastic restaurants and bars where the locals would go on your doorstep.There is an excellent diner just round the corner on Lexington Avenue called the Murray Hill Diner which serves breakfasts that will keep you going all day. On 3rd Avenue there is an excellent Mexican restaurant called Blockheads which does $3 Margarita's.I would go back to the Affinia Dumont every year!!

<Author>AuntieDebbie
<Content>It was perfect for our family! Our family of five had an awesome stay at Affinia Dumont in June. It is so hard to find a place in NYC that allows 5 people per room. Besides accomodating our large group, our room had everything we could want - 2 TVs (no fighting between the kids), a nice size bathroom, kitchen space to make snacks, and the separate living room and bedroom gave us plenty of space to stretch out. The doorman remembered my 11 year old nephew each time we returned and made that boy feel very special on his first visit to NYC. The front desk staff was so welcoming and very helpful. The beds were SO comfortable after long days of touring. Although some other reviewers of this property have complained about street noise, it didn't bother us at all. The neighborhood was very nice and I always felt safe. This was my first time using Trip Advisor to help me select a place to stay and this hotel was as great as the other reviews said it was! I'm so glad we picked the Affinia Dumont - they really made sure we had a nice stay!

<Author>strathj
<Content>Mixed Thoughts About Affinia Dumont I have mixed thoughts about giving the Afinia Dumont a three star rating rather than a four--it may well be that the hotel situation in Manhattan is so terrible that a four is justified by comparison, (I've never stayed in a Manhattan hotel before, but if you stayed in this facility in San Francisco, Honolulu, Scottsdale, etc. you would have no trouble rating the Dumont as a Three at best. Consider the advice of those with more Manhattan experience.We stayed 8 nights Aug 26 - Sept 2 07. Arriving Saturday night we were given a 4th floor room by an apologetic night clerk who assured us (without prompting) that we could be moved to a higher floor the next day if we asked. This deserves brownie points even though we didn't move. We loved our corner room with windows on two sides giving great views of 34th St, including the Third Avenue intersection. A personal choice. I mention this because of another review suggesting staff was not helpful with this kind of situation.Very Good Overall:Location on 34th: 1 1/2 blocks to #6 subway line (one stop Uptown to Grand Central Station and all points everywhere. A few stops Downtown will give you easy transfers to express subway trains headed to Wall Street etc.. Don't underestimate importance of this.Room size: Big! The reason we chose this property after seeing TripAdvisor reviews.Bed - The King was excellentBathroom - Very attractive and functional except for the modest counter space.Work desk - big.Electric outlets - lotsExcellent staff attitude, friendliness,and response to requests everywhere--front desk, concierge, spa/exercise room, housekeeping.Very good exercise room (good treadmills (3), eliptical trainers (3), and bikes (2), each with individual TVs. Weight machines and free wieghts are more than adequate for all but the very serious lifters.) When I was there (around 5 pm daily), there was almost never more than several other guests in the room.We enjoyed neighborhood restaurants and the hotel restaurant.Improvement needed:Antiquated television - Purchased at a garage sale?Neglected KitchenGood:Small gas range and oven Freezer-over refrigerator.Small coffee maker (with coffee packets supplied daily).Cups, plates, and glasses for 3 or 4Frying pan, 2 sauce pans, small glass bowl serving dish, 1 spatula, 1 can opener.Bad: Not much else in the kitchen. Not even a sharp knife to cut cheese with. No additional mixing dishes, serving dishes, measuring cups, juice or beverage containers. Tiny antiquated/underpowered microwave (despite lots of available counter space available for something better). No dishwasher (there is plenty of space for regular one and more than plenty for one of the small ones that was just installed at my office at home).Internet connections:We never got it to work--used dial-up instead. (Admittedly I gave up quickly, but I rarely have a problem.)The phantom Business Center. Their web site lists a Business Center as an amenitity, but it doesn't exist unless you count the single work station in the small front lobby ($6 for 20 minutes).I defer to those who have much more Manhattan hotel selection experience.Feel free to contact me. --Jeff  
<Date>Sep 10, 2007

<Author>LufTravel
<Content>Affinia disapointing this year We have stayed at the Affinia for the past several Labor day weekends with positive reviews (some probably posted here). Just returned from 3 nights and we were a little disapointed. The hotel seems to be more run down since our last visit in 2006 and the staff wasn't their usual perky selves. (Except for the bellman with the hat!) When we got to our junior suite on night 1 there was a funky smell in the room. I won't go into details. It was fairly late after a long day at the Tennis tourney, so we simply called the front desk and asked if we could be moved to a cleaner room the following day. We were told of course, pack up your bags in the morning and we will move your things. So the next day when we returned to the hotel, again after a long day we checked at the front desk to get our new room #. It was almost 5 and we were told the new room wasn't ready (our old room wasn't made up either, never was that day). So we headed back out and returned around 7 or so when the front desk gave us our new keys. But we had to go and collect our things as no one had moved them for us afterall. Basically the Affinia is in a nice location, has great size rooms for NYC, but on our next trip we will be trying a new location. May be time for a change.  
<Date>Sep 5, 2007

<Author>roxcrowe
<Content>Loved the Affinia Dumont My three girlfriends and I (including an appellate court judge) just returned from a four-night (ladies weekend) stay at the Affinia Dumont -- and can't stop talking about the hotel. First off, I booked the hotel for the group based on the past reviews and I am glad I disregarded the few bad reviews. The hotel was perfect for the four of us -- plenty of room (big by NYC standards); the kitchennette came in very handy (especially with the Murray Market next door); the location was great (away from noisy Times Square) and within walking/cab distance to just about anywhere; and the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be staying here again on our next trip and have even told my husband that next time we are in NYC we too will be staying here. In one word the experience was truly WONDERFUL!

<Author>cobaltblue
<Content>Affinia Dumont, A real Gem We looked and looked for decently priced hotel in Manhattan and we were losing hope when we came across this gem.It is only a 45-minutes cab ride from JFK. The lobby is really nice and you can use their computer in the lobby to print out your boarding passes.The staff is very friendly and the gym area is nice and relaxing. The lockers area was clean and I liked the special touches, such as providing fresh towel and a sanitizier machine for the combs and brushes they provided.The room was on the 25th floor, very nice, up there. The only drawback is the very noisy air conditioning that you need to keep on otherwise you boil in there.There was even a kitchen fully stocked and a little cute bottle of dishwashing liquid.The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were great. The even asked us if we wanted different pillows. They have a whole menu of pillows in the room and you can order the ones you want.The sheets were very soft as well. There was a tv, a safe, lots of closet space; the bathroom was big as well but it did not have a fan so if you take an extra hot shower, you will swelter in there if the door is closed.In the weekday mornings they also put a newspaper at our door which was nice.I even saw guests with their little dogs coming out of the rooms.There is a little supermarket deli next door that sells really sweet smelling flowers, water and prepares sandwiches and bagels as well.All in all, it was a great stay!  
<Date>Sep 5, 2007

<Author>Bellerboo
<Content>Hello Benjamin! Hello Benjamin and the guys! Sorry for the delay in posting our review! Myself and 3 girls from Liverpool stayed here in July for a week. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The guys on the door couldn't do enough for you, be it recommending restaurants, places to see and clubs! Especailly organisng the Limo for the journey home! The hotel is in a nice location, we have stayed in the Affina Manhattan before and it does tend to be noisier.. the Dumont is in a quieter loaction but still handy for all the attractions.. Ask for a room on a high floor and you can't go wrong (especially if its a corner room). There were 4 of us in our room and we all managed ok. The Cinema Cafe around the corner serves great coctails, the nightlife tends to be better downtown, Nolita, Little Italy, Meat Packing district etc.. only a cab ride away... I would definaltey recommend this hotel to anyone.. Back to the door men! Benjamin, my friend who stayed last week passed on your message! Its a very small world! Lyndsay, Geraldine, Sherryn and Carrie. x

<Author>AFLAGAL
<Content>One Of The Best  We returned once again to one of our favorite hotels in the country. Probably our best vacation there yet. Our room was on the 37th floor, a huge room especially by NY standards, magnificent view with 2 banks of windows overlooking the East River. As always our accomodations were super clean and quiet. The staff at this hotel is great, very helpful but not intrusive. No problems whatsoever this time. We figured we were in the room approximately 3 hourse out of every 24 but after a hard day (and sometimes night) of sightseeing, plays, concerts and shopping having a nice, quiet, clean home to return to is just what we needed. The sunrises were magnificent. Close to wonderful restaurants and public transportation. We always stay at an Affinia hotel while in NY and this was the second year at the Dumont. We will definitely be there next summer.

<Author>PenLondon
<Content>Just okay! Like so many others, I booked this hotel on the back of the rave reviews on this site. On the plus side, the rooms were certainly large and the hotel staff were pleasant. They moved us to a much higher room after our first night which was great.On the down side, the hotel and the room were a bit shabby - chipped paintwork and dated decor. It was really only just okay.The sofa bed was right in front of the door of the suite making entering a little tricky - makes me think that the furniture was not that well planned for the space. The bathroom was disappointing - I expected towelling robes at a hotel of this quality and the products were average. Like most hotels, the towels were too small.The spa was okay - no magazines provided in the relaxation area. My masseur was brilliant though.Location is pretty good although not much to do at night in the immediate vicinity. I could have done with more to do suggestions in the hotel guide to help choose a local restaurant.Barking Dog was pretty good although the outside area was shabby and pretty grubby.Fine if you want a large spacious room in New York but don't expect luxurious accommodation.  
<Date>Aug 20, 2007

<Author>hingibu
<Content>Good location, try to get a high floor room Stayed here for 5 nights in March - would generally agree with all comments here - the hotel is good value, location is good, rooms are quite large (especially for New York) and the staff are very good.Try to get a high floor - we had a 30+ level south facing room, the room was bright and airy and the views fantastic. Downside is that there isnt a great selection of food stores or restaurants close by.We would definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC.

<Author>BucksUK_traveller
<Content>Highly recommend Staying in NYC looked like a bit of a minefield, with plenty of scope for spending a lot with little to show for it. Based mainly on other reviews and availability, we booked a room with two doubles to share with our two children and were not disappointed. The room was furnished to a high standard and was scrupulously clean, and the staff were friendly and helpful. Our children were thrilled to be staying in the same street as the Empire State building, and the location is convenient. Although not cheap at $325 a night, I reckon this was good value for NYC and would certainly recommend it.

<Author>RichardCDublin
<Content>A bit dissapointing After all the amazing reviews this hotel recieved on Tripadvisor we were really expecting this to be a great place to stay. We booked in for three nights a fimlay of five. The first disapointment was that we booked a limo through the hotel to pick us up as a surprise for our children. The excitement at the airport was great, but the limo... never arrived. After several phone calls we were eventually picked up an hour late in a pick up which cost the same price! They claim the limo was in a crash that morning, but judging by the phone conversations we overheard on our journey into New York, we were not the only ones who had been let down.When we arrived we had requested a high floor but were given a room on the 4th floor. We asked for something higher but were told in the week of 4th July there was no chance and bascially forget it. The staff did say they could have a look again the next day but as we were only staying 3 nights it wasn't worth it. This meant we had a very dark and very noisy room as you are so close to the road that the noise goes on all night.The room itself was very large and this is why i think it rates so highly among others on this site. You really couldn't complain about the size of the suite or the location of the hotel which was walking diatance to the sights. But the room was dirty. The floors in particular needed a really good steam clean and there were stains everywehere. Now maybe we just got a bad room but this was dissapointing.All in all if you are looking for space and location I would recomend, but donlt have too high an expectation based on high ratings here.  
<Date>Aug 7, 2007

<Author>drake4
<Content>Highly Recommended the Affinia Dumont We decided to book the Affinia Dumont, after reading MANY hotel reviews for NYC. We spent 5 nights there with our 7-year old son. My husband took the train each morning to work-related meetings in NJ. My son  I spent our days exploring NYC. This was our 1st time in the city and we had no problem figuring out the subway/transportation system and had an absolute blast! I am a very picky traveler - I must say the Affinia Dumont was one of the best hotels, overall, that we have ever stayed in. We had been warned about the size of hotel rooms in NYC, but our room at the Affinia Dumont was by no means small. There was ample storage space, which enabled us to unpack for the entire week. The full kitchen in our room was over-the-top!! We did some grocery shopping a few steps away, which enabled us to eat in for several meals. It was relaxing to wake up and not have to worry about getting dressed to go out 1st thing in the morning. If we wanted to grab a quick lunch or snack...it was at our fingertips! Our 1st day in NYC brought rain. My husband took the complimentary umbrella in our room, for his morning commute. The Bell Hop was quick to offer my son  I umbrellas for our day out. Which brings me to my next comments - kudos to the absolutely WONDERFUL Bell Hop and front desk attendants. They were exceptionally friendly and very, very helpful. We brought along a portable DVD player, but forgot cables to connect it into the TV in our room. My husband went to the front desk to see if we could get cables; the front desk attendant sent a technician up to our room within minutes with a DVD player. He connected it and made certain it worked before he left. I also made use of the fitness center, which was also very well-equipped. There is also a self-service laundry, which came in handy, on the basement floor. We would most definitely stay again at the Affinia Dumont!! The rooms were fantastic and the staff was outstanding!!  
<Date>Aug 3, 2007

<Author>tourist_or_traveller
<Content>Not as good as I expected I stayed at the Affinia with my husband and 14 year old daughter at the beginning of July for 5 nights and our experience wasn't as positive as many others posted on TripAdvisor. We had a room on the 8th floor with very little natural light which meant the room was quite dark even during the day. When we asked to be moved we were told that the hotel was full and it wouldn't be possible but we later discovered that there were free rooms on upper floors. Our room was a reasonable size but the bathroom was small and although the kitchen was useful it did need to be upgraded. I was particularly disappointed to discover that many items in our minibar selection were past their use by date and I hope that by the time you read this that the management will have resolved this problem. On a more positive note the Affinia is good value, there are plenty of places to eat in the area, Bagel de Jour has a vast muffin selection as well as the bagels, and the location of the hotel is good for easy access to many of the main sights. The hotel allowed us and other families the opportunity to watch the fireworks on 4th July from an upper floor room. This gesture was very much appreciated. This room was nicer than ours.  
<Date>Jul 31, 2007

<Author>Craftinginaz
<Content>Great Experience at Affinia We were quite pleased with our stay at Affinia Dumont. We arrived early in the morning on the day we were supposed to check in (a Monday) expecting to leave our bags while we toured around. To our great surprise, the staff offered and were able to find us an outstanding room on the 37th floor immediately. We were glad to have to opportunity to have some downtime after the long trip. The views were incredible (included the Chrysler Bldg  East River) and the room was nice, clean and comfortable. The Juice and fresh fruit bowl at the front desk was a nice touch. During our 2-day stay, we walked to the little store a couple of doors down for some light snacks to have after a long day of touring and we started the day with a wonderful meal at the Barking Dog restaurant at the hotel. Affinia Dumont is situated just a couple blocks from the Empire State Building. From the Affinia Dumont, we walked around touring the City. Some of the other sights we saw were: Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Terminal and Time Square. We had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend the Affinia Dumont to friends.

<Author>stella099
<Content>great hotel It was our first time in New York  the Affinia Dumont was a great introduction. After reading many reviews I chose Affinia Dumont, it was a great location on 34th St. as this street is a 2 way street but for New York it wasnt overly busy like around Times Square area. I requested a quiet room  we got a lovely large room, very comfortable queen bed  choice of pillows  most definiately quiet (upper levels). They even allowed us to leave our luggage for 3 days while we went by train to Washington DC  Philladelphia even though we were not staying again when we got back - had already booked their other hotel - Murray Shelburne see my review on this). I also liked having a guest laundry so I could do my own washing often very late at night especially good for those travelling with children. Overall we found this hotel great in every way ps cant comment on the food never ate at the Barking dog. PPS loved having the free refreshing tea at reception available at all times.  
<Date>Jul 24, 2007

<Author>Pivotgirl
<Content>Can't get much better than this I just got back from a three day stay at the Affinia Dumont and the experience was amazing. We were three professional women travelling for a bit of fun and culture. We were not able to check in early, but were upgraded to the fitness suite which was FANTASTIC. The in room sauna was an expecially nice feature. I rarely been in a Manhatten hotel room that had as much floor space as any of the three rooms we had to choose from, all with a spectacular view of the Chrysler Building. The staff was knowledgeable, courteous and extremely helpful. The place was spotless, well appointed and overall a delight. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a little extra space. The location is fabulous too - very close to the Queens Midtown tunnel, so if you are flying to LaGuradia the trip isn't painful at all. Centrally located, easy to catch cabs or transit ... You can't say enough about it

<Author>dnatnk
<Content>Exceeded My Expectations I booked this hotel after reading reviews from a few different sites. Later I was surprised to find out that a close friend of mine had stayed here many times on business and was very positive on this hotel. So my expectations were high. My family (5 of us with 3 older boys 24, 23, 16) enjoyed the large rooms. We had two bedrooms with a sofa bed in a separate middle living area, 2 baths, 2 kitchens, 2 desk and 3 very large TV (not flat screens). We all came to NYC for a 4 night vacation. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff to be very helpful. The fitness was very nice by hotel standards. The elevators are always there ?seemed liked we never waited for more than 30 seconds for an elevator. The Barking Dog bar / restaurant was a great experience. There is a store (with most every thing) on the corner less than 100 yards away - great for stocking up your kitchen and saving a few dollars. The subway is just about a  mile away. It is a very nice location to see the city. I will come back.

<Author>MaristuH
<Content>Loved THe Dumont!!! My mom and I stayed at the Affinia June 29-July 2nd. We chose our hotel based on reviews from Trip advisor. We were not disappointed!! The hotel is beautiful and the entire staff was extremely helpful. I am a VERY picky person about the bed I sleep in and these were some of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. I had to ask before I left what type of beds, pillows and sheets they used. We never heard one noise all night and it was one of the most comfortable stays I have ever had in a hotel. There was one young Lady her last name was Cortez and she was more than helpful. Everytime we asked her to recommend a restaurant, store or any questions we had she was ready to help. She had the best recommendations and always provided a map. She was SO helpful. So were all the door men and staff. This whole thing made our stay in New York an incredible weekend!!

<Author>CB90292
<Content>My favorite hotel in NYC Have stayed at the Affinia Dumont on numerous occasions, thanks to having originally discovered it thanks to tripadvisor.The location is excellent - there is both north, south and east, west transportation virtually outside the door. The doormen are courteous and helpful, as are the front desk staff.I've always gotten a room on a top floor, in a corner and the view is fabulous. The room itself is large and nicely appointed. They will provide robes upon request. The hotel used to be an apartment building, so there is a small kitchen, which is very handy if one is staying for a few days.The only disclaimer is that they charge for high speed internet.

<Author>KansasJayhawkers
<Content>Great Location, Average Hotel We stayed at the Affinia Dumont from June 19th through June 27th, 2007. The location of this hotel (34th Street and Lexington Ave) was perfect for my family that includes two teenage daughters. The valets treated you like royalty and were very helpful with directions and suggestions.The fitness room met our expectations - spacious, modern equipment, and ample choices. The downside was there was no swimming pool, no community sauna, and the steam rooms were located inside the mens and womens restrooms.The rooms were spacious and adequately equipped but this definitely was not a five star hotel. Security was good and we felt very comfortable inside as well as outside of the hotel.

<Author>PJW-Glasgow
<Content>Lived well up to expectations Back home in Scotland after a 5 night stay in NY. We chose this hotel based on reviews on this site and we were not let down. We were assigned a room on the 5th floor with an immediate apology that if we wanted one higher, we could move for the remaining nights of our stay. We opted to do this and the result was a 20th floor view of the 4th July fireworks over the East River.We had a junior suite and this had all the room we needed and more. Granted the bathroom is on the small side but it was good enough. The staff were helpful when required making arrangements for holding our luggage and arranging a car to the airport on the day of our departure.I have no hestitation of recommending this hotel assuming that you have read the facilities and made sure it meets your needs.

<Author>philipellis
<Content>a flawless stay in NewYork We had a wonderful stay at this Hotel over the Independence Day holidays.Our major pre-requisite to staying anywhere is - cleanliness. This Hotel was immaculate: clean surfaces, crisp towels and bedding, spotless common areas and bathrooms. 10 / 10.Next: location. Again , wonderful: a 10 minute stroll to the Empire State Building (go early in the morning and avoid the queues), and then another 10 minutes onto Maceys. Even central park and the sumptious shops of 5th avenue are walkable - although it can take an hour at a mild pace! Times Sq  Broadway Theatres are maybe a 25 minute walk (or a $10 cab). We saw Spamalot - it was hilarious; our teenage kids, who hadn't even heard of Monty Python beforehand, are still chortling days later!Staff at the Hotel were always pleasant, and the tip from the bell hop that the best place to watch the fireworks would be from our bedroom was spot on - we had a fab view.Room service was brilliant: good quality food, promptly served and very reasonably priced. Again: faultless.Our rooms were brilliantly appointed: good size en-suite, nice spacious lounge and well spec'd kitchen all help make this a wonderful stay.The small housekeeping problems we had (faulty lights) were dealt with within an hour of our mentioning them to the front desk.Finally, there's a 24 hour drug store opposite the hotel, which is brilliantly convenient.All in all, our stay here was beyond our expectations. The Hotel was reasonably priced especially given the quality of the service we received and we look forward to staying here again.  
<Date>Jul 11, 2007
