<Author>thetraveler001
<Content>Impressed Traveler This hotel was selected for our anniversary based on the reviews submitted on Trip Advisor. After going through AAA travel, I was sold on and anticipating the stay in the Affinia. From the moment we arrived and was welcomed by the Valet, I felt like it would be a good experience. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful. The housekeeping staff was very accommodating and the valets continuously opened the entrances doors when they saw us coming  going and asked if we needed assistance with anything. The exercise area/spa was the cleanest and most pleasant smelling area. All the niceties were there if you needed them, which was a good thing.The room was large and spacious as a suite as well as the mattress was so comfortable. The only thing that was somewhat inconvenient was needing ice and waiting for someone to bring it up to the room ( It took sometimes 5 -10 minutes to get to the room). All in all, it was a great hotel.

<Author>designersdream
<Content>Great hotel; fab location! Just returned from a weeks stay in the Affinia Dumont and we were delighted with the location of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. The rooms are large by NYC hotel standards with the kitchen an added bonus. The real beauty of the Affinia is its location, 10 min walk to Macys, Empire State, subway 5 min and a great variety of bars  restaurants in the immediate vacinity. We were definately impressed with the Affinia and plan to stay there again on our return to NYC. If there was one thing I was not pleased with its that I had contacted the hotel in advance to request a high room. However we were disappointed to discover that we were in a lower floor  were not given the option to change during our stay. The receptionist merely shrugged his shoulders when we asked. I had explained in the email that this trip was a special occasion  it would have been nice to see our request had been dealt with.However, this did not affect our stay too much  overall we were delighted with the rest of the staff of the hotel who went out of their way to be helpful particularly the door staff.

<Author>krstilu
<Content>Hospitality? None Better! What a wonderfully pleasant hotel to stay in. I don't believe I've felt more comfortable at any other hotel. The staff consistently accomodate you from the second you pull up to the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel with warm, inviting smiles and a positive, gracious attitude you will find none better than the Affinia Dumont. Great for families! Rooms are very nice and spacious with a small kitchen sufficiently appointed. Markets, restaurants, pharmacies, etc. are all within the immediate area and all are reasonably priced (as prices go in NYC). I leave today after staying here for a week and I have never been more at ease. The hotel has even accomodated our late departure today by allowing us a late check out time as well as keeping our luggage and allowing us to remain in their very relaxing lobby. At no time have I felt rushed or pushed out. Kudos to the Affinia chain and the Dumon'ts incredible management and staff. Thank you for making our first experience in New York just a little bit better. Great City, great hotel, extraordinary staff! Additionally I must acknowledge tbe restaurant next door to the Affinia, The Barking Dog. Equally as pleasant and accomodating as its hotel neighbor.

<Author>tigertrojan
<Content>Fantastic Stay My wife and I honeymooned in New York and used the high marks from tripadvisor as a factor in choosing the Affinia Dumont. The high marks were well deserved. We were always warmly greeted by the bell hops, they even learned and remembered our names. We asked for a higher room on our first day and by our second we were given a room on the 29th floor. It is about two blocks from a subway station and near a number of decent restaurants. The cab fare to Times Square/Theater District ranged from $8-15 depending on traffic. We would definitely stay again when back in New York City.

<Author>Skipper39
<Content>The best choice in NYC This is the best hotel in NYC in my opinion. Although it is not in the Times Square area one can get there in about 15 min by taking the 6 train from 33rd/Park ave. one stop to Grand Central Station and the Times Square shuttle one stop to 7th avenue. This hotel is a few blocks from the Queens Midtown tunnel which makes for an easy arrival and return from LGA.The Affinia Dumont has very comfortable beds and provides hypoallergenic bedding if needed. The staff is very pleasent and the door staff always welcome you back upon your return. I particulary like the fact that having a small lobby means you do not have to traverse through a crowd to get to the elevators and up to your room. I highly reccomend the Affinia Dumont

<Author>Rich18
<Content>Affinity with the Affinia Dumont! I hate to be one to follow the crowd, but the glowing reviews here are all spot on! My wife and I have just stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 5 days as part of our honeymoon and it exceeded our expectations on every level. Considering we'd been desperate to go to New York for years (this was our first time there) that's no mean feat!Having mentioned our honeymoon when making the booking, on arrival (early check-in) we rocketed up to the 24th floor and found we'd been upgraded to a large suite with kitchen, king bed and an amazing view over midtown Manhattan (including the Chrysler Building!). The room was spacious and incredibly well designed/furnished - a true slice of NY chic. They even provided us with a surprise complimentary bottle of champagne and a note of congratulations! The staff were friendly and attentive throughout our stay, helping us without a moment's delay when we asked for an international plug adaptor, looked like we needed a cab, or stored our luggage for 8 hours after checking out (we had a late flight home). This customer-focussed approach extended to staff at the excellent Barking Dog bar/restaurant next door, who also provided Room Service for the hotel. The portions were immense, but that's NY for you!The hotel's central location is a major plus point. Sat towards the east end of 34th St (a major shopping street as it turns out), several key sights/streets are within easy reach, with a subway station just one block away for getting to those attractions further afield. It's even on the same street as the Empire State Building and Macy's!To sum up, we were hugely impressed by the Affinia Dumont and would certainly consider staying there again. Having travelled a fair bit in recent years, I can tell you that hotels of this type/price don't come much better!  
<Date>Jun 25, 2007

<Author>graymo
<Content>Great location, excellent hotel Myself and my wife travelled from the UK and this was our first visit to New York . I booked this hotel on reviews that I had read on Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed, this is an excellent choice.The Affinia is in a fantastic location. Easy walking distance to Empire State, Macy, Grand Central Station. In fact you can comfortably walk to Times Square but it was so hot whilst we were there, this was like torture.There are many Delis, Cafs  Restaurants nearby so you don have to stray far for food. The Murray Hill market is just next door and they make great hot  cold sandwiches 24/7. This shop is well stocked for just about everything ?except wine. You need to travel a little further if you want a nice relaxing bottle for your room.The check-in at Affinia was smooth and very friendly. We had reserved a Junior Suite and when I mentioned to the girl at the check in that we would like a good view of Manhattan she immediately swapped us to an end room, where you get a two sided view. This was no problem, and no extra cost. We were on floor 25 so were above many of the buildings in the neighbourhood. On entry the room was very clean and had been well prepared. There are IMHO a couple of minor niggles with this type of room, but we will get to them later. The view of the Manhattan skyline was fantastic. The facilities of the room were excellent with a handy well equipped kitchen, big bathroom and comfortable King bed and living space. This all made for a very relaxing stay. However I thought that the room was set up more for a business traveller than a holiday stay. The wardrobe was tiny and nowhere near fitted our clothes. Bearing in mind that this stay was part of a 3 week North American trip we had a lot of stuff with us. I use hotels for business all the time and the space was quite adequate for a short business trip. The business theme is further enhanced by a large double desk and office chair. Again, this is fine for business but not much use for us. Just takes up room. I realise that the Affinia has to cater for both markets, that is why the room was set up like this. The only other niggle was a very efficient but noisy AC unit. Boy, did we use this as it was 90F on some of the days. When the AC unit was on it was noisy and we left it on all night. This may have troubled a light sleeper, but not us.The hotel staff are top notch. They are very friendly and knowledgeable and will offer help and advice on any matter that you care to ask. They do not fuss, which is also good. The doormen are so helpful and will flag down taxis or book you a town car at a moments notice. They have full internet access at a PC in the lobby ?you have to pay. They also have internet available on the in room T.V. and also wireless connection.The hotel is very clean and the cleaners are a real friendly bunch who always chat to you. The standard of room cleaning every day was first class.As for food, we ate breakfast most days at Austin Caf, which I can recommend. This is left out of the Affinia, across the street and then up , about a block and a half towards the Empire State. Lots of choice here, from breakfast sandwiches, omelettes to vegetarian and freshly sweezed juices. The staff here are pleasant and can understand an English accent, which we found was a rare skill in NYC. The Barking dog restaurant (next to Affinia) was another story. They employ pleasant young eastern European girls for FOH and waitress but they just do not understand enough English. We were all laughing trying to communicate. They understand the American accent and phrases fine but not English. When I ordered a draught beer, they were confused. When I mentioned tarter? ain Course?they had no idea what I was talking about. They only know what it says on the menu. Appetizer and Entrees. We ate there on the first night and even with the language issue we had a nice meal. Our Russian waitress was very polite and eager to learn and we taught her a little English on the fly.The second occasion(our last night) was a different story. It was very busy, the Romanian waitress spoke poor English and did not write the order down. You can imagine what happened next. My starter (er Appetizer) arrived after 20 mins wait and then the Main Course arrived straight after. I had to sit there and finish my starter looking at my steak going cold. The Main Course was only luke warm so it had been stood a while. I complained to the waitress saying that I had never before had a Main Course delivered whilst eating the starter. eally??she replied and smiled. Probably didn understand me. These issues could all be solved with decent staff training, which obviously doesn happen. An altogether unsatisfactory visit.Room service is another story and we used this only once to eat and they were quick and efficient.Another good help is that the Affinia will arrange a town car to pick you up at the airport. You pay the driver direct, either cash or card, and it is only around $20 more than a yellow cab. This worked great for us as the driver was at JFK to meet us and because all the town cars were out, we got a stretch limo for the same price. You can email the Affinia customer services to book this before you travel. They set it all up.All in all a great trip and a great stay at the Affinia. We were sad to leave and will definitely return before too long.  
<Date>Jun 25, 2007

<Author>pythagorusdc
<Content>fabulous hotel, great price for NYC We just stayed for 5 days, my wife and I, our daughter, and two of our daughter's friends (all 13). We had a two bedroom suite. The rooms were fabulous: large, excellent amenities, clean, etc. Staff was fabulous and helpful in all things. (Once the girls clogged a toilet and they were up to fix it within 15 minutes. Another time they ran bandaids up to us to deal with a small cut.) for NY the cost was really low. 2300 for the four nights, much more on the weeknights. Under 400 for the weekend nights, for a large living room, kitchen, bath, and separate bedroom, attached by a door to another studio suite with king bed, office area, kitchen and bath. We plan to stay here whenever we are in NYC.

<Author>terrav81
<Content>Loved Affinia Dumont! My best friend and I did a girls weekend June 7-10 for our first trip to New York. We booked a room with the Affinia Dumont, based on the reviews at Trip Advisor.Boy, were we pleased! We arrived around 1, and we had a couple special requests with our room, so we knew it wouldn't be ready, and that was fine. There are a lot of things to do and a few resturaunts around the corner on 3rd, so we had pizza while we waited.Our room was fantastic! Huge by most hotel standards. The shower was great and the beds were AMAZING. After walking around New York for hours and hours, it was a treat to come back to our hotel and enjoy the comfortable beds and pillows.The staff was more than helpful throughout our stay, they were very educated about the area, and recommended which trains to take where, and we had no problem going around the city. They also recommended a few restaurants and we were pleased with their suggestions.On our last day there, I ordered take out from the Barking Dog (a restaurant next door) and loved the food. The manager was really nice and gave me a free soda for picking it up. I thought that was a nice gesture.

<Author>Cammie3003
<Content>A wonderful experience Booked a junior suite for one week in May based very much on the reviews on Tripadvisor. This was our first visit to NY so we were anxious to make sure that our hotel was comfortable and well located. Boy, were we not disappointed!Hotel staff are so polite and helpful and nothing seems to be too much trouble for them. The front desk staff in particular are just great.The room was on one of the higher floors and took in a corner of the hotel giving us amazing views of the city - uptown to the Chrysler Building and out over the East River. Hotel location was perfect and just a block away from the nearest subway and 2/3 blocks from the Empire State Building. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially the Junior Suites.The Murray Hill Diner just round the corner from the hotel served us great breakfasts all week (apart from one day we ate at Sarabeth's on South Central Park which was excellent) We tried to eat at restaurants mentioned in the guides and on Zagat.com and were not disappointed once.A great holiday, a great city and a wonderful hotel.

<Author>cot427
<Content>Affinia is great...great...great! First off, I just wanted to say that I booked the Affinia Dumont off of the reviews I read on here. Almost all of the reviews were great. My first impression of this hotel was fantastic. The lobby was bright and colorful, and the doorman greated us every time were came into the hotel. The front desk staff was really helpful and friendly, except for one thing I will talk about later. The hotel even has a computer to print out boarding passes free of charge. You can also pay to IM or email. Free iced tea and fruit was available on the front desk. The elevators, despite the 37 floors went really fast. I stayed for a weekend and every time I used the elevator to the 31st floor, I did not stop on any other floor. I was amazed by this. The spa looked very nice, but I did not use the services. They have guest laundry in the basement with a vending machine. My room was excellent. It was a studio suite on the 31st floor, #3102. It was way bigger than any other NYC hotels. I loved the kitchen, very convienient for a weekend. We kept our leftover food and pizza there, along with beverages and milk for coffee. Our coffee pot was hard to use though, becuase we had a hard time getting the pot off. We did no cooking, but it was convienient. The beds were very comfortable. We had two queens and ordered pillows off the pillow menu, I ordered a hypo allergenic. There was a nice big desk to do work, or store your travel papers and all of your shopping buys. The tv was nice and big. The air kept it nice and cool, although we broke the front using it. The hotel even had a safe. There was a large closet and many drawers in the hallway as you entered the suite. That was where the safe was. We also forgot our code to the safe, so we had to call the front desk for somebody to come up and unlock it. The bathroom was also very big, a nice shower and sink. There was even a telephone in the bathroom. The Aveda products were a nice compliment. The hotel hasan Affinia Fresh promotion where they give you toothpaste, razors, mouthwash, eye solution, etc. free of charge. The location was very nice in Murry Hill. Nice on the east side close to Macys and the Empire State Building. There was a Murry Hill Market right next to the hotel. They sold convienence items and really nice flowers outside that were extremely cheap. We would have bought so many, except we flew into JFK. We found that walking everywhere was the best way to get around, but if you are tired of walking, then take a taxi. They were really cheap to the hotel and very fast. We took the bus twice, but we waited a while for the to come around, and waited more to try to find out what bus to take. We booked the City Sights NY tour (The Blue Buses) and took the tour of downtown. They picked us up at the Empire State Building, about 4 blocks west. Also Macys is a stop where you could catch the bus. The tour guides were very nice and helpful on the buses. We saw the bigger sights of NYC like Rockefeller Center and Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty and all of the neighborhoods like Little Italy and Chinatown (Hated Chinatown). The negative thing about the hotel was that we booked through hotels.com and it was $162. The hotel tried to charge us $212. We fought for an hour and called hotels.com and we called hotels.com and they were very helpful and got us the $162 price. Then we paid, and the women at the front desk tried to not give us a reciept. Other than this minor price problem, the hotel was nice. I would definatly stay here again, but the only other hotel I would stay at is the Sheraton in Times Square, because it looked nicer, and about the same standard regular price as this hotel. I would stay were again because of the rooms and amenities.  
<Date>Jun 18, 2007

<Author>mikeacfla
<Content>This place is Fantastic! Everything it was cracked up to be and more! Commence with the rambling.... Got an early check in and late check out. People were all very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent close to lots of restaurants and the subway to get you anywhere. It was in a neighborhood where people live and walk their dogs which made us felt very safe. The bed was SOOOO comfortable and the shower....the shower. Best shower EVER!!! It's worth the price of admission alone. The place was sparkling clean. They let us use the spa to freshen up since we had a late flight. You're able to print your boarding passes at their computer in the lobby. Nice fruit and iced tea at the front desk. What was most amazing was the fact that this hotel was about the same price as some very dumpy places, which will remain nameless. Highly recommend; would definitely love to stay here again.

<Author>CoTravelsalot
<Content>great hotel and great location We recently stayed at the Affinia Dumont for a family vacation - 11 of us - it was a great choice. <Author>ccollins0822
<Content>Great value plus a menu of pillow choices We booked this hotel for a weekend getaway in Manhattan. The location is perfect -- walking distance from all the sights. Our 36th floor room was very large, with a comfortable bed, great view, nice Aveda soaps, and a pillow menu of 5 complimentary pillow choices. Yes, it's a gimmick, but it's unique. We had a kitchen, but didn't get to use it because there are so many nice restaurants nearby. The front desk staff were very good. I called ahead and arranged for champagne in our room on arrival, and the concierge took care of it and added a fruit plate too!One problem we had was that 3 movies appeared on our bill, but we didn't even use the TV. (Who wants to watch tv on a weekend in Manhattan!) 2 of them were before 8am on Saturday, when, of course, we were asleep. It took an unfortunate amount of pleading with the desk and skeptical looks from the staff before they removed them from the bill -- it wasn't a nice way to leave, feeling as though they didn't believe us.Overall, I'd come back here. Expensive yes, but given the competition in New York, I think this place offers great value for your money.  
<Date>Jun 11, 2007
<Rating>5	5	5	4	5	4	5	3

<Author>beach47
<Content>very nice hotel We stayed at his hotel for 3 days at the beginning of June. Since there were 5 of us, we booked the 2 bd, 2 bth suite, and we were very pleased. It is an extremely clean hotel, the staff is friendly, and the location is decent (it's about 4-5 blocks from the Empire State Bldg). I cannot say enough good things about the room. It was a 2 bd apt pretty much, and it had lots of privacy in the bedrooms. Everything about it was very convenient, and we had a view of the Chrysler bldg! The only thing that we did not like was the room service. It was not good. We ordered the first day, but after that steered clear. However, there are a ton of shops right around the place and starbucks 2 blocks down, so it wasn't a problem. Plus, if you wanted to bring carryout back, you can warm it up in the microwave. I would highly recommend this hotel.

<Author>Montagneny
<Content>A great small hotel On my way home from picking up my daughter at a New England college to head back to the Carolinas we took four days in New York City with my younger 9-year old daughter and a family adult friend. The four of us were extremely surprised to see how roomy and comfortable our two-bedroom suite was!The Affinia really got it right with cleanliness, spaciousness, quietness and bed comfort. These are the most comfortable beds, and what a relief for tired travelers!Check-in was a breeze, the doormen always welcoming and so charming; my daughters LOVED them! Breakfast at the Barking Dog restaurant (adjacent to hotel) was good (have the waffles and fruit) and later at night we had drinks and desserts there too (very good!!) We did not have a very high-level floor(18th) and even though we faced 34th street the room was VERY quiet. Don't complain if you don't have a great view because this hotel offers so very much more in spaciousness, comfort and quiet. Murray Hill is a nice safe residential neighborhood with great little restaurants and also good little grocery stores within a two minute walk. I was so glad I did not choose a hotel on Times Square (I almost did!) because I now realize that you just walk into a mob scene on the square when you come out of a hotel there. It is a constant flow and sea of humanity. I would not have wanted to start or end my day with my family this way. This will be my only hotel choice when we return to spend some time in the Big Apple again. We recommend this without hesitation!!  
<Date>Jun 7, 2007

<Content>Fantastic Stay! As travelers to New York for the first time - we booked this hotel solely on the reviews listed here. My daughter's dream vacation was to travel to New York - (a college graduation gift)The Affinia Dumont exceeded our expectations. Staff was upbeat, friendly, and helpful. Our room was large, clean and the beds were fantastic. After a long day of seeing all of New York the thought of a comfortable bed and not to mention the pillow menu choices made all the difference. The deli on the corner was a great place to pick up breakfast items as the kichenette had a refridgerator, microwave, coffee maker and stove - with all the cooking and eating utensils. The room was quiet and we noted how good it smelled when we arrived. ( usually I pack a travel candle to freshen the room - needless to say it didn't leave my suitcase!) We do plan on re-visiting New York and we WILL book our stay at the Affinia Dumont. I would highly recommend this hotel for your stay while in New York

<Author>Christy1
<Content>Fantastic! A truly fantastic place to stay, especially for the price we paid (less than $200 by booking far in advance on the hotel's website. Prices went up significantly closer to our date of stay). The fabulous staff let us check in at 8 am, which was SO appreciated after a red-eye flight, and when there was a slight problem with our key, they sent up a bottle of wine to compensate us for the whole 5 minutes we spent with the bad key! That was above and beyond what was necessary. Our room also had a nice view, which I didn't expect, but since the hotel isn't buried in a sea of skyscrapers, I think most upper level rooms would have a view.Everyone else has raved about all of the things I would rave about, so I'll mention some different stuff. First, I loved the location. It was close to a subway line so getting around was easy. It was in a nice neighborhood-Murray Hill-rather than in an overly touristy location like Times Square (not an Olive Garden or TGIFriday's in sight here!). The location made it very easy to get to the Lower East Side or Greenwich Village by cab for going out for dinner/drinks at night-it was a way cheaper and faster cab ride than if we'd stayed in the heart of Midtown. It was also easier to get up to the shopping of Midtown East or the Upper East Side. You can walk to Penn Station. The rooms have kitchens, and there is a great little market just a few doors down where you can buy groceries. For breakfast, skip the hotel restaurant, but go to Daniel's bagels, just a few blocks north on 3rd. They make egg sandwiches and all sorts of bagels, and it's a real locals place to go.I will definitely stay here again, even if I have to pay much more for the room.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2007

<Author>starseeker59
<Content>What an amazing hotel! While in town for the night with colleagues representing TripAdvisor.com at the 11th annual Webby awards I was delighted to stay at the Affinia Dumont. Upon arriving in the room, it was so massive I at first did not notice the small kitchen enclave located near the living room area. Wow!I must admit I hadn't been in such a fine hotel room before. The bedroom was massive with really really fine lighted closets and an in-closet safe. There was a wall-mounted tv in the bedroom, and another tv in the living area along with a nice office space and Aeron chair.Although everything seemed quite perfect, i must admit i was a bit surprised by the bathroom! There were so many hand rails in the shower/tub area along with two movable mirrors (one outside of the shower, and one inside) that i felt like i was some metal cattle prodding area. =/I didn't stay in the room more then a couple hours altogether, but I'd love to stay there again. The view outside the room isn't much too look at, but the decor inside is quite nice. If you're willing to check out the room - it is room 501. I had a friend stay on the 35th floor and his view of the river was spectacular (he had a corner suite). Very nice!

<Author>Xocoafan
<Content>Why go elsewhere? As a suburbanite who indulges in overnight NYC stays, I have tried at least 25 Manhattan hotels. While I ordinarily prefer a location in the west 'fifties, I got a very fair price for the Affinia Dumont on Expedia, and based on other Trip Advisor reviews, we decided to try it for my husband's birthday weekend. I will from now on always try this hotel first! The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. The room (on the 34th floor) was very roomy by NYC standards. The bed was comfortable, and there was even a pillow menu one could use. The full kitchen was so convenient for storing odd items we picked up en route to the hotel at the Grand Central food hall, and for making morning tea and coffee with real (as opposed to powdered) milk. We had a fabulous view of the Chrysler building lit up at night. The look was fresh and contemporary. I must mention that when I booked I mentioned that this was for a birthday weekend and requested a quiet room. Imagine how surprised we were to find a welcoming note directing us to an ice cream cake in the freezer! We found that it was a short, four dollar cab ride to the theater district, which certainly made this un-touristy (for museums and theater, anyway) location perfectly convenient. I can't imagine why one would choose to pay two or three times as much elsewhere. Great lodgings!  
<Date>Jun 4, 2007

<Author>SexySim
<Content>Fanastic , Wonderful and Simply the Best !! England Travellers What can I say from the moment we arrived at the Affinia Dumont i knew i was going to the love the place. Reception was lovely and check in was easy . The receptionist knew from my emai that this holiday was for my husband as we were celebrating his 40Th birthday. We had a room with a view being on the 30th floor room number 3004. Once wev entered our room the first thing i said was WOW it was wonderfully BIG, clean and perfect. My husband had a card and bottle of wine for his birthday which we had not expected . The location was great easy 10 - 15 mins walk to Macys and other shops. You can use the subways safely with no hassle. We even walked to Times Square which is further so wear good walking shoes. The people love our English Accent and we loved theirs as well. The Barking Dog next door to the Affinia was great maybe a dollar or so more than Murray Hill but i would say they are both the same. The portion sizes are really big so only ate half the amount but the food taste so nice you want to eat it all. ( i was trying not to over eat as you could easily do it ). We went to see Color Purple with Fantasia from American Idol the show was outstanding a must to see if you have ever seen the film. The BUS Tours are great as you can hop on and off but mostly good for sight seeing. We went to a Baseball game which was more for my husband who loves sport. If you intend to go to Ground Zone I would suggest you stay on the Tour Bus as there really is not anything to see as it is hidden with a covered fence which surrounds it so you can not see anything. Visit the Empire State Building at night you get to see the city all lit up. The bus tour at night to Brooklyn was good and everywhere is lit up but take a cardigan or jacket as it is very breezy up the top at night. As a suggestion get some New York passes as you get into alot of attractions for free and this will save you loads of money .  Anyway go to the Affinia Dumont you will not be disappointed and use common sense as your safety and you will not go wrong. The Reviews are the best thing to go by and I made the right choice to stay. Donald at the door was a good help for information great guy.

<Author>musicsj
<Content>My Affinity for the Affinia The Affinia Dumont is a great hotel in a great location. I am from New York and go to NYC at least once a year, and I will definitely stay at the Affinia Dumont again (I stayed 12 nights this time). The hotel lobby is quaint and well-decorated, and you can listen to iPods built into the lobby chairs. Everybody is very friendly and they are always telling you to Be Well, which is their slogan. There is so much to do on 3rd Ave. and everything is easily accessible from the hotel. I stayed in a 2 room suite with my father. He had a nice room with a King bed, and I slept on a very comfortable Queen pullout. The room was just under 600 sq. feet, and it had a kitchen with everything you need (stove, dishwasher, frig, etc.). The room was definitely a converted apartment because I felt like I was at home the whole stay. The one downside, and it is very, very minor, is that I had to share a bathroom. I used the kitchen sink sometimes to brush my teeth, etc. We had a nice room with a view of the East river, and there were TVs in both rooms. The one channel that is missing on the TV is Bloomberg TV, which I believe is a necessity for business travelers. That's subjective. The maids were very friendly and attentive and our rooms were always spotless. The manager, Dave, is a very nice guy, and he made a our stay great. On the 2nd level, there is a Fitness and Spa, which have everything you need. I worked out a few times and it was perfect. Each treadmill/elliptical has its own TV screen. All in all, I had a great time at the Affinia (difficult to say since I am a Hilton Honors member - I have stayed at the Doubletree Suites, The Waldorf and the Millennium Hilton, and although the Hilton rooms are great, they are not as good as the Affinia in my opinion.) I am going to find out if the Affinia Dumont has a rewards program because I would like to stay there again and again...Seth  
<Date>May 31, 2007

<Author>zardoz
<Content>A good option but not cheap The hotel has a pleasant midtown location (34th between Lexington and 3rd Avenues). The area immediately near the hotel is pretty uninteresting but it seemed safe to me.The #6 train is about 5 minutes walk away, the Empire state building about 10 minutes and Macys about 15 minutes.The staff were very courteous and helpful. The hotel has a gym and spa if you like that kind of thing.What I liked was the well equipped kitchen which allowed us to make meals, keep cold beer in the room etc. We still went out for meals but it was goos to have somewhere to make snacks and drinks etc.There is a market almost next to the hotel and a pharmacy on the same block.There are cheaper places to stay but then again you could save a lot by preparing meals in your kitchen and maybe just eating out once per day (because you MUST experience eating out in New York)The selection of restuarants near the hotel is not that great (but Jaiya Thai is good) but you are a 10 minute subway ride from the East/West Village, Tribeca, Soho etcEnjoy New York baby!  
<Date>May 30, 2007

<Author>antitan
<Content>First Class The service, location and welcome in this hotel is fantastic. We had booked using [----] and got a brilliant deal even cheaper than quikbook! I emailed the hotel directly to request a large corner roomwith a great view and on arrival thats exactly what we received on the 32nd floor looking directly over to the Chrysler building with fab views of the east river. The room was very large and extremely comfortable and had the biggest bed ever and so comfortable which wasjust what we needed after all the walking. The kitchenette was a bonus - with all you needed: very large fridge, with mini bar inside and a daily supply of tea and fresh coffee, we didnt cook as it wasso cheap to eat out. We went to Eee's Cafe (turn left and cross over outside the hotel and its just over the lights on the right hand side)[----] every morning for the breakfast special egg on anybagel with coffee for $1.95, which was excellent and strictly Kosher and altogether so much nicer that Starbucks!!! We also bought fresh fruit for morning at the Murray Hill Deli on the corner.The staff at the Dumont were very friendly and courteous arranging taxis for us and providing us with maps for our stay. The Affinia is 5 mins from the Empire State Building and about 10 mins from Maceys.It is situated in a residential area just off Lexington Ave (near Opus Dei Headquarters - Da Vinci Code !!and was really safe and and pleasant to walk around during the day and in the evening. We would definately recommend this hotel and will stay again when we decide to visit New York . Stay at the Affinia you will not be dissapointed!!!

<Author>AdventureRUs
<Content>best we've stayed in new york It's very clear that the staff and management really care, so rare these days. We were extremely pleased with the room, the view, the service, the attitude of the staff, all of them! This is the kind of service we always want, but rarely get. The beds were comfortable, rooms, including bathroom, clean. The little amenities in the room brought a smile to my face....the disposable camera, the yoga cards--it's clear that someone was really thinking about what the guest might want. We also enjoyed having breakfast brought up from the Barking Dog next door, the quickest room service ever! However, what was advertised as a 200 calorie breakfast had bacon and more added on. (But perhaps they have discovered that what people order is not what they really want!)We would return here in a minute. For the price, it was a real bargain. We had a corporate discount so did not pay the full advertised rate. Location was perfect too. Always a taxi passing by with the Metro stop just a block up the street.

<Author>CaroleS
<Content>Fabulous Affinia Dumont The service, location and welcome in this hotel is fantastic. <Author>StockportBear
<Content>Fab Hotel and Location - Pam, Stockport UK We were recommended The Affinia Dumont by friends and were so glad we stayed there. We stayed for 5 nights and thought the hotel was great. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and offered great advice on trips and subways etc. Our room was lovely and spacious with a fantastic view of The Chrysler building and the small kitchenette area with fridge was so handy. The rooms are very comfortable and clean with fresh towels and Aveda toiletries each day. We really liked the Murray Hill district as it was away from the main hussle and bussle but within walking to most areas with The Empire State, Macy's and 5th Avenue just 3-5 blocks away. The subways are also close by too. (We stayed in the Upper West during our last stay 3 years ago which was very nice but found we it was so far away we had to get cabs everywhere so loved being able to walk most places this time).The Barking Dog bar and restaurant which is connected to the hotel has a great atmosphere with fab food and staff, we didn't eat breakfast here though as there are so many deli's close by where you can grab a coffee and breakfast.We loved our stay in New York and would definately stay at The Affinia Dumont again.  
<Date>May 14, 2007

<Author>merrymerry
<Content>Loved the Affinia Dumont We stayed at the Affinia Dumont from Friday May 4th to Monday May 7th. We don't have a single complaint about this hotel. From the moment we arrived we were treated as though it was a priviledge for them to have us stay at their hotel. They couldn't have been more accomodating. Our room and especially the bathroom was very clean (that's a really big thing to us). The bed lives up to its claim as being custom designed, we always felt very rested in the morning. In fact I almost slept better there than in my own bed at home. We didn't take advantage of the fitness room or room service so we can't speak to those issues. It was our first time in New York and we loved it, but after a day of sightseeing it was always nice to return to the less hectic neighborhood of Murry Hill where the hotel is located. Everyday we would stop in at The Barking Dog restaurant attached to the Affinia and get coffee and a lite bite or the fabulous cheesecake. Again, the treatment at The Barking Dog is every bit as welcoming as at the hotel. We would absolutely recommend this hotel.  
<Date>May 10, 2007

<Author>Bluemantraveller
<Content>Great location The Affinia Dumont is in a very good location in the Murray Hill area of New York and it is within easy reach of many of the main attractions - only about 4 blocks from the Empire State Building. We chose this hotel following lots of research - particularly the reviews on tripadvisor.com. Overall we were not disappointed as the rooms are very spacious (particularly for New York), the location is very good and the check in/out was very easy and the concierge was excellent. The rooms also had a kitchen area which you don't usually find in New York. The Barking Dog cafe/ restaurant next door served excellent food and we usually had breakfast or lunch in there. The hotel is excellent value for money although the decoration is a little shabby and the lobby area rather dark. However, as long as you are not expecting 4 or 5 star luxury (which you will pay for in New York), you will not be disappointed. Overall there can be no complaints and I would recommend this hotel.  
<Date>May 3, 2007

<Author>VeeBeeUK
<Content>Not so bad, but not so good . . . You need to look past the hotel's slightly faded decor to appreciate the comfortable beds and spectacular view. The staff were friendly, if not always particularly efficient, and we found the hotel to be wonderfully located - less than a five min walk from the Empire State and less than ten from Grand Central and the Chrysler Building. Our 24th room floor didn't look out to the Empire or the Chrysler, but we did have a wonderful dual view of East River and Lex. I was, however, a little doubtful of the cleanliness; although the bedding and bathroom were clean, the kitchenette looked somewhat neglected and we had to wipe down the counter tops ourselves - not great.Mini-bar and sundries were OUTRAGEOUSLY expensive and not worth it. Pop to the market on the corner and stock up before you use anything there! Also have to second the Murray Hill Diner; gorgeous breakfasts and very reasonably priced. We did not eat at the Barking Dog, but did take in a drink there. We'd stay again, but more for the location that the hotel itself.  
<Date>May 2, 2007

<Author>crabby_traveler
<Content>Great Hotel Booked this hotel based on the reviews on this site. Couldn't have been more pleased.The staff was very friendly, made sure that we had the maps of the city that we required.There was a slight mixup on the rooms, had booked a king, but it came through as two doubles. The staff were very prompt in sorting it out, gave us a king on the 37th floor. Very nice views of the city from there.I would recommend it to anyone looking for a centrally located hotel.It is a block from the subway line, and within walking distance to the Empire state builidng. We walked up 5th to Central Park - long walk, but we could have taken the subway if we wished. We also took the subway down to Battery Park to visit the Statue of Liberty. Not a bad ride. Everywhere we wanted to be in less than 20 minutes of travel.We would stay there next time we visit NYC.

<Author>patmarietta8
<Content>Home Away from Home Used Trip Advisor's reviews and this hotel was highly recommended and rightly so! It lived up to all the excellent reviews that it had received. We came for a family vacation over spring break- March 31st to April 6th. We booked a one bedroom suite. My teenage daughterenjoyed sleeping on the pull out couch in the living room area and myhusband, son and I slept in the bedroom with two queen beds. Even before arriving, I contacted the concierge and she was able to help us book tickets to see Wicked. Those tickets are very hard to come by. As promised the tickets were waiting for us when we arrived. We really enjoyed the show! The Wicked show was amazing! Back to the hotel.The staff all seem to take pride in making you feel welcome and go out of their way to be helpful. It is interesting to note thatthe hotel has a poster on the coffee table in the lobby- proclaiming their popularity in Trip Advisor.com and they certainly aim to take wonderful care of you. The hotel was spotlessly clean, sheets fresh every day. We enjoyed wonderful breakfasts at the Barking dog- everything was delicious and usually accompanied by lots of fresh fruit salad. There was some wonderful restaurants close by- we tried the Thai restaurant, a Greek restaurant and Italian. The minimarket close by was very handy. We found we were glad not to by so close to the hustle and bustle of Times Square. We could take a taxi to that area when we needed to be in that area- but found the area near the hotel to be more restful- still busy, but not being swept off your feet busy. We also found our room to be very quiet- could not hear our neighbors at all. Highly recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay here again.

<Author>noddie11
<Content>quiet oasis My husband stayed at the Affinia for our first visit to New York, having chosen it due to good reviews on Trip Advisor.We arrived quite late and were met by a very courteous and friendly reception staff.Unfortunately the pillow menu was all used up and we had to make do with standard, but the next night we had buckwheat and I am now trying to locate one for home!As it was late I did forget to request a high floor and so we had a room on the 13th floor with not much of a view. However as we were out a lot it wasn't an issue.It was remarkably quiet at night.The room was medium size with a kitchen( slightly superfluous to our needs) and a good sized bathroom with large bath.We had a king sized bed that was very comfortable and a large desk. Plenty of cupboard space and loads of hangars.Everything was spotlessly clean with plenty of towels and regularly replaced toiletries.Staff were helpful and provided maps and information.The location was good being a short walk from the subway, and five to ten minutes from Empire State and Macy's. We ate breakfast at the Deli just across the road.I would definately stay here again.

<Author>keep_on_runnin'
<Content>Great location, great service We stayed here in March 2007. I picked Affinia following an excellent stay in one of their other hotels in NYC. The hotel itself was again at a very high standard. The Service was better here than in the other Affinia, although this isn't to say that the other one was bad, it wasn't. This hotel's service was excellent. The concierge were extremely friendly and their recommendations were spot on. The room was great, plenty of space and as usual very tidy with a lovely decor. The only problem I had here was that although the door that joined us to the room next door had been sealed we could still hear every conversation that our neighbours had. The door might aswell have not been there.We arrived late in the evening and headed straight for the Barking dog cafe next door. They were happy to serve us and the food was excellent.The hotel is in an excellent location and once again the price of the hotel was extremely cheap.Thanks again Affinia.

<Author>sp_gala
<Content>definitely can't complain I agree with the other reviews that the hotel was of high quality and service. The front desk (and bellhops) were courteous and helpful. We asked for a top floor room with a view and they definitely satisfied our request.Being a 'fitness-oriented' hotel there was quite the 'fresh' smell that welcomes you everytime you enter. Never used the gym but was well-equipped.Our corner room was spacious with a kitchen, desk and great view. It was clean and orderly with modern furniture. The bed was a bit soft for my liking. The bathroom was more than adequate but starting to show signs of wear and tear. However the water pressure was excellent. The hotel was quiet and never heard any of the neighbors. (maybe I was lucky).The location is good, close to the Empire, 5th Ave etc. Overall it was a great hotel so recommendable to everybody.For any 1st time vistors to NYC that don't know, I highly recommend to book tickets in advance for all tourist related sights and events in order to avoid the long queues you find everywhere. One risks wasting a lot of time waiting in line for tickets if not purchased before hand.

<Author>anniefield
<Content>Roomy oasis Myself, partner and two sons stayed here for five nights 22-27 March. We had a room with a king bed on the 33rd floor and my sons had a twin on the 37th floor. Both rooms had spectacular views, comfortable beds, decent sized bathrooms and well equipped kitchens each with full size cooker, huge fridge freezer,microwave,toaster,coffee maker,pots,pans,dishes etc. Although we did not use these facilities, apart from making the odd cup of tea, a lot of people seemed to be using them. There is a twenty four hour deli a few yards from the hotel and I saw many people arriving back at the hotel in the evening looking exhausted from a day sightseeing with bags from the deli ready just to rustle something up in the room.Also opposite there is a twenty four hour Duane Reade pharmacy where you can get all your toiletries.There are many restaurants and bars within minutes of the hotel making this an ideal base. We will most definately stay here again.  
<Date>Apr 3, 2007

<Author>mhugs
<Content>Great location restaurant does a lovely breakfast We travelled to NYC for the St Patricks day parade and after a lot of research chose to stay at this hotel. We were not disappointed the rooms were a great size and very clean, all of the services were excellent, we had requested a high floor which we did not get but it was a busy weekend so fair dos, our view was of nothing really except the back of buildings. We did not spend a lot of time in our room so it wasnt a problem.The only thing I would say is that we flew into Newark and asked the hotel to arrange for a limo to pick us up, my 13 year old niece was most upset when we got an suv. We were charged $150 for this excluding tips (a little high we all thought). We had arranged a bus trip for the next morning and had to be at Time Square the next morning for 8.30am, as none of us had a clue where to go we asked the hotel to arrange a taxi for us. Once again we had the same driver who picked us up from the airport in the suv, this journey took at the most 8-10 minutes and is approx 1mile, the charge this time was $50, I was astounded and questioned the price, the driver spoke poor english and we had no choice but to pay. When we returned to the hotel I complained and they were extremly dismissive and advised that this would be correct as it is classed as a town car. Do not use the car service without confirming the price.The barking dog next door to the hotel is amazing warm, cosy, quick and fabulous food we ate breakfast there every morning.

<Author>LondonJoJo76
<Content>A great hotel in bustling Manhattan I stayed in the Affinia Dumont at the start of March for 7 nights with my husband. It was our first time in New York so I spent quite a long time choosing a hotel before we arrived in the city. I picked the Affinia after reading all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. As we were staying for 7 nights I managed to get a better rate than on expedia by booking directly with the hotel's website on their weekly rate. By doing this I managed to book a junior suite for the same price as I would have paid for a standard room on Expedia.We arrived at the hotel quite late and found that although I had requested a room with a view we were only on the 13th floor. I was told to check again in the morning as a room on a higher level might become available, which I did, and we were moved to a room on the 23rd floor which had a great view of the Chrysler building and the East river etc. The only slight niggle is that the room that we were moved to smelt quite strongly of cigarette smoke, which I found quite strange for a no smoking hotel. We left the windows open when we out each day so that when we got back the room smelt a lot fresher. We decided that the view in the room was too good to give up!!In terms of the facilities in the hotel, it was great to have a kitchen area. There were some days when we walked so much in the city that all we wanted to do was come back to the hotel room and collapse and for that the room was ideal. The kitchen was well stocked with cups, plates, cutlery etc. There was also a cooker and microwave but we didn't really use those. It would be possible to cater for yourself the entire holiday given the equipment available if you wanted.The bathroom was a good size with a bath which was long enough to lie down in (I've heard this isn't always the case in New York!). The bed was huge and very comfortable and we had a desk and arm chair and sofa in the room as well which came in handy.There isn't a bar area attached to the hotel but this wasn't really a problem. There are so many bars / restaurants that are a 2 min walk away from the Affinia that it didn't inconvenience us.We both found the staff at the Affinia very friendly and helpful and the cleaning of the rooms was of a high standard.All in all, we had a great trip to New York. Would definitely recommend the Affinia Dumont if you want to stay in central Manhattan. It is ideally located .... just a short bus ride away or 20 mins walk and you are in the centre of the city.Minus points: room smelling slightly of smoke and having to come home!!  
<Date>Mar 23, 2007

<Author>mrspepperami
<Content>Great base for New York trip As first time visitors to New York we wanted a decent hotel, close to the main attractions that we could base ourselves in for the week we were visiting New York City. We have used Trip Advisor on several occasions for recommendations and again we were not disappointed!Our hotel room was a junior suite on the 27th floor with great views of the Manhattan skyline, especially looking out at the Chrysler building lit up at night. The room itself was great with more than enough space for the two of us. The king side bed was extremely comfortable, by the end of the week it was pretty hard to get out of!! While the kitchen was on the small side there was more than enough room to prepare breakfast in the morning, make a cuppa upon returning in the evening and having a fridge to store some beers in meant you weren't dipping into the mini-bar!The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We messed up our booking dates (totally our faults) and the front desk staff sorted it out within minutes. The cleaning staff also deserve a mention as the room was spotless on our arrival and throughout the stay.Manhattan is easy to get around once you get your bearings. The Empire State building and Macys are a 10min walk down the street, with Penn Station just a little further down. We tended to walk a lot but there is a subway station (Line 6) one block away on 33rd street (one going uptown and one downtown on opposite sides of the road) and a good bus service around the corner that goes cross-town the length of 34th street. A $10 metro card will get you 6 trips on either the bus or subway. Failing that the doormen are always on call to hail you a cab (expensive during peak time, but not so much at night). Like other reviewers we hired a limo to get us back to the airport in Newark ?a bit overpriced at $80 but it included a tip and tolls.We ate in both the Barking Dog (the special pork chops were really good) and Thai restaurant (recommend the green curry) either side and both meals were good. We also got some food from the Murray Hill store/deli to take back with us to the apartment which was also quite reasonable. On one of our lazier nights we rounded the corner onto 3rd avenue to a number of pubs/clubs with some good nightlife. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in New York and I have no doubt that the comfort, cleanliness and location of the hotel contributed to this. We would definetly recommend it!  
<Date>Mar 6, 2007

<Author>gartoon
<Content>Believe every word you read! We have just returned to the UK from our 4 day/5 night trip to NYC and this was our chosen hotel. (a full trip report will appear later when i have caught up). From the moment our taxi pulled up outside the hotel and we were met by a smiling Chris on the door, to the early morning call on the last day to tell us our ride to JFK was waiting outside, we have nothing but praise. We booked a junior suite and were on the corner of the 26th floor with a view from one side up Manhattan towards the Chrysler and on the other towards the East River. We were visiting for my wifes birthday and i had casually mentioned that when booking last November - and on arrival there was a card, complimentary wine and fruit. The room was huge and the bed lovely and comfortable - in the mornings we raised the curtains, propped up the pillows and with that first cup of coffee, watched the sun rise over the East River skyline. Admittedly the bathroom was a little dinky but more than adequate. As for location - as everyone else has said you are on E34th street but we found it to be the ideal place. It was fairly quiet (as much as NYC can be) 5 mins from ESB, 5-10 from GCT and the Chrysler, 10 mins from Macys and 15-20 from Times Square. There are loads of places to eat and drink within a 10 minute walk (Sarges is just around the corner on 3rd and Keens Steakhouse a light stroll away). You also have the 24 hour deli/market a couple of doors away or a Starbucks within 3-4 mins. All in all a great place to stay and we will definately return.  
<Date>Mar 5, 2007

<Author>ROSIEW
<Content>Lived up to the reviews When we planned our trip to New York, we looked at the reviews of a lot of hotels and this one came out tops. We've just spent 4 nights there and have to say that we couldn't have wished for a better place to stay. From the moment we arrived, the staff were friendly and helpful, as were all the people we met in New York, contrary to what we'd been told by friends who'd told us to expect offhand, unfriendly people.We'd asked for a room with a view of the Chrysler Building, but none of these came with 2 queen beds, so we were given a really large corner room on the 26th floor, with a great view of the river. It was wonderful to see the sun rise over the buildings each morning.We didn't use the Barking Dog diner but did have breakfast in the Murray Hill diner, just around the corner. It's spotless, with great food and service, so give it try.We also took advice from previous travellers on this site and booked a limo to take us to the airport - much nicer than a cab and not much more expensive when you add in the tolls on the cab drive.We had a wonderful trip overall in this spectacular city and when we return, it will definitely be to the Affinia Dumont.

<Author>parrotts
<Content>Fantastic hotel, Good for Children We took our two boys to NYC  stayed in Affinia Dumont. It is in a great area, Murray Hill - not right in a busy area, but close enough to walk to most things ie: Empire state 5 mins, Macys 7 mins, Times Square 15 mins. Grand Central 5 mins. Lots of good diners, delis  restaurants - the Barking Dog next door is also well priced and does good food- burgers, wraps, pasta, salads. We stayed in a Queen Studio - plenty of room, two good sized beds, kitchenette - very comfortable, modern, clean, quiet.Staff were very friendly  happy they paid the boys lots of attention. The concierge staff were great, lots of good, relevant information  always had time to chat.This hotel is marketed as an executive business hotel but I think it makes an excellent base for a family base hotel. Its a great place !!

<Author>AgnieszkaChicago
<Content>Clean *and* Perfect for Travel with Pets My husband and I not only want to stay at clean hotels but also are members of the House Rabbit Society and proud owners of two wonderful, free-roaming bunnies. We travel with our pets often, and found that it's very difficult to find a pet-friendly hotel that is sparkling clean, luxurious (given our middle-class budget), smells well, and has a very comfortable bed. But after staying at Affinia this December, we've found our favorite hotel! We'll never stay anywhere else when we're in NYC. Why? Perfect Mannhattan location; super-comfortable bed with a matress that comforts to your body; no problem for our pets to roam free; quiet; super friendly staff; fantastic fitness center; very clean; a 24-hour grocery store less than a block away.

<Author>VermontPeppergirl
<Content>Affinity Dumont will amaze you if you have ever stayed in other NYC hotels. This place was incredible! I can't believe the price, less than half other hotels' single rooms for a junior suite! There was not a single smell in the room (my pet peave), the room was huge with a kitchen  sitting area. Great view on the 21st floor through the many windows in the room. Room service was lightening fast and food was great. Lots of treats in the room (for a charge, but still great to have). The staff was so friendly and regular. The cleaning woman was sweet as can be. Valet parking. I hear they have a great gym though we didn't use it, and a great restaurant. There is a deli just next door to get juice, coffee, cakes, sandwiches. And lots of restaurants nearby. We can't wait to go back. We usually stay aroung 42nd street and 5th, but that is so congested and noisy at night. This area was really nice and quiet and near the East River too. Oh, and the best part? There were these really bright reading lights over each side of the bed for us baby boomers who need lots of light to read! The whole room was well lighted with dimmers. (I am so tired of these dark hotel rooms!) Oh, the other best part? They are pet friendly! I can't believe it! Everything you could possibly want in a hotel. We were toying with the idea of getting an apartment in the city but now we think it would be nicer and less expensive to just stay at the Affinity Dumont when we go down. You will NOT be disappointed.

<Author>HburgTraveler
<Content>Exceeded Expectations My wife and I and our daughter stayed this past weekend at the Affinia Dumont. We decided to book the room there after reading all of the terrific reviews others had given it. We were in a one bedroom suite on the 31st floor. We had a great view of the Chrysler Building, and the East River. Location was just good, not great. But if you are up for a little walking, it takes just a few minutes to get to Macy's, Times Square, Fifth Avenue, Empire State Building, etc. The room was large, bathroom very large and very clean. Very nice small kitchen, would save you a lot of money by not having to eat out for all of your meals. We visit the city a couple of times a year, and we would definitely stay at this hotel again. The best hotel we have stayed in at NYC.

<Author>ukhappytravels
<Content>So Much Space I have been meaning to do this review for a while so it's a little late......We loved the Affinia, we were on a budget but wanted to push it a little bit to enjoy our stay and not have to worry about the air conditioning breaking down or hearing the neighbour going to the toilet, we were not disappointed, not only could we not hear the neighbours toiletry habits we couldn't even hear the street below, no sirens, nothing!We stayed for 6 days and the main thing about this hotel was the space and comfort. It was the largest room I have stayed in in all my mid budget travels. It had a kitchen which came in handy with our budget, the bathroom was modern with great complementaries (even mouth wash). It was the best night sleep I have had in a hotel ever, it was hard to drag myself out of it some mornings. We had a large desk that doubled as a dining table with internet connections and all the mod cons. The location was perfect (5 mins max to the empire state, great restaurants and bars in any direction and metro/trains)The staff were very friendly and helpful and were prompt and efficient, it was the world cup and the cleaning lady has loads of insight into the world cup teams, my boyfriend would get updates from her on the games he missed due to too much sight seeing.We did the typical sightseeing things, we got on the double decker buses that toured around Manhattan, the tickets lasted for two days and doubled as a taxi ride to our favourite places as we could jump on and off as we pleased. There was a torrential rain while we were there in the middle off summer and it was great fun sitting on the top deck in our rain coats and under our brollies while water rushed beneath our feet flooding the below decks, everyone was laughing or crying, it was great fun. We just jumped off when we saw something that looked interesting and jumped back on when we were ready.We didn't use the hotels restaurant or room service as every morning we would get up go to 'our favourite' cafe, pick up coffee, warm croissants and freshly cut fruit only 1min walk away, grab a paper and go back to the room for a relaxing breakfast. Our kitchen came in handy to store leftovers for later, make that extra cup of coffee or cook up a quick snack if needed. Usually we wouldn't be back to the room till late afternoon / early evening and once there we'd freshen up and go our for dinner at one of the many local restaurants of our choice, we would just walk along until one took our fancy, one night we found and great tapas bar which amazing cocktails and spent the night listening to live music and drinking huge pina colads. The hotel staff were always ready to recommend a bar or restaurant to try, they would grab a cab for us and tell the driver were to go if it was too far to walk.It was such an amazing trip and made even better by the hotel. I've been to New York before and the hotel I had stayed at was clean and tidy but tiny, cramped and rushed. The Affina made New York living fantastic and I cannot recommend it enough!!!  
<Date>Jan 10, 2007

<Author>mohair
<Content>Hot summer bliss We stayed here for our honey moon. The suite was huge, beautifully furnished and very cool - important on a summer visit to the Big Apple. Girls - nice toiletries and a spa on the 2nd floor! Boys huge TVs in every room and a kitchenette with a big beer fridge and dishwasher (which the maid - not wife stacks for you every morning). Location very good - few blocks from Empire State, 5th Avenue and Macy's. Also very close to a few different underground stations - although we mainly walked to help us not feel so bad for eating excessive amounts of food.Very friendly staff - hotel seems to attract both business and leisure travellers. Having stayed in New York a couple of times have never stayed in such comfort without paying double the amount. In a way I'd like to keep it a secret - but I am now pregnant so trips to NY are v unlikely. Enjoy on my behalf!

<Author>mashaf
<Content>Consider booking here carefully I was very disappointed with my experience at Affinia Dumont in mid-December. I had booked a Suite for one night to celebrate my mother's 60th birthday. My parents and I arrived separately and by the time I had gotten to the hotel (running late as always), my parents had been sitting in the lobby for close to 45 minutes because the front desk person said that they wanted to wait for me to arrive to discuss the room. This seemed strange to me, esp. when I had called 2 days earlier to make sure everything was confirmed. When I got to the desk, they said that the room was not ready yet (although it was 20 minutes past check-in time and I had requested an early check-in). So, my tired parents and I sat around the hot lobby for another 30 minutes, when, one of the desk agents announced that our room was not available and could she put us in a standard room? I could not believe that this was happening!!! Esp. on my mother's birthday! I had planned the weekend 2 and a half months in advance to make it special, made all the final confirmations two days ahead of arriving and there were still issues. The desk agent could not explain why the room was unavailable - she actually said I can not explain why this has happened - it just has. The manager did not come out from the back at all during this whole ordeal except to handle the paperwork to finally transfer us to Affinia Manhattan, a hotel of lower quality. Because my parents and I were trying to have a nice time, everyone went with the flow, but I knew my mother was disappointed with the shoddy accommodations at the second Affinia (there was a big stain on the carpet and our room was next to the service entrance). UGH!! It was a truly disappointing experience. The desk agent said that they oversell the hotel ALL THE TIME. So, there are individuals all the time who are turned away due to the hotel's disorganization. I am about to write the hotel company a letter. For over $400 a night, one should expect better service. This is NOT budget travel!!!! Oh, did I mention they comped our parking fee? This provided little relief as the whole ordeal tired all of us out, made us late for our dinner reservations and forced us to rush through a night that was supposed to be a true celebration.

<Author>Lou-and-Chorls
<Content>Loved it. Fab rooms and very friendly staff My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere central to stay but without the hassle of Times Square for New Year. We looked at so many hotels but got a good price direct on the affinia's own website. We had a corner room, so had two huge windows with great views from two sides. The rooms are a very good size, with the kitchen area a huge bonus for the early morning coffee and juice! The bathroom was clean and also a good size, the shower was powerful and the bath nice and deep for a relaxing soak.The staff were friendly and helpful and there was always someone on hand for general questions. Didnt try the Barking Dog restaurant for dinner, but went in for cocktails and coffee, both times the staff were really friendly and the atmosphere relaxed and easy. The food looked great and the prices were very reasonable.No faults at all with this hotel, would gladly recommend and will certainly return.If you are staying for a few days, get a 7 day Metrocard, its $24 (which is about 12.70 right now) and you can travel anytime on any of the subways. This is a great way to get about when your legs are just about to give in.For cheescake try Carnegie Deli, 854 Seventh Ave, at 55th St. The food here is lovely, but HUGE portions, so be careful what you order, although you can always take it out with you if you dont finish it!

<Author>dolphin80
<Content>Great hotel, excellent service, clean room!! My wife and I wanted to stay in NYC for one night from Saturday, December 30th to Sunday, December 31st, 2006. After extensive searching on the internet for a decently priced hotel, we settled on the Affinia Dumont hotel on 34th St. I booked and paid for my reservation through Orbitz.Posted check in time was 3pm. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and asked for early check-in. Sure enough, they had our room ready and allowed us to check-in. We were giving a room on the 25th floor, on the front of the hotel with a gorgeous view of the NYC skyline, especially the Chrysler Building.The room was one of the most spacious I've been in for NYC. To my surprise, the room also had a kitchen, complete with stove, refrigerator, sink, and plenty of counter space. Thats good to know for future reference!! The bathroom was a typical hotel room bathroom, with decent water pressure in the shower. There was also a large desk with an internet connection available if you need to stay connected. Our room also had a very comfortable king-sized bed and a nice 27-inch TV.As for the the location, the hotel is within walking distance to the Empire State, Rockefeller Center, Times Square, Penn Station, Grand Central Station, and St. Patrick's Cathedral. There are several restaurants, delis,  coffee shops in the area. This area of NYC looks very nice as there are a lot of condos and buildings with rooftop gardens.One small complaint that I had is that the room initially smelled like the previous guest was a smoker, even though the rooms are supposed to be smoke free. I guess there are still some inconsiderate folks who choose to smoke in these rooms and ruin it for the next person. However, the windows in the room could be opened, and after a few minutes, the smell dissipated or we got used to it. I wouldn't consider this the hotel's fault though.My wife and I were very happy with this hotel and will definitely use it again if the price is right.  
<Date>Jan 3, 2007

<Author>EdinburghAmanda
<Content>Great for groups, very nice, large clean rooms, good location As a group of 5 ladies who regularly visit NY for December shopping, we were looking for a 2 bedroom apartment that could accomodate us, without having to separate all the time into pairs. We have tried several options in the past, but none has offered the perfect solution provided here. A large king in one bedroom and two Queens in the other, plus a pull down in the sizable lounge was ideal. Kitchen with large fridge freezer definitely a bonus and the sheer space, given the shopping bags was great. Bathrooms large, clean and pleasant. The overall hotel and room feels well turned out.I was worried that the location in midtown was neither close to the uptown shopping or to our preferred eating and drinking locations downtown, I needn't have worried - we found a new area for exploring and the whole area around Macy's, within 10 mins walk, is complete with all the usual shops you would expect to find. Taxi's were a few dollars wherever we wanted to go. The hotel restaurant was fine for breakfast, but we went elsewhere for dinner. On the first night the staff recommended Italian just around the corner was very good.Staff were very helpful and apparently the spa/gym area was small but adequete, our only critisism was the combination of bellman duties and door duties, which meant one person running about trying to deliver bags and catch taxis - they needed to put an extra person on for this.We will definitely visit again.  
<Date>Jan 3, 2007

<Author>Krak
<Content>Practically Everything If you're looking for a romantic boutique, you've come to the wrong place. If you are looking for a clean hotel with excellent service in a fine location, you're there. We stayed for three nights and were able to walk to some wonderful spots like Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and Chelsea. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and we had two meals in our room from the restaurant downstairs. As far as ambiance, unless you're into all of the comforts of home including a kitchenette, large desk, and all of the sporting videos you'd ever want, you may be underwhelmed, but if you are looking for a comfortable, clean room in a nice neighborhood, you won't be disappointed.

<Author>njhlab
<Content>Good, but could have been better I followed the advice of fellow travellers and booked this hotel for a recent weekend shopping trip to New York. Overall I was very happy with my stay and the hotel  room lived up to expectations. However, it could have been better. My flight was delayed so I arrived late on Friday night. No-one showed me up to my room so I was left to try and work out how everything worked in the kitchen myself (never could get the cooker to work). The room was scrupulously clean - probably the best I've yet seen in a New York hotel room - and having a restaurant next door and a 24 hour deli/market on the corner was very handy. Niggles: whilst the restaurant next door (the Barking Dog) serves basic comfort food and is very reasonably priced the service is slow and inefficient. I also used the spa and did not enjoy my massage. The room was so over-air conditioned, with cold air actually blowing on the table, that I froze.

<Author>M & C been there
<Content>If we designed a perfect business hotel, it would be the Affinia Dumont The Affinia Dumont is one of the most well thought out hotels we have ever enjoyed. The two and one-half room suites are large, and comfortable. Everything that you need to live is there...a great full length mirror, coat hooks by the door, effective dimmer reading lights by the bed, a fully functional small kitchenette with stove, refrigerator, microwave and basic accessories. There is a desk with a Herman Miller Aerion chair that is actually comfortable to work at. There are enough easily accesable outlets at the desk for computers, chargers, etc. Comfortable sofa and chairs in the Living roomA large TV ia in the living room and another TV in the Bedroom. There is even a shaving mirror in the shower. The Affinia bed is extremely comfortable and they offer 3 types of pillows: down, hypo-allergenic and temperpedic foam.The bellmen were friendly and helpful, the front desk efficient and accomodating. My only complaint is that they have wired, but not wireless high speed internet.....they have thought of everything else. We will definitely be staying there when we stay in New York from now on.

<Author>Lesley M
<Content>You'd better believe it! We chose this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor - it was rated the 2nd favourite hotel in NY. Having booked it, I then had second thoughts because I'd never heard of it and we've previously stayed in the places like the Waldorf Astoria.On arrival, first impressions were not good - a very small reception area with some tired chairs, it looked more like an office block than an hotel. However, this is the only tiny negative niggle about the whole experience.The staff were unfailingly cheerful and helpful. I requested a room on a high floor (as recommended in one of the reviews) and we were allocated a Junior Suite on the 20th floor. A corner room, it had huge windows on two sides - one with views of the Chrysler Building and one with the sunrise over the East River. The room was huge, well equiped with a huge wardrobe (with an iron and ironing board!), lots of drawer space, a desk area and a seating area. A small kitchen contained a kettle and coffee machine with complimentary tea and cofffee (as well as an oven and microwave).The bed was very comfortable. They have nice linen and a pillow menu offering three very different types of pillow! Despite the large windows the blinds had blackout linings and were very effective at keeping out the light.Despite taking our exercise kit to try out the extensive exercise facilities, we never entered the gym. The 34th Street location of the hotel meant that we could walk to Central Park and Bloomingdales in one direction and Soho and Greenwich village in the other so we had more than enough exercise.Do believe all the reviews - this hotel is a great find. The Junior Suite cost less than a double room in the Paramount which was the size of a small double bed with about 2 feet on each side! We will definitely stay there again. The Affinia Dumont is especially suitable for families and we are recommending it to all of our friends.  
<Date>Dec 1, 2006

<Author>hayleyscomet
<Content>great for families with small children; big rooms Stayed at the Affinia Dumont for a 4-night stay with our 2 year old. The room was very large by NY standards (we booked a Jr Suite) and paid only $185 a night, cheap by NY hotel standards. While our view was non-existent and very loud on the 3rd floor (we had requested a high floor, never got it), loved the kitchen and overall spaciousness. NY friends thought it was niver than most NY apartments! We asked for a crib which they also did not honor but found one for us along with a stroller which made our life easier. Staff as courteous as can be with very helpful doormen who helped hail cabs and even put luggage in the car. Very conveniently located, great restaurants all around. You won't be disappointed!
