<Author>jec1985
<Content>Good Deal on a Reasonably Priced Hotel Just got back from one night at the Affinia Dumont in New York City. Although it had received glowing reports on this website, I was a little leery of staying there, since I am more used to staying at the Waldorf or the New York Hilton when I am in the city. However, the hotel was close to my meeting, so I gave it a try.I booked on the hotel website, and reserved a King Junior Suite. When I checked in, I was upgraded to a corner double queen one-bedroom suite. The room was very spacious for New York, complete with separate sitting room, small but complete kitchen (microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, and even plates, silverware, etc.) A very nice sized desk for working, and a very large TV, sound system and sofa. I was on the 31st floor, with a great view of the Chrysler Building. The room was very comfortable, but not luxurious, like you would find in the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton, both of which I have stayed at in other cities. The room was clean, and the hotel is totally non-smoking. There were nice big windows for a great view of the city. I tend to get claustrophobic in small dark hotel rooms, and had no problem here. It was nice to have a large room, which is rare at these prices in NYC. I paid $269 plus tax, for a total of $310.49.The bathroom was a nice size, clean, with separate vanity area with plugs for hairdryer, etc. The amenities were Aveda, but no cotton balls or sewing kit. In these days of quart size toiletries, it would have been nice to have these. The water pressure in the shower was good, there was also a phone in the bathroom, and a make-up mirror, although the lighting left a little to be desired. The towels were good size and very white ( I hate towels in any color other than white, becuase you can't see if they're really clean or not). No robes available, but there was a pillow menu which allowed you to request special pillows. The bed was very comfy and the pillows were fine.The lobby wasn't much, but the people at the front desk were very nice. If you're in the mood for a little quaint french bistro, there is a place just right around the block called Cosette which was very good, basic french (not the fancy stuffy kind) food and service.Would I stay there again? If you are with a family, I think it would be great, due to the kitchen and the extra room. I prefer to be closer to mid-town, but these rooms make it very easy to save money by using the kitchen for breakfasts, and snacks. (Avoid the expensive mini-bar, and buy your snacks and drinks down at the Duane Reed on the corner). I would certainly stay there again if I had the reason to be in the area. I felt safe in the neighborhood, and at the hotel. Room 3103 was very nice, and you won't be disappointed if you stay there.  
<Date>Nov 28, 2006

<Author>Malgosha
<Content>Awesome!!  Central hotel with a $30 cab ride from the airport. Walked to everything and everywhere in Manhattan. <Author>Heartyoz
<Content>Would Defo stay at the Affinia Dumont again...... I trolled through endless reviews about where to stay in NY...and whittled it down to a couple, so I asked the local experts on TA for advice and came to the decision with their help, on the Affinia Dumont - and I am so glad I did. My hotel criteria was: Preferably modernish hotel, central to sights, good views and it came up to that  more. I e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival asking for a room on a high floor with a view, when we checked in we were given 504 which faced the street but no view as such, they were really busy. However they changed us the next day (moved all the luggage etc while we were out sightseeing) to room 2904 - what a view!! We ended up sitting in fron of the window when we came in for the night just gazing at the lights, it was breathtaking. The bedroom was really large (had a office workspace in one part) and was really airy. The bed was just soooooo comfortable - ideal for a good nights rest after a hard day in New York City. The kitchen area, with coffeemaker (coffee supplied) , fridge (stocked minibar), cooker and utensils were handy - we used it in the morning for coffee (and a quick croissant from the deli just next door, on the street) before we set off for the day. The bathroom was a reasonable size (bath and shower), hairdryer and toiletries supplied. The location of the hotel was great, I was slightly dubious when I was booking it as some of the reiviews said it was in a 'quieter' areaut for us it was perfect, after a day in all the noise and excitement, it was good to go back to a slightly 'calmer' area and the added bonus of less street noise at night. It was a 5 minute walk to the subway if that (which got us everywhere), 10 minutes max to the Empire State Building, and 15 mins walk to Macys. There weren't loads of restaurants in the area but we did find a nice bar a couple of blocks down called Blancs (great barman called Ambrose) and there were palces around if you didn't want to eat in all the hussle and bussle - there was also the Barking Dog next door where we had a drink and bite to eat the first night we got there - staff really friendly. All in all I would definitely recommend the Affinia Dumont and would stay there again without a doubt.  
<Date>Nov 24, 2006

<Author>JCDublin
<Content>Great hotel and location Just back from New York after a 3 night day in the Affinia Dumont. This hotel is a great find, room was a twin with very large beds, and also had a full kitchen! We arrived and were allocated a room on the 4th floor, requested a higher floor as first time visit for my sister, they asked us to come back in 30 mins and then gave us a room on the 37th floor! View was great to downtown. hotel is very close to Empire State building and close to restaurants, very good Italian around corner called Da Ciro recommended by the hotel. Also went to Penelopes diner on 30th and 3rd avenue for brunch on Sunday which was very good, Guy and Pallards is a great deli for paninis and bagels for breakfast and on corner of Lexington beside hotel. Zagats restaurant guide is spot on and well worth getting. Weather was great so didn't get to use the subways, concierge very good at getting cabs for us and the hotel also organised a car back to JFK on Sunday for $65 (it started lashing rain so not many cabs around!). Really enjoyed the trip and will definitely go back to the Affinia Dumont.  
<Date>Nov 14, 2006

<Author>moneypenny74
<Content>pleasant surprise My friend and I stayed at the affinia dumont for three nights in october. We had originally booked at the Shelburne Murray Hill which is owned by the same company. When we arrived they told us that we couldn't stay at the Shelburne but they told us we had room waiting for us at the Dumont. We were skeptical because we liked the New York charm of the Shelburne. We were told that we were welcome to come back the next day or we could stay at the Dumont for the same price. They gave us cab fare and put our bags in the cab ( it was just around the corner). Although it lacked the charm of the Shelburne's stone facade it was more than made up for in modern comfort and service. The room was really big with a kitchenette, aveda products in the bathroom, large triple sheeted beds and a nice view. Although we were out and about all day it was nice to have such a comfortable room to crash out in. Oh yeah and the water pressure was amazing. I wanted to move in.

<Author>heartnyc
<Content>Dumont is great value for money This was our first trip to New York and found the Dumont a great location for getting around. It is extremely close to the 33rd Street subway station for the 4,5 and 6 trains which run up and downtown frequently. It's also a short walk to the Empire State Building.The hotel itself is decorated simply but the staff are polite and welcoming and the rooms large and clean. We managed to get a suite for the price of a standard room on Expedia and as result we had a room the size of small apartment with a living area and a kitchenette. The room also had a fantastic view of the Chrylser Building (when it wasn't raining!). We never ate in the Barking Dog restaurant which is attached the hotel but instead we visited the various diners on Third Avenue and got great value breakfasts. I would recommend the Affinia Dumont without hesitation.

<Author>khs22
<Content>Fabulous Affiinia!! We JUST got back from our stay at the Affinia Dumont  I have to write about it! This was the perfect hotel for a visit to NYC. I am no stranger to NYC (used to live there) and have certainly had my share of stays in 5 star hotels. The Affinia may have the occasional flaw - a crack on the ceiling, etc. But they really do provide a higher-end experience (especially amazing considering the price!) Friendly staff - one guest told me the doorman ran 4 blocks in the rain to find her a cab. I'm 5 months pregnant and was still getting over a bad sinus infection, after an early am flight I was desperate for a bed. The staff was able to accomodate my early check in within about an hour of my request (just enough time to have breakfast around the corner!) Comfortable beds with wonderfully soft, cotton sheets and down pillows - you also have the choice of 4 other types of pillows just a phone call away - housekeeping had my extra pillows in my hands (cases were still warm from pressing!) within 5 minutes! We were supposed to stay at the Roosevelt during my husband's conference, but after reading all the bad reviews we quickly switched. For a few dollars more than the discounted conference rate at the Roosevelt, we got a king 1BR suite. Can we say huge? Our place was bigger than any apartment I or my friends have ever had in the city. The neighborhood is just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Herald Square, but there's plenty nearby - grocery store (Gristide's), gourmet markets, cafes and diners - try the one at 33rd  3rd for breakfast!). The internet fee really is insignificant when you realize the going rate at the kinko's on 33rd and park is 30 cents per minute.)In a nutshell, the best way to feel at home while away from home!  
<Date>Oct 29, 2006

<Author>Luckyfour
<Content>Best hotel I've ever stayed in! We stayed in this hotel in October for 6 days and cannot say enough great things about the hotel. The suite was huge with great views with the Chrysler Building on one side and the river at the other window (corner suite). The staff were terrific and were extremely polite and helpful. The room was very clean and like an apartment. The Murray Hill area is fantastic with great little restaurants and shops; very different than Times Square where it's so crowded and hard to find good food. The bed was extremely comfortable and was great to have a kitchen. I'd love to return to New York and stay at this hotel and I give it 5 stars!!!! What a wonderful experience! My boyfriend travels for work a lot (and for about 15 years) and has never stayed at a nicer hotel. He loved it as well.

<Author>BirdWalk
<Content>Great Rooms We recently stayed four nights here. Our bed was very comfy and we had a lovely view of the Chrysler Building and the East River from our suite. As many reviewers have noted, the generous size of the rooms and the proximity to a subway stop are the best things about this hotel. Two amenities would elevate the Dumont from good to great -- 1) A true concierge, rather than the very busy desk staff, and 2) free wireless internet in the rooms and in the lobby. (For almost $400 per night, it seemed rather chintzy to pay an additional ten bucks a night for internet access.) Overall, an enjoyable stay.

<Author>Christie327
<Content>We Heart Affinia Dumont! We have just come back from staying a week at the Affinia Dumont in NYC and we weould go back in a heart beat. We had 2 one bedroom suites, one for my husband and I and one for my mom and sister. We had wanted the two bedroom suite, but we know we would have been unhappy with that, how much time do you want to spend with your family!? Our suites were on the 20th and 28th floors, overlooking the East River. The suites were 3 times bigger than any hotel I have ever stayed in in NYC. Having the kitchen was great for breakfasts and left overs. We had two large closets in the bedroom and a big bathroom, while my mom's room had 3 closets and a slightly smaller bathroom. The pillow menu was great and the bedding was wonderful. We have a Tempur mattress at home and we never sleep as well when we travel, but the Affinia bed was almost as comfy! The staff were very friendly and accomodating and helped to make our stay enjoyable. The area was great and there are a ton of restaurants on Third Avenue to enjoy. Macy's is a short walk from the hotel, and the area feels very safe. We will definitely be staying at the Affinia Dumont again!  
<Date>Oct 17, 2006

<Author>amybojo
<Content>Affinia DOALOT it could be called.... As we stayed here just recently while in town for a long weekend. The management team is supurb here and the accomodations are some of the biggest - space-wise - that you will find in NYC. As usual we booked our stay on Expedia.com, and upon checking on their website for our confirmation # less than 24 hours before check-in, we realized that the rate for our Junior Suite room had dropped. The Expedia agent called the hotel and spoke with the front desk manager and the manager waived the cancellation fee and we rebooked at the lower rate. This was a positive and exceeded my expectations on what the hotel may do as a result of our inquiry. Checking in was a breeze. We encountered a couple of problems with the room service and also the smoking (the hotel is all non-smoking) - and a barking dog (the hotel is very pet friendly so you may hear this during your stay) in the room directly across the hall from us - but all was taken care of upon my bringing it to the manager's attention. We were promptly re-located to another room (Junior Suite) on a higher floor (29 vs. 18). The view from 29 is amazing - if you can imagine - as you can see the Chrysler Tower to the North and the East River to the East.....it's breathtaking both during the day and even more so at night. The hotel room itself is huge - as stated before - bigger than most even beyond the Big Apple. Most / or all Junior Suites I was told are in the corners...giving you ample room and the view I spoke of. The amenities are first rate in the room, an umbrella stand with an umbrella, and Aveda toiletries. I was impressed. The decor could use a minimal update as the kitchen - albeit bigger than most studios in NYC could use a minor facelift and the couch is older. The TV is what I was most expecting to be a plasma/lcd given the rank and file of this type of hotel - as it caters to business and pleasure travel. Overall, the management did everything to accomodate us and even after our stay sent us a follow-up survey and responded to our comments within hours. This is the biggest city in the US with a hotel on every corner - literally - what differentiates this hotel from the others is it's service and management team. Thank you Trang for your help during our stay!  
<Date>Oct 4, 2006

<Author>janchor
<Content>We loved Affina Dumont We stayed for six nights in September while attending the US Open tennis championships. I booked the hotel through its website after reading all the good reviews and we were very satisfied. We got a great special promotion rate!!Great location near our subway transportation out to Flushing Meadows. We asked each morning at the front desk for a list of the days tennis matches and after a few days they had them ready for us in the morning!! Our room was very comfy and quiet and clean. The new grocery store right next door was very handy for late night sandwiches and great salads. And Guy and Gallard just a few steps across Lexington had good coffee and bagels. When it poured with rain the Drugstore across the street provided us with ponchos.The area around the hotel felt very much like a comfortable neighbourhood and the hotel felt like home! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to other visitors to NYC.

<Author>barkingdog
<Content>Wonderful/Reasonable in NYC We stayed here over July 4 and couldn't have picked a more perfect location. It was just up the street from where the fireworks were being launched. The hotel was very clean and the king-sized bed was increditbly comfortable. Every day after an exhausting day of sightseeing we were greeted with smiles and some absolutely wonderful iced tea and fruit. This hotel is located a few minutes walk from the Empire State Building, a block from the subway, around the corner from an incredible deli called the Murray Hill Diner and by several great Italian pastry shops and Patsy's Pizza. We were on the top floor and had a corner room with a wonderful view of the river and the Chrysler Building. We took a lot of pictures of the city nightlights from our windows. Aveda products are used in the bathrooms and our room had a full kitchen with a refrigerator to store leftovers and sodas bought down the street. A lot of hotels in NY have small rooms, this was large and the sofa bed was perfect for our children, it seems to be queen-sized. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel for either a couple or a family.

<Author>larsthorwald
<Content>Great family hotel in New York City Our family (two teenaged sons) stayed in this quiet neighborhood (Murray Hill) near Times Square over Labor Day week-end. The hotel has a tiny lobby and a restaurant nest door. Also on the other side there is a small corner grocery (with gourmet deli) soon to be getting a liquor license. This is a very user-friendly and QUIET neighborhood. The windows open (!) and there are kitchens complete with dishes and full stoves. We got a 2bedroom suite ( one bedroom with king bed, living room with sofa bed and 2nd bedroom with fdouble bed) for $1200 for two nights. The value and amount of space was phenomenal for New York city. Everything was very clean, staff atentive, and nice duvets on the beds, too. We considered this a major find!

<Author>porche
<Content>Great value for money We have just returned from a holiday in the states and we enjoyed a 6 night stay at Affinia Dumont, New York. We searched trip advisor to see which would be the best for us and after weeks of reading reviews decided on Affinia, as it was 2nd best. We needed a 2 bedroom suite and the room size was great, nice and roomy. The bed was comfortable, which I'm fussy with as we have such a comfy one at home, and there's a pillow menu as well if you need it. It was very clean as well, especially the bathroom which I'm extremely fussy about! However being a hotel where pets are allowed to stay the carpet was a bit smelly, especially when you first entered the room but after a while it wasn't to bad. The staff were friendly and helpful, I was expecting rudeness after reading reviews on other places and staff, but they were great. Overall it was a fabulous place to stay for our first time in NewYork and the location also was excellent. Close to Empire State and restaurants and so on......Keep up the good work Affinia See you again soon Cheers From Red Hill Victoria Australia

<Author>To2uK
<Content>Perfect and unpretentious I stay at the Dumont whenever I'm in New York and since I've been there regularly since 1999 I've seen the hotel emerge from a rather shabby _ but well located and friendly _ place to a comfortable, chic property.I always go for the junior suite, which feels like a little flat. Since I'm usually in New York on business and work in my room, the big desk and Aeron chairs are greatly appreciated. The bed is huge and comfy and the bathroom spotless, with a deep tub for soaking.The kitchenette is tucked away and you don't have to look at it while in bed, which is nice. I appreciate the fridge, too, for storing a bottle of wine and some water and snacks.The neighbourhood is good, too. There's a great gourmet cafe-sandwich bar at the corner of 34th and Lex, as well as a decent nail salon and drycleaner (can you tell I was practically living at the Dumont for a while?) The one really dreadful thing is that a great bar, Brew's, used to be next to the hotel, but it was torn down a few years ago for the new development. Still, there are good neighbourhood watering holes a quick walk away.The location is good. Murray Hill isn't as cool as some other neighbourhoods, but it's located kind of in the middle of everything and that makes it a pretty quick cab ride to anything. All in all, it's a great place.  
<Date>Sep 12, 2006

<Author>mpgnzz
<Content>Good Price, Good Location, and Roomy to Boot We stayed in a junior suite on the 31st floor with an excellent view of the city. It was a clean and well thought out accommodation. Not huge, but definitely roomier than any other place I've stayed in NYC. Shower pressure was very good. Shampoo and soap also nice. The kitchen, although we did not need to use it, was perfect and I could easily see it being used during a longer stay - it is equipped with dishes and cookware and dish soap. The bed was comfortable plus you could choose whatever kind of pillow you preferred. Clock radio has cd player, and is not the kind of annoying bright that keeps you up at night. The staff was very nice. It was quiet - relatively because you can always hear NYC traffic, sirens and such, no matter where you stay. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit. I did not try the restaurant/bar, but there were certainly plenty of places to eat close by. There's also a pharmacy across the street in case you forget your toothbrush or just want some snacks or drinks for your room. Empire State building is very close.

<Author>ufgators96
<Content>Definitely will stay again We stayed at the Affinia Dumont for one night on September 2nd. We love this hotel! It is by far the largest hotel room we have had in NYC. It is probably triple the size of other hotels rooms, this is not counting the kitchenette in the room. We had a great view of the East River in the morning from the 29th floor. Location is great, in the Murray Hill area. Lots of restaurants nearby. You can choose a pillow from their pillow menu. In room massages are available. There is a gym but we did not use or see it. We will definitely stay here again when we are in NYC. The staff was very helpful and very friendly. Do not valet the car at the hotel as there is a garage across the street with cheaper parking. Our only complaint is that the reception for ESPN was bad. If it wasn't the first weekend of college football we really would not have even noticed.

<Author>Mightyrhinos
<Content>This hotel is the best! When we arrived our room on one of the top floors wasn't ready but we were promised it and told to leave our bags and come back later. Unfortunately that guest had decided to extend his stay and we were offered a room on a much lower floor for the first night and then promised one on the top floor for the rest of our stay. We said OK and the manager gave us and the children a complimentary breakfast at the Barking Dog Restaurant next door. She also comped us a cocktail each there. She even took the trouble to hand write a letter of apology over the mix up. When we returned the next day, all our stuff had been packed up and moved for us. All the staff on the desk and the doormen were absolutely lovely and so friendly and also very knowledgeable. The room was huge and the kitchen was great as we bought food in for breakfast and the evening meals. I must recommend the deli up the road called Greenleaf Deli/Grocery. The staff made us try their different dishes, the portions were huge and really reasonable and a lot of the locals seem to use it which seems a good sign. The Affinia is in a pleasant, safe location and I would definitely return and recommend it to others. The children loved the IPODS in the lobby.

<Author>SteveHammer
<Content>Excellent Hotel What can I say that hasn't already been said. This is an excellent hotel. The location is superb, the staff were extremely friendly (and I mean all of them), the rooms were spacious and spotless and the view from the 32nd floor beautiful. We spent seven nights here in July, (myself, my wife and two children) and loved every minute of it. Its's ideally situated with only a 5 minute walk to the metro, 10 minutes to the Empire State and 15 mins to Grand Central. There are loads of places to eat within easy walking distance and you feel perfectly safe walking around day or night. The doormen were particularly pleasant and helpful and made my six year old feel very special by greeting him and engaging him in conversation every time they saw him. I would definitely stay here again and would recomend it to anyone visiting New York

<Author>MichaelChristine
<Content>Great Place I have stayed in 10 to 15 hotels in NYC, and this ranks with the best of them. HotelVery friendly staff, always greeting you with a pleasant hello in the morning and afternoon. The room is huge for NYC, and included a small kitchen, very comfortable king bed, and a large desk and ergonomic chair for working in the evening. Also, if you want to spoil yourself (as I did one evening), the spa is excellent, and great value.  LocationThe hotel is located in Murray Hill, a very nice and quaint neighborhood. This was the first time I stayed on the east side, and it was perfect. A 20-25 minute walk to Times Square or Union Square. The subway is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, if you need to get somewhere fast. This was much better than staying in Times Square, where the crowds can be overwhelming.PriceExceptional value for NYC. I paid $270 during the week, and $200 on the weekend. Overall, great place, excellent staff, and Trip Advisor is spot-on, ranking this hotel number #2. However, the 3 Stars is too low. Should be a minimum 4 Stars.

<Author>RJB_JD
<Content>Great location and room We had a junior suite on the 15th floor on a corner facing the east river and chrysler tower. The room was huge (by European standards) and very clean - the aveda products pleased my girlfriend. The staff was always polite and helpful but unfortunately we couldn't take up the offer to meet the hotel manager and take in a free beverage and snacks.It was worth paying a fraction more for the junior suite to get a little higher up in the hotel away from the general NYC street noise that while not too bad in this location, could bother lighter sleepers.We initially had some concerns about not being downtown, but the location was fantastic. There is plenty to do nearby both day and night - Houstons restaurant on Park Ave is worth a mention for the excellent value and service. 10 blocks / 15 minutes walk downtown gets you to Flatiron and Union Square where there are loads of decent bars and restaurants. It seemed very safe to stretch your legs up and down Park and Lexington Avenues so taxis weren't always necessary.A great stay in a very good hotel that I would recommentd to anyone not looking to stay downtown.

<Author>BKinPA
<Content>Like living in the city! We just returned from an adult (i.e. no kids, they are at camp) vacation in NYC. We had seen the Affinia Dumont before and liked it, but did a lot of research here and elsewhere before booking. We decided on the Dumont and did not regret it. We booked a one-bedroom suite at the Dumont through Expedia, which had a substantial discount on all three nights, for substantially less than most single rooms in other parts of the city. While we did not get the great view of the Chrysler building that I had hoped for, we were in the back of the hotel which is very quiet and still has a partial view of the East River. The TV in the bedroom did not work and they brought in a new one immediately. Staff are great and very friendly. The spa and fitness center are fantastic. We brought our own wine, sodas, and snacks, and got a fantastic takeout meal one afternoon from Guy and Gallard (also has THE best coffee and great bagels and pastries), utilizing the kitchen is one great way to save a few dollars. We had never taken a bus before in NYC, but there are bus lines right at the hotel in both directions and they go places the subway doesn't. We took a bus down to the East Village and walked and shopped all the way across through SoHo and the West Village, then took the subway and bus back for an easy trip. The Murray Hill neighborhood is wonderful - staying in a suite at the Dumont makes you feel like you are really living in the city! A taxi ride to dinner in the Upper East Side was only 10 minutes, so the place really is closer to everything than it looks on the map, and it is so relaxing to get back to a quiet residential area after all the hustle of Manhattan. One note of caution if you stay at the Dumont - it is often hard to get taxis there, and forget it during rush hour. If you have theater tickets, have dinner in the neighborhood and then catch a taxi at about 7:30, you will have less trouble and less stress!! Otherwise use the subways and buses to get around.  
<Date>Jul 31, 2006

<Author>LubbockTony
<Content>Very Happy Our family of four recently stayed at the Affinia Dumont for six nights in mid-July. We decided to book the hotel based upon the positive reviews that we had read. We were not disappointed with our choice. Everything was just as the glowing previous reviews has stated.The front desk personnel were all very helpful from the time that we checked in until we left they were always ready to serve. The staff is full of useful knowledge about shows, restaurants, tickets, you name it - they were great. Their knowledge of nice restaurants and guidance enhanced our trip. The doormen also gave great advice on anything that we asked them.The room was wonderful- very spacious and comfortable. The walls are very well insulated so that you don't have any noise from other guests next door. Be sure and take advantage of the pillow menu for selecting a preferred pillow. The housekeeping service was top notch. Our request for extra towels was handled very quickly and with a smile.We will certainly recommend the Affinia Dumont to all of our friends. We will also stay at this property in the future. This place is GREAT.

<Author>jeannedelor
<Content>Reasonably Priced for NYC My husband and I have stayed at the Affinia Dumont two years in a row over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is within walking distance to Macy's and the other stores on 34th Street. A subway station is a short walk from the hotel. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are quiet because there is very little hallway noise (there are fewer than a dozen rooms on each floor). We stay at the Affinia because there are fireworks at the foot of 34th Street every year on the 4th. A non-smoking room on a high floor with a view of the river was requested well in advance, and although we checked in at 4:00 pm on the day we arrived, they were unable to accommodate either request. We were disappointed. The toilet in our room was making noise constantly when we arrived. We were not as happy with our stay this year and we will probably stay elsewhere the next time we visit New York City.

<Author>lmmbjr
<Content>You will not be disappointed My sister and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in NYC at the Affinia Dumont. Our studio suite was clean, spacious and included a full kitchen. We arrived about 1:00 pm and checked in immediately. The only negative I can think of was that the bathroom was a little small and could have used an exhaust fan. We had a problem with the phone not working, but within 20 minutes someone came up and reprogrammed the phone and checked all the extensions to be certain they all worked. All staff we had contact with were extremely helpful and friendly. It's located in a quiet neighborhood, but only a few walkable blocks from the hustle and bustle you would expect in NYC. We would definitely recommend this hotel. We hope to return in the Fall.

<Author>Samsrobin

It was our children's and my Mom's first trip to NYC, and they all commented on how nice New Yorkers are! Go Affinia!

<Author>JenniferLosAngeles
<Content>Good hotel to stay at I stayed at the Affinia Dumont over the Fourth of July holiday and was pleased with the hotel. I was there with three other adults and found the accomodations to be pleasant. The room was clean, it smelled good, had large closets and the kitchen was handy. The kitchen had a stove, range (burner), microwave and fridge. There was glassware, dishes and silverware, however there weren't any pans or such to use on or in the stove/range. You could put the dishes in the microwave, but if you were planning on using the oven to heat lasagna or the stovetop to make eggs, the pans needed aren't there (although I didn't ask the front desk if they were available for use). There is a coffeemaker in the room, too, but if you're going to use outside ground coffee (like from Starbucks), then bring your own coffee filters as the hotel doesn't have them. The coffee they provide comes in those sealed pre-filled filters.The hotel room was quiet, even with the windows open at their max (which was about 6 inches), although we were on the 34th floor, which could account for the lack of noise. The a/c in the room worked great, which was nice after walking around the warm city.The hotel provides shampoo/conditioner and the like, as well as a hair dryer in the room, which was convenient. You also got a complimentary USA Today each morning.The hotel location was two blocks from the 6 subway train and there was a crosstown bus that picked up across the street from the hotel. Very handy. Second and 3rd avenue are packed with restaurants and bars that seemed to be busy each night.The only downside to the hotel was that the front desk wasn't too concierge-like in that they didn't help you plan or book a tour or show. They would provide phone numbers and print outs from the web, but they didn't function as a true concierge would. The other drawback is this hotel doesn't have a pool and they don't have a deal with a nearby facility to use one. They do have an excellent spa, though, that offers the classics like massages and facials. The front desk people are prompt and friendly, though.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2006

<Author>slickoperator
<Content>Excellent Hotel This is an excellent hotel. As other reviews point out, the lobby is nothing to write home about, it's fairly poky. But that really is the only criticism I have. While there I put the hotel through a number of tests. The first one was: I'm very noise sensitive, and although they gave me the kind of room I'd requested, very high up, with a wonderful view, it had a connecting door to the next door room, which was a potent and irritating noise source. I asked to be moved to a quieter room. At first they told me the only quieter room they had was on a smoking floor (I'm a non-smoker). When I said I didn't care, I just wanted a quieter room wherever, they found one on the same floor I was on, which was a non-smoking floor. It wasn't a better room, really, and was in some respects less good. But it was quieter, and served me well for the rest of my stay. Full marks on that. The move was executed within half an hour of my initial complaint.Secondly: I ordered a DVD from Amazon, and by mistake Amazon left my name off the package. In spite of that, the hotel staff ensured that it got to my room. The service in the Affinia was universally excellent. The concierge, bellhops and reception staff were extremely helpful at every turn. One word of advice: whatever you do, don't bother going to the Barking Dog, or whatever the hotel's adjoining restaurant/bar is called, for breakfast. For better value, and a more authentic experience, go to the Murray Hill Diner just round the corner on Lexington. The service and the food is much better.  
<Date>Jul 10, 2006

<Author>snowgirl22
<Content>Awesome Stay Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Affinia Dumont. What a great stay. There were 4 of us and we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. We had to move initially as I forgot to ask for a non-smoking suite and the smell of smoke was pretty heavy when we walked in. The front desk staff was very accomodating and even though the hotel was fully booked they moved us to a new room. We had the most comfortable king bed in the bedroom and also a sleeper sofa which turned out to be quite comfy as well. Donald, the doorman was great. He brought our luggage to the room, and then quickly returned with champagne glasses so we could get our celebrating started. He was a wealth of info for where to go in the city. The housekeeping staff took great care of us bringing us new towels everytime we called. Most days we weren't out of our room until after 2pm so they would bring us fresh towels and then they'd ask when we'd be out so they could clean without disturbing us. The hotel is located midtown, close to the subway and grabbing a cab couldn't have been easier. A GREAT location! We also used the fitness center at no additional charge. We didn't expect much, but when we got there we were pleased. They had every type of equipment we needed to do a complete workout, anytime of day. Would I stay again? Most definately!!!! Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous hotel, Brilliant location Ok, just got back from a 5 night stay at the Affinia (16th to 21st June 2006). This hotel is fantastic, the rooms are fabulous (we stayed in a junior suite), the bed was huge and comfortable - you even get a pillow menu which is fab. The kitchen is very handy and the fridge is huge and stocked with beer which is always nice. The room was spotless in every way and each night we came back to a made bed with clean sheets and towels. We left things around and it was totally safe. The hotel was also spotless and the staff are brilliant - we left the hotel at a busy time to come home and getting a cab was difficult so the hotel got us a limo to the airport which finished off our holiday in style.The hotel location is fantastic - 5 minutes from the Empire State Building and another 5 minutes to Macys. There are loads of great bars and restaurants just round the corner but the 'Barking Dog' which is attached the hotel is flippin brilliant - the portions are huge and the food is great. We could walk to all of the sights from the hotel because of its great location and it was always a very pleasant (air-conditioned) welcome from a tiring day by the hotel staff. Overall a fabulous hotel in a brilliant location, spotlessly clean and very friendly staff. We would go back to the Affinia tomorrow. But watch your wife in 'Tiffanys'.....been there - bought that :) Oh - quick note : NY is a very very safe place to be at any time of day, try everything and don't worry about anything.....its fantastic. If you want to ask me anything about the hotel or NY just give me a shout - sjj@osfc.ac.uk  
<Date>Jun 23, 2006

<Author>RDavidW
<Content>Fantastic room views Spent 6 nights in June '06.Great value for money. We had a room on 30th floor - great views of the Chrysler and Uptown, as well as the East River.Rooms are not THE most modern, but are a good size and very light. The Beds are not only huge as you'd expect in the US, but are really comfortable. The large mirrors are a nice touch also. The little Kitchenette is a bonus as it means you have your own fridge and cutlery - Guy and Gallard on the corner does great coffee and chessecake/ fresh fruit etc.

<Author>Tessallyne
<Content>Great Hotel, Great Location Let me start by saying that we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful but not in a phoney, we're out for a tip way. The elevators are fast and efficient and in 7 days, I believe we were only on an elevator with other people twice. We were fortunate enough to get a corner room on the 32nd floor so the views were incredible! Chrysler Building in one direction and the East River in another direction. The room, sheets, towels, bathroom were always extremely clean. We also loved the Murray Hill district where the hotel is located. Everything is within easy walking distance and the area has a real residential feel to it. We will most definitely be back to the Affinia Dumont!

<Author>Vdub1776
<Content>The Room was huge for New York standards! What more can I say? We arrived in New York a little early before check in and they allowed us in our room at about 1 pm. All of the staff was super friendly and the service was excellent. The hotel room was huge for New York standards. The bed was honestly one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The kitchenette came in handy also for left overs and to store drinks in the refrigerator. The corner view down 34th street overlooking the Hudson River was also a beautiful site to wake up to each morning. The hotel is located in Murray Hill which is a plus in my book becuase it is kinda quiet, and we didn't wake up to a honking cab each morning! Our flight didn't leave till 9 pm that Sat night and check out is 3 pm, and they gladly stored our bags for us and even allowed us to use the second floor spa to freshen up before our flight home. I would highly recommed this hotel to anyone staying in New York. I know I will definitely be going back myself.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fabulous hotel, great staff, super location We stayed four nights here and were very happy that we listened to the good reviews on this site as they proved totally accurate. We were greeted by very friendly and informative desk and concierge staff. The room was great - it had its own kitchenette, a comfortable bathroom and the bed was incredibly comfy. No view to speak of but we weren't there to look out of the window!! The location of the hotel was great - a few blocks down from the Empire States Building and Macys. There were also some really great bars and restaurants just one block away (towards East River down 34th St). Even the bar next door (the Barking Dog) was a relaxed and cool place to hang out after a day's sightseeing. We would highly recommend this hotel.

<Author>beanes
<Content>Affinia Dumont was excellent! My party of 6 stayed at the Affinia Dumont on June 6-11 2006. We originally had reservations at another hotel but read mutliple bad reviews for it so we started looking again with only 2 weeks before our trip. After reading wonderful reviews about the Dumont on this site and others we decided to try and book. When we actually got reservations we were a bit skeptical of any place that had openings 2 weeks in advance (most don't have openings 4 months in advance). But all of our doubts vanished the second we arrived. There's so much to say about this hotel I'm not sure where to start. But we'll start with the first thing you notice..LocationThe Dumont is located at 150 E 34th St. It's 3 quick blocks to the Empire State Building and 2 blocks from the Line 6 subway stop. You can get basically anywhere by subway. The hotel is in a great neighborhood. 1/2 block east is 3rd Avenue which is lined with groceries and restaurants, as well as little shops. It's far enough out of Times Square to be peaceful, but close enough to be considered centrally located.StaffOne of the second things we noticed about the Dumont was its excellent staff. The doorman was very friendly and so were the desk workers. They also spoke to us as we went in and out, and almost seemed like our friends by the end of our stay. They were extremely helpful and courteous at all times. The way it should be!The RoomOur room was a quick elevator ride to the 36th floor. (We never had to wait for an elevator, and it was only about a 15 second ride. When we opend the door to our 1 bedroom/2 queen bed suite we were greeted with spectacular views of the city, especially of the Crysler Building. I bet we stood at the window for 10 min. in awe before we even set our bags down. The view was only the beginning. Our room was HUGE. The living room had a foyer type area with a big mirror, coat rack, and arm chair. To the immediate right was a average NYC kitchen. It had a very large refrigerator, as well as all the other amenities you'd expect in any regular kitchen. It was also stocked with dishes and utensils. The living area had a sofa that made out into a bed, an end table, a coffee table, a big desk with a VERY comfortable chair, and an entertainment center with a TV. I know that sounds like a lot of furniture, and it is! But the room still feels very large. There was plently of room for 6 people to move about, even when the sofa was made into a bed and a twin bed air mattress was being used. The bedroom had two of the best beds I have ever slept on in my life. There's a pillow menu and down comforters. The beds were so nice, we're currently looking into where the hotel got them so we can get some for our home! The bedroom also had an arm chair and an entertainment center, as well as a night stand and end table. Right off ot the bedroom is a dressing area with wooden hangers on clothing rods, a safe, and a dresser. Right next to that is a beautiful bathroom. It was bigger than most bathrooms I ever seen in any hotel anywhere. Excluding the tub, toilet, sink, and other vanity area, there was still 25 square feet of walking space! Amazing for a NYC hotel. Both the living area and bedroom had HUGE windows that spanned the entire width of the walls. Not only was the room very comfortable and functional, it was also very fashionable. There were 2 contemporary art pieces framed in each room, and the lightening was spotlights that were adjusted to shine on the pictures, beds, sofa, etc. Each of the lights could be adjusted to be as bright or dim as you liked. The room was just full of fashionable and great touches that I could never tell it all. While I don't know if all rooms are like this, I CAN testify to ours. Our room was 3603 by the way. You could ask for it when you reserve, we just asked for a room with a view, and that's what we got! I'll try to post some pictures of our room when I get them developed. The Second FloorThe second floor of the Dumont is set aside for fitness and comfort. There is a 24 hour fitness room that's free. There is a lot of equipment, each with it's own personal tv that you can watch (change the channel to yours if you like!) and there is even a dvd player under each tv. The 2nd floor also hosts the Oasis Day Spa. Although we didn't use it, it looked VERY nice. Here's a testimate to how kind our staff was: When we arrived at 1:30 our room wasn't ready.. They were cleaning it. But the staff told us that if we wanted we could just go up and use the spa's showers.. even before we checked in! How nice! Anyway, although the hotel is made for fit business travelers (you can also check out yoga, etc fitness tapes and stuff), it is not overpowering. It is a great hotel for anyone. The desk in the room (if not used for business) is great for laying those NYC maps out and reading those brochures!The PriceFor 6 people to stay in a one bedroom/ 2 queen bed - 1 pull out sofa bed it costed 600 dollars. That would even out to about 300 a night per room anywhere else (we would have had to get two rooms at other places because most hotel rooms can't hold more than 4 people) 300 a night is by no means insane for NYC prices, especially for a htoel like this!! It was WELL worth the price! We looked forward to going back to the room everynight!I hope this review, although lengthy, will help you. And I really hope you consider the Affinia Dumont, you won't be dissapointed!!!  
<Date>Jun 12, 2006

<Author>ChrisGandTheBean
<Content>Fantastic! We had booked four nights here and it was the last four nights of our honeymoon after being in San Francisco, Las Vegas and southern Utah. We arrived by cab from Penn station and the door man, Donald greeted us. He has to be one of the most welcoming door men I have every experienced. Even after we checked in and went to our room on the 34th floor, Donald arrived with our luggage almost as soon as we were in the room and he was so helpful in making sure that we had everything we needed and helping us with the facilities in the room; all without being intrusive. The room was fabulously big and had a view that was equally wonderful; we were presented with a beautiful picture of the Chrysler Building all lit up and to our right was the Hudson river. We had a studio room so we had a reasonably sized kitchen along with all the necessary cutlery etc. that you would expect, along with arm chairs and a foot stool, executive desk and chair and a bed that was simply monstrous. Apparently, the beds are custom made for the hotel and you even get a pillow menu to provide you with the perfect pillow to ensure a good nights sleep. The lobby staff were extremely helpful and did their utmost to answer our questions about the best places to go etc, especially Justin, even if he didn know that the Staten Island ferry was free! Next to the hotel is the Barking Dog restaurant which served food all day. You never left feeling hungry, the food was really good and the speed of delivery to your table was especially fast. Our final trip was courtesy of Moses who provided us with the transport to JFK airport. He was extremely polite and friendly and couldn have been more helpful in getting us and our luggage to the check in desk. Just ask at the hotel lobby for Moses!

<Author>cadaques12
<Content>Great location I stayed at the Affinia for a week - and loved it. I had used Trip Advisor to help find a good hotel in New York and was not disappointed. I styed in a huge room with the biggest bed I have ever seen. My parents (in 60s) had another room with two huge Queen beds. Both rooms had great views of Manhattan (26th and 28th floors). We used the kitchens in the rooms for breakfasts. It was great having a huge fridge to keep drinks cold. The rooms were spotless - best maid service ever. There are three lifts which you never wait more than a minute for (a bonus in such a big hotel). The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. There is an added bonus of an air-conditioned gym which residents can use 24 hours a day for free. It is quite big - with great views. You can also hire CD players, weights and yoga mats for free.The location of this hotel could not be bettered. The subway is a block away. Times Sq is just 20 minutes away, the Empire State less than five. There are dozens of bars and restaurants nearby (try Sarges for a real US dining treat) and Kimi for fab Japanese food. The Barking Dog (next to hotel) does great buttermilk pancakes, but beware service is slow and it can lack atmosphere.I plan to stay at this hotel again when I am next in the city. It really is good value for New York with rooms much bigger than many more expensive hotels in Manhattan.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2006

<Content>Affinia Dumont is wonderful. We just returned from NYC. The Affinia Dumont turned out to be a very pleasant experience. We go to NYC fairly often, and this is my favorite of the seven or so hotels we've tried over the last six months. The entire staff was most friendly, helpful and energetic. <Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Stay in the Affinia Dumont Had an excellent 4 night stay in the Affinia Dumont. The room was fantastic and spacious although we never used the kitchen and did'nt really spend much time in the hotel.Stayed on the 36 floor (King suite) which was quiet, good views, clean and spacious. The aircondition unit was getting on a bit but still effective.Had no problems with hot water or lifts.Plenty of resturants around the area, Thai, Italian, mexican, american etc. Guy and Galland's just on the next block does excellent breakfast fare. The hotel was close to the Empire State building and we had no problem walking to Times square, Theatre district, up to central park etc. You can always catch a cab or use the subway, we found walking the best option so take some comfortable shoes and get ready for a crick in the neck as a result of always looking up. Fanstastic stay and would happily go back to this hotel.

<Author>bmoretraveler50
<Content>Would stay here again. We stayed here for our first time in May 2006. We had a one bedroom suite, which was decent sized for New York City. The bathroom had a few problems (the drain wasn't working properly and there were a few scuff marks on the walls) but was impeccably clean. The staff was extremely friendly and sent someone up to fix the drain within 5 minutes of us telling them about it. Aveda products in the bathrooms and fresh apples/oranges in our room upon arrival. There is a spa on the second floor that we did not use but seemed (from our trips in the elevator) to be doing good business. The Affinia Dumont isn't extremely fancy but it is nice, clean and has friendly staff. Murray Hill is a nice centrally located neighborhood. We would stay here again.

<Author>wellermdfan
<Content>Loved the Dumont Great hotel - the front desk staff were great. Housekeeping brought the specialty pillows and extra towels within 5 minutes of request. Doorman opened doors (which isn't all that common in some hotels in the city!) and ran up to the corner to hail cabs for us!We loved this hotel - we arrived early and they just happened to have a room available. They let us check in early, with no extra charge and we luckily had a room on the top floor. The room was very big. I didn't even know that the room was going to have a kitchen! THe room and bathroom were clean and the soaps/shampoos were very nice. The temp of the room was fine and we found that we could easily control it. We didn't order room service although the menu had a good selection and very reasonable charges. It might have been cheaper to order room service than go out to eat - but then again we wanted to experience some of NYC's great restaurants. We never had to wait a long time for an elevator. They had a 24-hour fitness room and these free spa-kits you could use during your stay. In all, we loved this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone who can afford it. I wish I could stay here everytime we come to NYC.

<Author>scratchyrabbit
<Content>Great stay at the Affinia Dumont I just returned from a 4 night stay at the Affinia Dumont. My husband booked our stay there off the recommendations of other reviewers on this site. We were not disappointed. We loved it! Our room was large and spacious and clean. It included a kitchen with fridge, stove etc. I balked at first at the location of our room (near elevators and a stairwell) having had bad experiences in other hotels. It turned out not to be an issue at all. We never heard a peep from anyone or anything. In fact, we never saw or heard another guest on our floor the whole time we were there. We were on the 30th floor and had a great view of the city. The staff at the front desk was so helpful and friendly, never tiring of our endless questions for directions and recommendations. We will definately stay here again when we return to NYC.

<Author>WhyNot_1_2_Go
<Content>Even better than the Benjamin We stayed last year at the Benjamin, another Affina hotel. We loved our experience there (see my 3/24/05 review). We wanted to stay in a different part of town so we went with another Affina property. We loved our stay.The Dumont has a hip but cozy feel. In the two days we were there, I felt that the staff (especially the bell hops) got to know us well. They were very helpful with suggestions about restaurants. We had a lot of luggage and two kids, so when I asked the bell hop what he thought about the best way to get to the airport, he volunteered to come up to our room and survey our luggage. He then made arrangements for a driver and coordiated everything from there. That kind of service was common throughout our stay.Our room was on the 33rd floor and overlooked the river. The L shaped layout of the one bedroom until gave a great view. The room was beautiful and very large. It had a full kitchen with a dishwasher etc. At $369 per night, the rate was lower than small rooms in many other hotels in the area. It was also about the same price as a small room that looked directely into the side of a building at the Westin Times Square, which we had stayed at earlier in the week. The room has a lot of nice touches, such as a stereo, two tvs, a large desk area etc. The hotel has a pillow menu and fit kits, which consist of portable CD players, pedometers etc. that can be borrowed by the guests. The beds were very comfortable. What I liked most was that the room was extremely quiet. We brought our kids (9  12) and never felt like we had to police them as we often do in hotels where the walls are thin.The hotel is in the Murry Hill area, which we ended up liking a lot. Despite it's 34th  Lexington location, it has a smaller town feel. By that, I mean that there aren't any hot dog vendors or packs of tourists roaming the streets. There are a lot of restaurants in the area serving a wide variety of cusine, but they mostly appeared to be filled with regulars. There was a 24 hour drug store right across the street. There is also a Guy  Gallard, which is a fantastic place to grab a quick and economical breakfast.I have nothing negative to say about this hotel. It was fantastic. At worst, being tourists, it was a bit far from many of the sights (Central Park, Theater District, Park Ave etc.) that we were visiting. Nevertheless, we liked returning to the area in the evening, so that we could leave the hustle of our days' adventures. On the way out, we were waiting by the elevator and a familiar looking woman was standing there. I did a double take and then realized Carolyn, Donald Trump's advisor in The Apprentice TV show was standing there. She apparantly stays there from time-to-time. She obviously knows good value, as the Dumont offers an outstanding experience.  
<Date>May 11, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>NY's best kept secret I stayed at the Affinia in December 05 with my girlfriend. For NY the studio suite was huge, a great change from the shoe boxes you usually get in NY. Good location on 34th Street so only a few blocks from Empire State and a short taxi ride to Soho or the East Village. Rooms are large, well furnished and they also have a little kitchen. Would definately reccommend for anyone staying in NY who has a bit of style as it is away from all the touristy tack around Times Square. Lots of nice shops and restaurants in the area. I would not consider staying anywhere else in NY.

<Author>Elyn
<Content>Thumbs up A group of us booked three rooms/suites here. We had a studio, which by NY standards, seemed huge. We had a corner room in the back, which was a) quiet and b) had two big windows! and an actual view, i.e., sunlight, and not a brick wall. Our friends had a suite on a high floor with a great view of the Chrysler Building and other people's roof terraces. (As a former New York resident, I am still not immune to real estate envy.) The galley kitchens are a great amenity, even though we did not use ours on this trip. (Our friends, who were traveling with kids and stayed longer, made good use of theirs.) Rooms were attractive and clean, and the front desk staff seemed very pleasant. The location is convenient. Altogether, a good choice.

<Author>AddieBee
<Content>Affinity for the Affinia My boyfriend and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont for three nights and we were very pleased with the property. We got a really good deal on Travelzoo ($179/night for a studio with a king bed). First, the staff - very pleasant, accomodating, definitely schooled in guest services. The room - huge. I couldn't believe how large it was for a NY hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was clean/large enough to be serviceable. The kitchen could have been better outfitted and the room needs a little table and two chairs for guests to eat breakfast or whatever, so that the Kitch part of the set up is more functional. It was nicely decorated, but a little beat up. It was hotel clean. I have stayed in much, much worse places.The location - We liked the Murray Hill neighborhood. We liked NOT being on top of Times Square. A drugstore across the street. A D'Agostino (grocery) right up the block. Nice shops and restos on 3rd. ( Try bagels from Daniel's Bagels on 3rd between 37 and 38th - awesome.) Barking Dog restaurant next to the hotel was OK. We ate breakfast there once. Good coffee and the house-made biscuits were yummy. Transportation - The Lexington Line (4,.5,6) is at Park and 33rd. The hotel is not at a main transfer point like Times Square, but really, you have to juggle stops/change trains wherever you are in NY, so it really didn't matter. Cabs easy to get. We had no problems getting around.Overall - It was a very, very nice experience. We would definitely stay there again, especially if we can get a good deal on the price.  
<Date>Apr 24, 2006
<Rating>5	5	5	-1	4	-1	5	-1

<Author>Malcky
<Content>Breathtaking views from the 35th floor Have just come back from New York City, Stayed at the Hotel Affinia Dumont on East 35th street. We stayed on the 35th floor of the hotel in a one bedroom suite. THe room contained a well equiped and large bathroom and Kitchen. The room and living area was spaceous with two double beds. The views from the two windows were overlooking the river East and buildings like cathedrals and skyscrapers, the views were amazing. The rooms were evidentally cleaned everyday which was very welcome as this has not always been the case for us in the past. The staff in the lobby were very help and informative helping us plan our visit. The hotel is in a good location close to buildings like the Empire State building, departement store Macy's and the Metro. There are good good restaurants around the hotel, and a five minute walk to the cinema and local supermarkets.(These supermarkets are much cheaper than the shops over the road from the hotel, worth checking this out). The traffic noise was still a problem from the 35th floor, no fault of hotel but would recommend ear plugs to block out the noise (the city that never sleeps).

<Author>campfaz
<Content>Loved NYC.....Loved the Dumont We booked the affinia dumont because of the positive reviews on this site and we were delighted with our choice!We paid a good price from Octopus Travel and when we contacted the hotel direct it couldn't match the rate we had secured.Our room was on the 24th floor looking out over 33rd and so didn't have the Chrysler building but still had great views looking downtown.The room was well decorated in nuetral shades and the bed was really comfortable, the pillow menu was a hit as I have memory foam at home and this was one of the choices. Everything was clean and the Aveda products in the bathroom were great. Two small negatives a bottle of water was $6 (ask for a grocery store and use the fridge) and the corridor did not reflect the quality of the room but then you don't sleep in the corridor!Any requests we made of the staff were delt with very promptly whether it was bringing our choice of pillow, extra tissues (even a heavy cold didn't spoil New York) or fixing the TV remote, housekeeping arrived a few minutes after we called reception. Reception staff were also helpful directing us to the nearest grocery store and giving us advice about the subway which was easy to negotiate.We ate in the Barking Dog two or three times and it was fine nothing special but convenient. There are plenty of places a short walk away on 3rd and hey there is the whole of New York just a walk/cab ride away. The subway is a short five minute walk and the Empire State and Macys about 10 mins walk along 34th. Some other reviewers felt the subway was a little disconnected because it is hard to get across town, that's just New York the subway tends to run uptown/downtown while buses are better for crosstown.I would recommend the Affinia Dumont, good size room, nice furnishings/decoration, useful kitchen, good location and helpful staff. New York is a wonderful city and we would love to come back perhaps near Christmas and we would be delighted to stay at the Affinia Dumont again.  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>swissjen
<Content>Great Hotel I cant understand the recent two star ratings of this hotel. We stayed for 4 nights in a Juniour Suite which had King Size bed, Study desk, Settee and Kitchenette. We requested a room with both a river view and City view and were allocated a room on the 34th floor with the requested views! ( Email the hotel prior to departure). The room was huge, very clean, was extremely quiet with only 5/6 rooms on each floor and had all the facilities you would need in a room, Air Con, Fridge, Coffee maker and TV with Pay per view movies including some which are only just in our cinema's! The reception desk were helpful whenever we asked a question of them and the concierge couldnt do enough. In terms of the hotels location, It was 10 minutes from Empire State Building, 10 minutes from Macy's and around 15 minutes from Grand Central station. The subway is around the corner on 33rd Street and a ticket anywhere is $2. The last stop downtown is Brooklyn Bridge which is a great place to get off. In terms of the Bar next door, we didnt use it so i cant comment but there is a great Diner around the corner (on the way to 33rd subway) and Breakfast there was fabulous. In terms of the evening dont miss the opportunity to do as the locals do and head right at the hotel to the junction with 3rd avenue. There are around 10 restaurants and bars within 2 minutes of the hotel including Greek, italian and Mexican. This area was very safe and the majority of the restaurants were open air and pavement dining which was great for people watching. Stay at the Dumont and you will not be disappointed. ( Room 3405 is a beauty so get your requests in!  
<Date>Apr 20, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A definite must! After reading all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor we decided to stay at this hotel at the end of March for a week - we were not disappointed. Dana Hawkes welcomed us to the hotel and gave us a corner suite on the 37th floor so the views were spectacular and the room itself was perfect and extremely clean. The kitchen was ideal for making breakfast in the mornings as there is a supermarket around the corner that sells everything so this was perfect. The bathroom was a fair size, extremely clean with fresh towels and toiletries and was cleaned everyday along with the rest of the suite. The maid even washed up for us! With regards to the area, it was perfect with a villagey feel - we stayed at Time Square last time which was dreadful so this certainly suited us this time. Although a residential area, we were surrounded by boutique shops, classy bistros, sports bars, etc yet only 5-10min walk to Macy's, so the area is perfect for sight seeing.When we go back next year we will definitely stay here again as Dana Hawkes and Glenroy Brown really looked after us. If you want the tackiness and vulgar side of NYC, maybe stay near Time Square and the Novotel because you certainly would not find that in the area of Murray Hill......take my word for it!

<Author>BooerOz
<Content>Excellent location, great value, spacious and friendly We are a couple in our 30's visiting New York for the first time for a week, so we were looking for a good location, good value, comfort and quiet to recover from long days sightseeing. The Affinia Dumont was all of the above and more.The Affinia is centrally located in the Murray Hill/midtown area, 3 blocks away from the empire State and a block away from the 6 train which will take you to the all important SOHO and West Village area in less than 10 minutes. We had a 1 bed king room (actually 2 double beds), and we asked for a high floor on arrival which gave us great uniterrupted views over the financial district and hudson river. The room were spacious, spotless, with tastefull comfortable furniture and decor. The desk and workspace area was really helpfull when planning our days. Lots of nice touches like aveda toiletries and fit kits in your room. The beds are super comfy and our high room meant zero traffic noise. There is a gym and spa, which we didn't use but the spa looked great. All the staff were really friendly, got to know you and very helpful in giving city advice, and booking tickets. We ate in the Barking dog once, and ordered room service from there, food was fine. The only thing that this hotel was missing is perhaps a lounge / bar area to relax outside your room, but we didn't really find this an issue. Absolutely recommended, and would stay there again.

<Author>Derek's#1fan
<Content>Affinia Dumont Was My Home Away From Home Stayed at Affinia Dumont April 8-15 with my husband and two sons (9  10). I could not find one single reason to fault this hotel. The hotel exceeded my expectations. I read reviews for many other hotels and it seemed that unless you stay at an expensive hotel, you could not have a comfortable and pleasant experience. Affinia Dumont was a five star hotel at an affordable price. We got a great deal through travel zoo, $179.00 a night, and we stayed 7 nights. Our room had two double beds and a kitchen which came in very handy for drinks and breakfast. The room was huge, which surprised me since in NYC space is very limited. The hotel itself was fantastic but on top of that the location was unbelievable. A short walk to many of NYC major attractions. We walked to the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Plaza, St. Paticks Cathedral, Madison Square, Times Square, and Times Square Park. Once we even walked back from the American Museum Of Natural History. The boys (910) enjoyed the lounge area with ipods and very comfy chairs. They enjoyed the huge desk/work area which came in handy when prepping our signs for the Today Show. They enjoyed the pillow menu, and were able to try the down feather and memory foam pillows. There are tons of restaurants, cafes, delis and shops close to the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will stay at Affinia again and again averytime I go back to NYC.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Would stay here again My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in March. We chose this hotel based on its tripadvisor rating and were not disappointed.We had a studio suite which is the cheapest room, but it was huge. The beds were comfortable, modern decoration, modern clean bathroom and handy kitchen. The location is good. 5 mins walk from the subway at 33rd street, near lots of bars/delis/restaurtants on 3rd Ave, 5-10mins walk from the Empire State Building, but it is still very quiet.Doormen very (but not too) friendly.The only reason we have not given a 5 is the lack of bar/cafe in the hotel. If you dont fancy a restaurant meal and are too exhausted from all the sight seeing to go and get anything else(!), there is no other option.Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

<Author>shadrian
<Content>Brilliant !!! Stayed at the Affinia Dumont in March. Had an excellent stay, New York is fantastic and the Affinia Dumont was a great place to return to at the end of a hectic day.We got upgraded to a suite (living area / kitchen / bedroom and bathroom ). The decor was tasteful, the room was kept spotlessly clean and we received a bottle of wine on arrival as it was our anniversary. The bed was very comfortable and big.Reception was welcoming and Donald our concierge was excellent.As for proximity to the sights - the Empire State building is 5 /10 minutes away, along with Macys. Grand Central is 10 minutes heading up to central Manhattan. It is easy to walk everywhere from here, although you may want to jump in a cab on your way home after a days walking (we only used cabs not buses or the subway).These are very reasonable about 6 to 10 dollars per journey.For breakfast, there are loads of excellent Deli's around to grab a bacon  egg bagel or oatmeal !Overall the Affinia is close enough to all the attractions but is in a quiet spot on 34th street and therefore does not have the mayhem and noise of times square area.We are desperate to return to New York City and when we do, we would not stay anywhere else !!!!Make a reservation, you won't regret it.

<Author>Iain____Mitchell
<Content>Drab  I have just returned from a 7 Day holiday in New York City and unfortunately made the mistake of booking the Affinia Dumont. I made the choice after reading other trip advisor member reviews and seeing that the hotel is ranked as one of NY's best. I have always been delighted with previous hotels I have booked as a result of trip advisor but certainly not on this occasion. This hotel is best summed up as drab and dreary. Let me explain. The reception area is similar to that of a travelodge/motel. The carpets throughout the hotel are dirty and worn, the room is dreary, no colour anywhere and the hotel smells musty. There is no bar, no restaurant and no where nice to relax after a day in the city. The Affinia is way overpriced for what it offers. Friends were staying at various other hotels in NY and were much closer to everything, paid much less and had much more facilities. The Affinia Dumont may cater for a business person who needs a bed for the night and the company is picking up the tab but if you are a tourist looking to enjoy NYC then please book another hotel. I met friends at the Novotel and can vouch for the superior condition/quality of this particular hotel. To be fair on the Affinia staff, they were friendly and welcoming and the bed was very comfortable however The Affinia is simply just not worth the money.  
<Date>Apr 13, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Shabby and depressing My partner and I usually decide where to stay in holiday ultimately based on Tripadvisor ratings and we have been delighted with our choices so far. Because the Affinia Dumont received an overall rating of 4.5 and ranked number 3 of all NY hotels, and because the rooms were described as spacious, we booked it. I should point out that we really wanted to stay at other hotels but because we booked late, they were not available.We simply cannot understand the enthusiasm of the other reviewers for Affinia Dumont - its almost like we were at another hotel! How it could rank as the Tripadvisor third most popular hotel in NY is unfathomable! It compares, at best, to a shabby two-star hotel in UK. The lobby and reception are small and shabby. The porters are friendly, but a little over-the-top (15min of extolling the virtues of the hotel when you've just travelled transatlantic on two filghts - enough!). The room was OK, size-wise, but had not been painted for a long time, was very very dull, and did not smell terribly pleasant. Same with the bathroom and kitchen. The kitchen was like something from a very old mobile home/caravan. The decor was dull and dusty and just did not work. The corridor outside the room constantly smelt of heavy cigar smoke, don't know why. On evening after a long days shopping, it started to rain heavily when we got back to our room and we decided to eat in the Barking Dog- this is not actually part of the hotel; it is next door. The food and service at the BD was pretty bad. Would not go back. The other problem was that the hotel was at least a 20min walk to the action/centre/theatres etc. The nearest metro was at 33rd St,., 5 min away but this station was a little disconnected in that only you can go north/south easily but not east/west.What really nailed it for us was that our friends were staying at Novotel on 52nd St. They paid 800 dollars less than us and their hotel was absolutely gorgeous! The bar area was so nice with a great view of Times Sq, the rooms were same size as ours and the hotel was right in the middle of town, but very quiet. We would give Novotel a 4! It had a great bar and a nice restaurant. Going back to our hotel (no bar or decent restaurant) was a chore after we saw Novotel. Our other friends also had much nicer hotels for less money.Overall, we did not like the dingy dull depressing Affinia Dumont and it is not worth anything like what they charge. We usually like to stay at 4star hotels and if you do too, do not stay at Affinia. Please do not be misled by the other reviews, you could do much better. NYC is brilliant though - firedly, clean, safe, buzzing!  
<Date>Apr 10, 2006

<Author>iamnotanoun
<Content>Lovely I read the Trip Advisor review on this hotel and booked it at the last minute for a business/personal trip. I am extremely happy that I did. The positives; the room (junior suite) I stayed in, 3405, has views of both the Chrysler building and the water. it is very large for a NYC hotel room and the price I paid (which was a special) made it a tremendous value. I am not particularly high maintenance so I had little interaction with the staff. They were friendly and the restaurant recommendations were good. The Morgan Hill neighborhood was a treat to wander through (I prioritize character and color over elegance) and there were many good restaurants within a short walking distance. I am a walker and the distance from the common sites was not a problem for me. The train and subway are close. Taxi's were easy to get. Having stayed in many well known NYC hotels at a much higher rate, I am quite pleased with my experience. My preference was to keep this gem to myself but since I did find it on Trip Advisor, I thought I owed you all :-)  
<Date>Apr 9, 2006

<Author>Royzee
<Content>Great Location, staff, amenities Thanks to previous Tripadvisor reviewers! Hotel within a long (30-45 minute) walk or a short cab ride to downtown  theatre district. 8 blocks from Grand Central. Smiling, helpful, knowledgeable Staff- really made you feel special. <Author>CitySlicker69
<Content>WHAT A FIND! We just moved away from NYC and came into town for a visit...with our daughter and our 70-lb dog. Now if I'd had $500 bucks to spend per night, I'd have probably stayed at the Gansevort. But we were on a $200/night budget. I really couldn't believe our luck to have found this hotel. We had a junior suite for $199/night. It's was extremely spacious, clean and had incredible views. On top of this, the staff was nice, accomodating and very welcoming to our dog. They even provided bowls and a bone. The location was also surprisingly convenient. We even took a nice walk to Central Park one day...and the East Village the next. Of course, the subway is only a block away as well. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're coming to NYC.
