<Author>uroman
<Content>new york hotel We stayed 5 days at the Affinia Dumont March 23-28th and were not disappointed. We chose this hotel based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor which were pretty much accurate reports.The desk and bellmen were the most friendy I have seen with good recommendations for dinner and sights.We had an excellent room on the 34th floor which was a large studio with a kitchen.We made use of the coffee maker and the refrigerator only but one could make a meal there if desired. The bed and pillows were excellent. The bathroom was small but who spends a lot of time in there anyway. Water pressure was good but the water temperature seemed to vary from warm to hot.The view was unbelievable with a vista of midtown that was spectacular with the lit up Chrysler building right in the middle.We did not make use of the dayspa but it looked very nice.Location was excellent as in a residential part of Manhattan with less noise and neon lights then those closer to Times Square.A lot of restaurants on 34th and 3rd with a deliciuos Spanish retaurant behind the hotel on 33rd called Marbella. There are 2 supermarkets on 3rd avenue and a drug store across the street.Subway 1 block away on Park and 33rd street. If you are going to be there for 4-7 days I recommend buying the 7 day unlimited metrocard for 24 dollars as it was well worth the cost for bus and subways.Three excellent places to eat.1.Cafe Boulud-- French expensive but worth it2. Novita -- Italian on 20th and Lexington for Italian3. Antique Garage--Turkish food in Soho on Mercer street.If you are flying in from JFK consider taking the Airtrain to the Long island railroad which gets you to Penn Station for 10 dollars a person off peak and get a cab from there. It is only about 30 minutes from JFK to central Manhattan using this service.I would definitely stay here again!  
<Date>Mar 29, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>More than I expected I had always heard that NYC hotels are overpriced and small. This was neither. I found a great package deal (booked air and hotel bundled together), which made the room relatively inexpensive for the quality. I was very surprised at how large and nice the room was. Here are the positives and negatives:Positives:* large, nicely-decorated, super-clean room at great price* soft bed/sheets* choice of 3 kinds of pillows (all 3 are on the bed already, just ask for more if you want more of one specific pillow) - all 3 are super nice* full-size mirror on wall* quiet A/C - Heater* regular wooden hangers in closet (not the anti-theft kind - classy touch)* complementary, full-size umbrella in room (only for use during your stay - very classy, plus it is available for purchase for under $10 in case it is raining when you check out!)* digital combination safe* desk with herman miller chair* high-speed internet available* kitchen with large fridge, oven/stove, sink, coffee maker, and dishes (yes, there is also dishwashing liquid)* nice marble counter in bathroom* one adjustable mirror next to sink and another in shower* bathroom fully stocked (and restocked daily) with Aveda bath products and soft towels* strong water pressure in shower* very courteous staffNegatives:* toilet paper is very rough (Scott's brand). If I had though about it, I would have walked to the corner store and bought some Charmin or Cottonelle or something.* shower temperature fluctuated from scalding hot to luke-warm, (not so bad as to make the shower experience unenjoyable though. Just had to adjust the temperature a few times during shower)

<Author>Mandogbroon
<Content>Great Hotel - Great Service! We returned this week from a 7 night stay at the Affinia Dumont and were totally impressed!Our room - a studio room with king size bed - was absolutely spotless and was cleaned (kitchen  bathroom too) to this standard daily. It was spacious, exceptionally comfortable and the kitchen was absolutely ideal for the few occasions when we just wanted to make ourselves a snack / breakfast / eat our take-away! It's also very peaceful - with only a handful of rooms on each floor, there was never any disturbance / noise from other guests walking the corridor.Location is good - it's an easy walk to Macy's and on to Times Square; ESB is also literally a 5 minute walk away. The service provided by staff was fantastic and we have never been made to feel so genuinely welcome in a hotel - the porters  doormen were just brilliant.We've noticed some slightly negative feedback re. the Barking Dog restaurant next door to the hotel. At the end of the day I suppose it might just come down to the type of food / restaurant you enjoy, but again we could not fault the service or the meals served here. Nope, it's not an haute cuisine restaurant but we didn't have that expectation. Food was served promptly, was piping hot, was as described on the menu and was really tasty! (Portions are massive too -excellent value for money!)We would have no hesitation in recommending the Affinia Dumont and we would re-book in a flash. It's a great base from which to explore NYC with the added bonus of exceptional service.  
<Date>Mar 18, 2006

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel Stayed at the affinia dumont for 4 nights. On arrival we were given a room on the 6th floor, with no view. After requesting a room on a higher floor we were reserved the 36th floor for 3 nights. The staff were excellent and our bags were moved for us while we spent the day in the city. This hotel is located on east 34th street. It was a perfect location for us as we like to be close to everything but far enough away to get some peace! It was 5-10 mins walk from The Empire State building, Macy's, 5th ave... The view from our room was breath taking - especially by night!! The hotel is very clean, and the staff were polite and helpful.This hotel is in a perfect location if you don't want to stay in the busy, noisier parts of the city. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Place My family and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont for one night and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is off the beaten track so be ready to walk or to take a cab to Times Square. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. We were traveling with 4 children so the room needed to be roomy and have enough beds for all. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with 2 beds and a pullout. The beds were very comfortable with down comforters and specialty pillows. The kids loved the idea of ordering different types of pillows for their comfort! The bathroom was large with great Aveda products. Withing 2 blocks is a diner..Murray Hill Diner and Starbucks is on the corner. The price was affordable and we would definently stay there again!

<Author>sylvester42
<Content>Thoroughly enjoyable stay! My husband and I arrived in a snowy New York on Thursday afternoon and were warmly greeted by the hotel staff. Check in took only a few moments with our luggage being taken up to the room for us.Our room was on the 25th floor and had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building and other skyscrapers.The room was almost like a mini apartment it had so much space. The King size bed was extremely comfortable and there was even a choice of pillow. Plenty of space for clothes in drawers and wardrobe. Bathroom was compact, but very clean and had plenty of towels and toiletries.The theme of the hotel is fitness, so if you hadn't time to go to the spa or fitness suite you could hire a kit for your room e.g yoga.The Barking Dog restaurant is next door to the hotel. We ate there one evening.The service was good and I had a lovely glass of red wine, but we were very disappointed with the food. The reception staff and doormen were very helpful when asking for directions etc and always greeted us when leaving or entering the hotel.The hotel is a short walk from the Empire State Building and Macey's etc. But you can't go to a city and not expect to do some walking! We walked miles!I would definitely stay here again as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

<Author>dm3890
<Content>Great spot The Affinia Dumont was everything that reviewers said it was. Located on the east side of the city in the Murray Hill neighborhood, the hotel is conveniently located to the subway (33rd Street), Grand Central, the Empire State Building, and the Midtown Tunnel. Neighboring restaurants were great (Thai food at the Lemongrass). The area around the hotel was safe and clean. The rooms were unbelievabley spacious (for NYC)--we had a studio which had a king sized bed, a large desk and bureau, tv, large full length mirror, kitchenette, and nice bathroom. Spacious closet with iron and full size ironing board. The rooms were also very clean. We were on the 33rd floor with a grand view to the south--lots of light. The desk staff and doormen were helpful, as well. I did not notice this mentioned in other reviews, but the Affinia is a health-oriented hotel and provides spa services, as well as a large workout space. We got a good rate from Expedia for this hotel, otherwise it is a bit pricey.

<Author>Laineylop
<Content>Good Stay, Functional Hotel in Quiet Area My boyfriend and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont for 4 nights on the basis of the recommendations on this site. Whilst we enjoyed a comfortable stay in the hotel, I would say the hotel just met my expectations which were fairly high in light of the hotel's no. 2 ranking on TA at the time of booking. However, having stayed in NY before on only one previous occasion (in 5* hotel at company's expense), it would be fair to say that I didn't know what to expect for a 3 1/2* hotel and for the $ we paid. Despite the initial downbeat tone of the review, there were many positives. The hotel room was very spacious. We booked a studio suite which contained a great king size bed, comfy chair, nice work area, good sized kitchen area and an adequate bathroom. The decor was in good condition and neutral, albeit we weren't big fans of the duvet cover. We also changed our pillows straight away as we were initially supplied with feather ones (not good for allergies). The kitchen area contained everything you would need to prepare basic meals but we chose not to use it as there are too many great dining options in the city. We also didn't eat at the Barking Dog for the same reason. The bathroom was a little bit small but this was more than compensated by the excellent shower (constant hot water and good water pressure!). I've stayed at a number of hotels which would have been excellent but the shower let it down. I was glad that the Dumont didn't have the same problem.We also liked the location of the hotel. At first we were put off by the nearby buildings which were residential and looked a bit bleak. However, we soon warmed to it. OK, so the immediate location is unlikely to feature in any romantic movies, but was convenient for us gawking tourists who wanted to explore most of the city on foot. The subway on 33rd Street is very close to the hotel and Penn station is only a 10 minute walk which gives you the option of taking the Long Island Rail Road (LIRR) to / from JFK. We took the LIRR from JFK to the hotel and were happy to save the $40 compared to our $60 cab fare on the way back. Our first stop was always going to the Empire State Building so it was great that it was a straight walk along 34th from the hotel as we were exhausted after an early flight. Macy's is also nearby for those who love department stores (too much choice for me!). On the negative side, our room was by no means a room with a view. On booking the hotel I specifically asked for a room with a good view of the Manhattan sky line since our stay was for my boyfriend's 30th birthday. Our view was pretty appalling as it overlooked a car park and some other run down buildings. It was a bit of a shock at first so I immediately went back to reception and asked if we could change rooms to one with a view, ideally of the Chrysler Building (which the hotel is meant to offer). Whilst the receptionist was polite about my request, she didn't really make much of an effort to accommodate it and said that she couldn't offer us an alternative room. I found this a bit unusual considering that the hotel was by no means fully booked . I've also read a number of reviews of this hotel where guests were offered an upgrade but that certainly was never offered to us. Not much I could do though so I returned to my room with a dismal view. I doubt the view would have looked much better even if the windows had been cleaned...We had a couple of other gripes as well. Firstly we returned to the hotel one day to get changed for the evening only to find that our hotel room door had been left opened by the maid. We had left her a tip every day as well! Thankfully nothing was missing but that should never had happened in the first place. Our other gripe was that room service finished at 11pm. For the city that never sleeps we found that a bit early. We went to the basketball, theatre, etc in the evenings and would have appreciated being able to get a meal back at the hotel one of the nights as it was so cold outside to walk around. I appreciate that not every hotel can offer 24 hour room service, but midnight would have been good enough for us. Additionally, while the hotel is of a good size, we got the impression that there was lack of staff as no matter what extension we dialled we got through to the same person on reception! Overall, we had a good stay at the Affinia Dumont and would definitely consider returning, perhaps to the Affinia 50 property. However, I think it is only fair that potential future guests are more aware of some of the shortfalls of this hotel. Like everything else, the hotel represented a compromise. In this case the compromise is between space and ambience as the hotel was a bit clinical (as you would expect from a hotel aimed at the business market). I would still nevertheless recommend the hotel to those who regard space as their main priority when selecting a hotel.  
<Date>Mar 1, 2006

<Author>Grommit7
<Content>Very Comfortable I am a very particular traveler and found this hotel to be exactly as described by the many other positive posts on Trip Advisor. The Affinia Dumont is simply a very comfortable place to lodge while in Manhattan. The service was excellent from check-in to check-out. The rooms were large, clean, updated and again, very comfortable. The size of the hotel is also a plus-with only 5 or so rooms per floor, the feel of the hotel is intimate as opposed to anonymous. I am returning to NYC at the end of March and will stay again at the Dumont.

<Author>Coastal-Confessions
<Content>Great Service, Large Rooms Stayed on business on first trip to NYC. Great location within easy walking distance of Empire State Bldg.-Macy's, Madison Square GardenAttached restaurant is average and cramped, recommend walking down to the corner where there are 10 restaurants/sports bars to choose from (Blockhead Burritos was good for a casual dinner)Hotel is Mod Deco and the rooms are very large with full kitchens and good work areas. Did not use Spa, but the workout facility is clean and up to date.Hotel staff (especially the doormen) were ever-present and courteous.One of my associates had issues with the heat, where the heat ran all night and roasted her. I had a opposite issue, where the heat quit the last night. The night-time manager was quick to send someone up to check on it and tranferred me to another room when the problem could not be fixed.We both received credits the next day on our bill.Assuming the heating issues are one-offs, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Upper Manhatten/34th StreetAlso, neighborhood is safe and quiet and there is even a Duane Reed drugstore across the street (of course there's a Duane Reed on every corner it seems)  
<Date>Feb 27, 2006

<Author>theteacher2001
<Content>An excellent stay at the Dumont We are a young couple who stayed at the Affinia Dumont for five nights during February 2006. This hotel is presented as a fitness hotel. This means they offer a gym (No pool) for you to exercise in during your stay. They will also provide, free of charge, an exercise pack for your room or suite. These packs centre on a particular theme such as Yoga or Weight Training. The rooms appear brand new and are obviously well kept. They offer a large room in which to sleep (A major plus against other NYC hotels) with two queen size beds in a studio suite. The bathroom is again large with a bath and shower and a large wall mirror. All the rooms come with a small kitchen with appliances such as: cooker, fridge freezer, microwave and coffee maker. This kitchen is ideal if you have small children and you need to provide food as and when. The view from the windows can be great so ask for a high floor. The television is large and offers several high end channels such as HBO and childrens entertainment, so there is plenty to watch if you decide to stay in. The room also has a small electronic safe for any valuables which is free of charge. They also offer a pillow menu where you can you choose pillows such as Swedish Memory.The location of the hotel is ideal being 4 blocks away from the Empire State Building and one block from 33rd Street subway. If you fly in from JFK the hotel is not far away from the tunnel which leads to the highway towards the airport. Around the hotel there are several bars and restaurants and various grocery shops which are ideal for getting supplies for the room. The staff at the hotel are great and if you need anything such as a restaurant recommendation of how to get to somewhere just ask and they will help. Once a week the hotel has a meet the staff session with free wine, cheese and a massage!To conclude this is an excellent hotel with an excellent location and staff whom bend over backwards to ensure your have a great stay.  
<Date>Feb 25, 2006

<Author>Tackle
<Content>Developing an Affinity for this Hotel Reservations: Got a great rate thru the links at Trip Advisor.Check-in: Efficient, courteous and highly professional.Room: extremely large by New York standards, especially at this price. It was well furnished with comfortable beds, and the rest of the furniture was in good condition. Nice kitchenette for those inclined towards in room dining. The bathroom was large and nicely appointed, with excellent soaps and shampoo. The towels were average BUT certainly not luxurious. The water pressure and temperature was excellent. The television was nice.Check-out: excellent and fast.The location in Murray Hill is convenient to MidTown and most parts of Lower Manhatten.Additional comments: we had to ask twice to have the toilet fixed (it was continuously running) and NO one ever showed up to fix it.The gym was very nice by hotel standards.Like most hotels they still charge about $10 per day for internet access; when will this be included in the normal room charge? Who these days wants to sit in the hotel lobby for free internet access?

<Author>mrsblue
<Content>A Greate Place To Stay - Definitely Recommend! We took the advice of the recommendations given on TripAdvisor and boy you were right! This place is a gem in the big apple! We stayed for two nights this weekend and had a fantastic room overlooking the East River on one side and the city skyline on the other. It was a wonderful corner room on the 29th floor. We made the reservation over the internet for a junior suite, and then called up a few days later to ensure we had room with a view. They were very accommodating! We were able to watch the sunrise over the East River - it was quite beautiful. The room itself was quite big with a king size bed, an executive desk, couch, chair, coat rack, and fully equiped kitchen. The bed was the most comfortable bed we slept on in all our hotel experiences. The kitchen was great - it had a gas stove, full size refrigerator, and built-in microwave oven. The bathroom was a good size bathroom, however, it didn't have much shelf space. The hotel had a fully equipped gym and a day spa. We looked around at the gym and the spa but did not have time to use the facilities. They both looked wonderful. The staff at the hotel were quite acccommodating and friendly. They got cabs for us, and gave us detailed maps and directions about the city. We highly recommend this place and would definitely return! Great place!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent Value! My husband and I spent one night at the Affinia Dumont in NYC on Feb 18th. After scouring the internet for good deals on hotels, we came across this one. For the money, it was an excellent value. The rooms were very spacious, clean, modern. Comfortable beds and pillows. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Parking was easy and not terribly expensive-35 dollars for every 24 hours. The only negative is its not centrally located, thus you spend a good deal of money taking cabs everywhere. I would definitely stay at this hotel again though and absolutely recommend it!!

<Author>wiggleit15
<Content>A nice stay at the Affinia Dumont My boyfriend and I stayed on Valentine's day and enjoyed the hotel. We picked it based on Tripadvisor reviews, and while I think that there are probably much nicer hotels in New York City, that it was a good value and very comfortable. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. The living room is nice but not spectacular, with a big desk a couch, television, dvd and music players. The kitchen was small but necessary for us, as we decided to cook for ourselves. There were a few pots, some plates, forks, knives, the generally necessary utensils. The bedroom was lovely with a huge and comfortable bed. We loved the fluffy white comforter and the pillows (they have a pillow menu from which you can choose buckwheat, hypo-allergenic, and swedish memory!) I recommend the hypo-allergenic. Everything was clean and just fine in the room.What I loved most about the hotel was the service. We called housekeeping for a sharper knife and they brought it with a smile. The same housekeeper brought us our pillows, and the toothpaste we requested in the morning. The staff was very nice and that matters a lot. Overall, a nice stay, and we would stay there again.  
<Date>Feb 15, 2006

<Author>sprogsgran
<Content>Comfortable stay at the Dumont We stayed at the Affinia Dumont after being transferred from the Shelburn. It was for a 60th birthday trip organised by my family. We were given a suite with a view of the Chrysler building. The hotel is ideally placed for sightseeing. The staff were extremely helpful and full of advice. We had a problem with the safe in the room but each time maintenance attended immediately and sorted the problem. It was eventually traced to the fact that we had placed a mobile phone inside, once this was removed all was okay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. the Barking Dog Restaurant attached to the hotel is also a great place to eat.

<Author>BocaLaw
<Content>Honest Assesment Stayed three nights first week in January. Good rate of $249/night through Affinia website. Arrived around 1:30 pm, luggage promtly taken by porter curbside. Check in prompt and friendly. Request for upper floor room w/ a view granted. One bedroom suite 22nd floor with a great view of Chrylser bldg and city. Room was very good size for NYC and spotlessly clean. Aveda toiletries, great beds, small kitchen (which came in handy for snacks/drinks). Noticed heater was making loud rattling noise. Called front desk - maintenance had it fixed in 20 minutes. Suite had a good sized work desk for biz travelers. Showers steaming hot with great pressure. Turn down service was perfect. Some street noise even 22 floors up but hey, this is New York! Decor is contemporary but not over the top so.Location is excellent. Several great restaurants one block away on 3rd. Greek restaurant, Ethos, had the best baby lamb chops I have ever had. Murray Hill Diner, also one block away,awesome for breakfast. Duane Read Drug Store directly across the street very convenient. This hotel is in a renovated former apartment bldg. The lobby is small but fine. There seemed to be not more than 4-5 rooms on each floor. The theme of the hotel is fitness but we did not really use those facilities. There were only two SMALL negatives. First the elevators were a little scary. We actually got stuck between floors once for a minute and they were a little bouncy. Affinia had elevator repair people there during our stay. This was nothing major and shoud not deter anyone from staying there. Second, the doormen were a bit spotty. What I mean by that is that sometimes they were there and sometimes they were not. When we did see them they were courteous and friendly.Overall this is a very nice hotel in a great part of town and is part of a chain that seems to be making quite a name for itself with its various properties throughout NYC. You should not expect over-the-top white glove service as you might at the Four Seasons, Trump, The Pierre, etc., etc., Just a very nice, very clean no hassle stay. Definetly above average, perhaps just shy of excellent. If you can book a room under $200 or a suite under $300, grab it! Would I try one of Affinia's other NYC properties? Absolutely! Hope this helps.  
<Date>Jan 9, 2006

<Author>sigmund
<Content>Acceptable but not #2 in New York Stayed on the basis of TripAdvisor reviews in early December. As others have said, the hotel is very well positioned, the staff are friendly and helpful and the main bedroom large and clean. The bathroom was rather small; the kitchen was fairly useful but could be better employed. The bed was very comfortable and the furniture and carpet OK, but showed wear and tear. The view was unexciting. There is a very small public area.The hotel was perfectly adequate for our needs but it is not first class. In my view, it should only enjoy its premier position in TripAdvisor hall of fame by charging relatively low rates. We however paid 322 (about $550) on average per night via expedia - which is about twice the rate that I think the hotel is worth. It was of course Christmas but I believe the room was still significantly overpriced. At half this price, the Affinia Dumont would warrant an verage?to above average rating.

<Author>tjwb
<Content>First Class Stay My wife and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont hotel during a long weekend trip to New York over Thanksgiving Weekend at the end of November. We booked entirely having read reviews on TripAdvisor and were not disappointed. It was my wife first trip to NY and I asked if we could have a room with a good view on a high floor and we were given an excellent room on the 32 floor with amazing views to the Chrysler Building and beyond. The reception staff and concierge team were excellent throughout the stay and went out of their way to be helpful and welcoming to us.Our room was very large ?unbelievably so by Manhattan standards, well equipped and spotlessly clean. The bed was huge and very comfortable, the linen excellent and importantly it was very quiet. I stay in a lot of hotels on business and this felt extremely good. We didn use the kitchenette or the hotel restaurant next door ?there were too many other places to go ?you MUST go to balthazarny in SoHo ?but book before you go ?it amazing. If I had one criticism it would be the size of the bath ?but I 6??and don often find hotel baths big enough ?it was fine for my wife.The location is perhaps a couple of blocks further south than you would choose in an ideal world, but pretty much everything is in walking distance or a quick cab.This is the second hotel we have picked entirely as a result of its rating on this site (the other being the Hotel Lbbaye in Paris earlier this year) and I would commend it to you.

<Author>Geej
<Content>Everything We Hoped For We took our 2 sons (ages 12 and 8) to NYC for 3 nights to see the sights and stayed at the Affinia Dumont. It was fabulous. The hotel has a very small personable feel. The lobby is quite small but elegant. It feels like your own personal place. We had a junior suite that we got for $209 per night (I got that special rate directly from the hotel on the phone.) It had a great King bed (luxurious and so comfortable)and comfy pull-out sofa for the boys. The suite was one large room (#1905) set on a corner and shaped like an L -- very large. We overlooked the Chrysler building out one window and the East River out the other. Fabulous views if you can get up to the top 10 floors. We had a nice kitchen complete with dishes, pots, toaster, microwave and oven/stove and big frig. The bathroom was brand new, marble, and worked great -- strong shower, lots of shelves, hooks, racks and counter space -- great for 4 people. We also had a desk/dresser unit with an office type chair. The sofa also had a nice round coffee table and a big stuffed chair. There was also a big closet and ironing board and safe near the front door.The central location was great too. When we arrived by train we walked from Penn Station with our three rolling bags -- just 6 blocks east to the hotel. We also walked back from seeing the Producers at 44th and 8th last night (although my 8 year old did whine a little). The staff couldn't be nicer. They helped us get theater tickets and were great following up with me while I was back home. When we got there they had not made up the sofa bed for the boys so we called down at 10pm the first night. The housekeeping staff had already left so the manager ended up coming up with a really nice comfy down comforter and actually made the bed himself. There were 2 grocery stores within 2 blocks (one a Dagastinos) where we bought bagels and cereal for breakfast each morning and ate in the suite (looking at the great view). There is also a great little bar/restaurant next door called the Barking Dog where we got a wonderful late dinner one night. We also ate a block away at Blockhead's Burritos which had great mexican food that we all loved and great margaritas. There are 5-7 other small restaurants nearby, including a McDonald's and a Blockbuster across the street. My husband also worked out in the gym every morning (there is also a small spa that smelled great). All in all, this hotel is great!! And what a deal!!  
<Date>Dec 29, 2005

<Author>Lollanna
<Content>A quality stay at the Affinia Dumont I highly recommend staying here...it's number two on tripadvisor for a reason!As soon as you enter the hotel, you are struck by the relaxed atmosphere and pleasant staff. Nothing is too much trouble and the staff will go that extra mile to ensure that you have a great stay. For example, when we arrived at the hotel we asked for a room with a view, if possible and sure enough we got a fantastic corner suite on the 30th floor that had an amazing panoramic view of the skyline.We got a Junior Suite. It was incredibly spacious. From my past New York experience I was expecting a cupboard but it was impressive in size. The kitchen has a family sized refridgerator, coffee maker, microwave, oven etc...We ate some of our meals and snacks on the sofas in the seating area which had a big coffee table.The bed is huge (King sized and then some!), comfortable and a pillow menu is on hand to guarantee a good night's sleep.The desk area is large and I would imagine great for business visitors although we hardly ever used it except to store stuff on.The TV has all the channels you could want including HBO etc. The only gripe I had was that you couldn't really watch it in bed unless you physically turned it round....The bathroom was okay - probably the least attractive room. The shower had a propensity to go from hot to cold unpredictably and the worst point was that the bath didn't drain properly. However, the Aveda toiletries went some way to make up for that!The hotel also had fitness facilities and a spa. I didn't actually take advantage of these but I imagine that they, like the rest of the hotel, were of a high standard.Next door to the hotel is the Barking Dog restaurant, a neighbourhood place, that serves good standard dishes. We ate there a couple of times and thought it was good value.All in all we enjoyed our stay. Would we stay there again? Definitely.  
<Date>Dec 29, 2005

<Author>Katze
<Content>Great Hotel, Fantastic Service I stayed here for one night with my husband. We stayed in a studio suite, which was the biggest room I've ever had in NYC. We loved having a full size fridge to store drinks and it was lovely being able to make hot tea in the morning. We had burgers next door at the Barking Dog for lunch and it was really good. The service was a bit hasty as it was extremely busy, but still good overall. The service at the Affinia Dumont is the best I've ever experienced in a NYC hotel. The doormen were so helpful and really knew the city inside and out. The front desk staff were efficient and very friendly. The staff just really helped to make the stay extra nice. Overall, just a great hotel. This and the Westin in Times Square are my favorites.

<Author>ChoosyPerson
<Content>Fantastic hotel! Great service, very clean and comfortable! We booked Affinia Dumont based solely on reviews from this site and we made the right choice!We had a basic double room and it was fantastic - I can only imagine what the bigger suites are like! The room was big and spacious with a very comfortable bed, comfortable armchair, large desk and chair, plenty of drawer space, and a decent size wardrobe with a safe. The bathroom was fairly small but very clean and well kept, with Aveda products and plenty of towels. Iron and ironing board were in the room as well as a hairdryer. The room also had a kitchen with fridge, cooker and microwave. There is a big TV of course and also a radio with CD player.The staff are incredibly friendly and extremely helpful, and the location of the hotel is amazing - less than 3 blocks from the Empire State Building! We asked for a high floor and got the 25th, with a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building on the other side of the hotel.This is a really great hotel, very comfortable and a perfect base for visiting New York - do not hesitate to book, we were there for 5 nights and we will definitely return!  
<Date>Dec 10, 2005

<Author>garymac1965
<Content>Better than expected My wife and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont over the Thanksgiving weekend with our choice of hotel based solely on the recomendations from this site. We were not disapppointed and to be honest the room we had on the 10th floor was even better than we had hoped for.The staff we came across were all very helpful and polite considering their work was keeping them away from their families on thanksgiving and nothing seemed like too much bother for them.The location of the hotel was in a quieter area of the city but still allowed for easy access to what we wanted to see. I cant comment on the restaurant as after the comments here we decided to eat elsewhere. The Frontier diner on 3rd avenue at 37th street was reasonably priced for breakfast and the food was good.If I were to return to New York, I would definitely make this my first choice for accomodation and would advise my friends and colleagues to stay here also.

<Author>jojovino
<Content>huge room Have just returned from a four night stay at the Affinia after recommendations from Tripadvisor. The hotel was all I expected and more! Although we arrived early, not expecting our room to be ready, it was, infact the receptionist askedif we minded being upgraded to a larger room!! Upon entering the room we were treated to the largest NY hotel room i have seen with two queen beds, a large double size desk/ TV area and a fully fitted kitchen.As there are only about 6 rooms on each floor we never heard any noise (apart from the taxi horns downstairs!).Each member of staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful and the lobby, although not having a bar area was pleasant and relaxing. Unfortunately the only thing letting the whole experience down was the Barking Dog restaurant next door where the food was fairly standard fare. Despitethis it definately filled a gap for hungry travellers straight off the flight from London!!The hotel was well placed on 34th Street for walking to all attractions/shops and we only needed to take a taxi once the whole time when we found ourselves on 80th Street after a stroll through Central Park!I will definately be recommending this hotel to all my friends and will definately choose the Affinia again if I return to NY.  
<Date>Nov 25, 2005

<Author>Loriners
<Content>Ideal centre from which to tour NY We chose this hotel for a short break in October on the strength of the recommendations on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. It's ideally situated in a pleasant part of town withing two blocks of the Empire State Building. The staff were charming and completely helpful. Our room was really more like a mini apartment with a generous sized bedroom complete with excellent desk facilities for those who need to work while on their visit. It had a generously proportioned, well-equipped kitchen and a very well appointed bathroom with good quality toiletries. The standard of the decor throughout was excellent. This was our first trip to NY and the Affinia Dumont was a major contributor to the best short break we've ever had. This was superb value - 3 nights for 2 people, plus 2 return flights from Heathrow for a little over 1000. We had a simply wonderful time. Can't recommended it highly enough!

<Author>lukey01
<Content>Great for the location and service?4/5 Ok so I went in Feb 2005 and am only just posing a review. Main reason been I was unsure as to whether I enjoyed the Hotel for what it was or enjoyed the hotel because I was simply in New York.We arrived at about 10:30pm Local time after a long flight from London. We were greeted at our Cab outside the hotel by a Friendly Gentleman who took our bags and put them on a trolley. I was only 20 at the time and I took my 18 year old girlfriend so upon check in I had to provide a credit card. (I used a photocopy version). We were then taken to about the 22nd floor and shown a room which I was impressed with but had two single beds. I ask for a King and without hesitation was taken to the 33rd floor and sure enough a King size bed with an Amazing view. (Looking out eastwards I think.) Unpacked and went straight downstairs where the same door man (a guy with a mustache and of Asian origin I think) called us a cab to time square.The next day I wanted to check the reservation I made at The River Caf was still ok. But me being me I had booked the wrong date?The young black lad on reception preceded to get us a reservation for the day we wantednd he succeeded. Overall the trip was amazing and the hotel made every effort in making this a better stay. Sure there are no lavish reception halls or Club Bars but for the price and service I would highly recommend this hotel. 4/5

<Author>MG
<Content>Overrated, is everybody reviewing the same hotel? I'm not sure that everybody is revewing the same hotel here. The Affinia Dumont is certainly not opposite Penn Station!I was extremely disappointed with the hotel, aside from the large rooms it didn't really do much for me. Despite a request when the booking was made (several months ago) for a high room with views we were on the 10th floor, they only had high floors available with single beds. No major problem but a little customer care goes a long way. The Concierge was actually whoever was on reception and in this instance was very poor, a request to confirm some restaurant reservations that we had made was noted but not acted upon, we discovered this when the restaurants in question rang to confirm our reservations themselves several hours later. When we requested information on getting to the airport we were pointed to the station and told that they couldn't call us a shuttle bus, we would have to do it ourselves!The rooms were large but old fashioned, the air conditioning units were very loud and I dread to think what it must be like during the summer. Noise from adjoining rooms and across the hallway was especially prevalent, lots of hotels have locked adjoining doors to rooms but the gaps between them left a lot to be desired and televisions and telephone conversations were clearly audible despite not being particularly loud and so much light came through from the neighbouring room that we had to block the doorway with towels.Overall I was disappointed and would have preferred a smaller room with better services. I struggle to understand why this is even in the top ten hotels in New York, let alone ranked number 3!  
<Date>Nov 14, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A pleasant surprise. This hotel is quite nice and clean, with huge rooms, excellent showers, comfortable beds, and very clean throughout. The gym has many options for however you like to work out. The neighborhood has tons of options for bars, restaurants just around the corner on 3rd. The funny thing is, the breakfast is delivered in a brown paper bag like it was picked up elsewhere, but it was good, just nothing fancy. I usually stay downtown in hipper hotels, which this place isn't, but if you're ok with not running into wannabes, it's fine. However, for the price, around $379 + tax, broadband internet should be included in-room, instead of the $45/week charge.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A gem We stayed here whilst it was beeing refurbished so were a bit apprehensive. We needn't have been. We entered the reception area and were surprised to find rennovations were almost complete, and was now looking extremelygrand and luxurious. The clerk was most helpful giving us all our special requests and upgraded us free to a suite. The lifts were plentiful and quick.Our room was extremely clean, the linen white and expensive, and the en-suitewas new and obviously recently remodeled. The only down side was no view but being in New York for the first time didn't matter as we were out all the time. This hotel is also directly opposite penn st station so no need for a taxi, just walk across the road. We have told all our friends not to stay anywhere else and cant wait to return.

<Author>cathob
<Content>Great Hotel I stayed at the Affinia Dumont at the start of October. I thought the overall standard of rooms, service and facilities were excellent. Check in was quick and easy, 4 lifts, all in order, all of the time. I was on the 32nd floor with views downtown.The room was large with two double beds, a kitchen (with fridge freezer, oven, microwave plus pans, cutlery, plates etc), plus large desk and chair, plenty of wardrobe space and decent mirrors. The bathroom was smart with a powerful shower and Aveda toiletries (lovely!).I never heard any of the other guests while there which made for a very peaceful stay. I didn't make use of the spa but would if I stayed again. There's also internet access in the lobby which was useful as I'd not brought a computer. The staff here were extremely helpful. They helped me work out which trains to get where and when I needed to see a doctor they put me in touch with one. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again. The only criticism I would have is that the phone calls made from the room were very dear (although I suppose that's true of most hotels).  
<Date>Oct 19, 2005

<Author>dsanchezVancouver
<Content>It doesn't get any better than at THE AFFINIA DUMONT... I have stayed in a fair share of hotels over the years and my whole experience at the Affinia Dumont was wonderful! We had a 1 bedroom suite for 5 people and it was fine. Having a kitchen was terrific! The service was exceptional and the staff couldn't have been more helpful or polite. Especially when you compare them to others in NYC, but that's a whole different story. The hotel even smells nice when you first enter. Kind of like a Spa. The location on 34th Street is great, unless you're wanting to be closer to Time Square. The subway is only 2 blocks away and you are surrounded by deli's and excellent coffee places. Ms. Iris Stacey was the manager of the hotel at the time of my stay, and she was the best! Stay here and enjoy yourself.......it's worth the money!!!

<Content>Fabulous! Fantastic hotel. This review is for women who love shopping and hate camping:) We got a deal $318/night CAD and it was worth every penny. <Author>SagTrav
<Content>Perfect stay We stayed four nights at the Affinia Dumont in October 2005, and found it to be perfect in every way. The Junior Suite was spacious with a huge work table and return (for a computer). The lighting was excellent (so often lacking) and the bed was super-comfortable (although the King bed was a little too bouncy which made it hard for two people to sleep, so we requested a change to two Queens and they also gave us a nice view with the change on our second day). The fully equipped kitchen was a great convenience, to store our wine, cheese, milk, etc., and we even made breakfast two mornings. The kitchen was spotless, including the regrigerator, microwave, dishes, etc. The bathroom was also spotless. The shower was powerful and the toiletries are excellent quality. When this is described as being in a residential neighborhood, that may be true, but it is a plus. There are delis, flower shops, restaurants, even a D'Agostino grocery store, on every block. Everything you could want is within a block or two. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly (see Donald for all your luggage and cab needs - he is adorable) and responsive. Do not eat at the Barking Dog next door; it is mediocre at best. There are plenty of other places. I did not even visit the fitness center or spa, and if I had, I am sure I'd have even more positive things to report. I will stay here again.  
<Date>Oct 11, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Brilliant!!! Where can I begin. We arrived fairly early and being on our honeymoon we had requested a room on a high level. The room was not quite ready for us, so the porter took our cases and we went and eat next door at the Barking Dog. Just to add, food is superb from here highly recommend it. Getting back to the hotel, our room was the biggest I had ever been in, it was a studio apartment, but the bed could have slept four adults. Reading other reviews saying that new york hotels have the smallest rooms. If you want space come to this Hotel. We also had a kitchen with everything you could need. The views were amazing and the location was five minutes walk from empire state building. We loved New York and would definately go back to this Hotel. The staff were very helpful and would do anything for you ( and I dont believe this was just to recieved a tip either )Its a three star hotel, but I would give it five stars.

<Author>jppalooza
<Content>Welcome here any time I could recommend this hotel to everyone, but I want a room here again the next time I visit, so let's keep it a secret. Clean, upscale, modern and with all the accessories/amenities you could want, including free use of a pedometer and CD player while you are there! We arrived late (at 1:00am) and they didn't have the exact room we requested (we wanted a high floor, king bed, non-smoking), but they upgraded us to a Jr. Executive Suite for our whole stay complimentary! Great views, excellent location and comfy beds, Aveda products, a kitchen that you can actually cook in, and never once did anyone bother us, including any noise from any other room! Can't say enough about our stay! Wonderful! Some say that the price can be a bit hig, but we got our room for $250/night including taxes  everything from Northwest Airlines website under their hotel section.

<Author>privatewire
<Content>Made the holiday Everything about this hotel was perfect, great location,great room, great staff.There was absolutely nothing to find fault with, every request was dealt with quickly and courteously by the extremely friendly staff. The room was huge, with great storage space and a large screen television,the air-con worked perfectly,coping with outside temperatures in the high 80s.The room was very well soundproofed,we never heard anything from any other guests,which is one of my pet hates, and we also had a great view of the East river (we were on the 26th floor)The area around the hotel is nice to explore and has loads of good bars and restaurants within easy walking distance, it is also very handy for the centre and is only a couple of blocks from the Empire States bulding.One other thing, my wife was delighted with the Aveda bath products!Dont be put off by a couple of bad reviews, this is a great hotel.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Brilliant Hotel !!!!!!! I had been planning my 40th birthday celebration and decided that 5 days in NYC was definately a way to remember it. Having booked my flights seperately, I searched through many hotel brochures and was dissapointed by most of what I found. However when I found the Affinia it took 2 mins to book this hotel.The web site was informative and helpful, and the rooms were an exact replica of the pictures on the website.The location was perfect, 1 minutes walk away from Penn station, couple of blocks away from Times Square,right opposite Madison Sqauare garden, couple of blocks walk away from Empire State buildingThe staff were curteous , helpful, cheeful and welcoming. When I needed to get an adaptor for my laptop or needed to request a late check out the front desk were quick to help me.The doorman tapped his cap each time we entered or left the hotel.The room was excellent, I had a junior suite with 2 bathrooms, high speed internet acces, a bottle of wine and chocolates on my arrival,comftable king size bed, commanding views of the skyline,supurbly equipped kitchen,lovely decor, the list goes on !!!!!!.The rooms were spacious and more than adequate from my wife, my 8 and 6 year old boys and me to share.We never felt like we were living on top of each other as you do in some hotel rooms.I have stayed in NYC on 3 other occasions and the hotels I chose were left in the dust by the facilities and amenities at the Affinia.All in all I found the Affinia great value for money. I am planning another trip to NYC and I will definately be booking the Affinia

<Author>JackSD
<Content>Comfort, convenience, great views... Too many New York hotels are legendary for having (a) rooms the size of postage stamps, (b) a surround-sound of constant noise, (c) web sites that bear no resemblance to their reality, and (d) prices far higher than the actual level of your experience. Blessedly, none of these things is true of the Affinia Dumont.This hotel is defined by two physical facts: its location in Manhattan, and its height. The block of East 34th Street on which it's located will never be the culminating scene of a romantic Hollywood movie full of visual cliches about New York. But it's fabulously convenient for anyone driving into or out of Manhattan, since it's a couple of blocks from either the exit of the Queens-Midtown Tunnel or the 34th Street exit from the FDR Drive, and offers a straight shot west to the Lincoln Tunnel entrance on the other island of the island. The location also leaves the hotel out of the traffic crunch and noise carnival nearer the heart of midtown. And it has great access on foot to the Empire State and Grand Central. Walk a little east and south, and you're in the heart of Murray Hill. The hotel's height -- 37 stories -- is also crucial, since that means that its rooms above 30 stories are remarkably quiet for Manhattan. And rooms on those floors also have commanding, handsome views of the Chrysler Building and other skyscrapers to the north, and the East River to the east.Room decor in the Affinia Dumont is comfortable and rather corporate, without being fussy or ornate. We had a junior suite for two nights and found it spacious for two people. Beds are very comfortable, mirrors abound, and high-speed Internet connections are in every room. The staff is faultlessly polite and cheerful, and the in-house spa and work-out room are welcoming and well-equipped.If there's a drawback, it's the absence of any public spaces, shop or restaurant in the hotel proper. The lobby is small and sleek in a nondescript kind of way -- no place where you'd want to linger. The adjoining restaurant, the Barking Dog, is cute as a cafe, but its role in providing room service leaves a lot to be desired, for a hotel that aims to offer luxury/boutique service. For example, breakfast orders are brought to the room in take-out fashion (in paper bags and foam cups), and the food quality is ordinary.But if you'd like a base of operations in New York that can give you the sensation of having your own quiet, attractive, roomy apartment, with classic Manhattan views and a location from which the whole island can readily be reached, this is it...  
<Date>Sep 6, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent hotel Just spent 5 days in New York and chose the hotel based upon reviews on this website. Felt compelled to write a review to validate other peoples comments on how good this hotel is. The first thing you notice is how huge the room is! At least 3 times the size of 'typical' manhatten shoe box hotel rooms. The inclusion of a kitchen/ lounge made my stay so much more comfortable. The service of the staff was of a very high quality with the room being spotlessly clean every day and the front desk being very helpful with enquiries and reservations. I would recommend checking several websites for prices for this hotel as I found a massive range in pricing as i think they discount the rooms heavily outside of business season. I went in August and as a result got an absolute bargin.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Affinia Dumont was great!! I recently stayed at the Affinia Dumont with my family for five nights while we were on vacation in New York. The hotel was excellent in all respects. It is located only a couple of blocks from the Empire State Building in New York City near the intersection of Lexington and 34th in the Murray Hill area. The subway was only a block and a half away and, while it was a healthy walk, we were able to walk to Times Square from the hotel.The room was much larger than I expected. It had a large living room with very attractive and comfortable furnishings, including a couch with a pull out bed, a comfortable easy chair and a very effecient office area. There was a large TV in the living room, a stereo and video game capability but we had little time to use any of those things while we were there. Our room also had a nice kitchenette with a refrigerator, stove, microwave and dishwasher. The bedroom was great as well. We had two queen size beds (real queen size beds not full size). The beds were VERY comfortable and they give you an option of several different pillows to choose from. The bedroom was also much larger than I expected. By comparsion, the rooms were much larger than what you normally get at an Embassy Suites and much larger than I ever expected in New York City.We were on the 32nd floor and looked right out on the Chrysler Building. We couldn't have asked for a better view. Also, there were only five rooms on our floor and everything was very quiet.The staff was very friendly and accomodating. One of the ladies at the front desk helped us arrange tour tickets and the valet helped us with directions on several occasions and travel arrangements to the airport. On our first night there, the air conditioner in the bed room was making a slight gurgling noise that wasn't bothersome but just didn't sound right. I reported it the next morning, and that day they sent someone up to look at it and that night the front desk called to see if the problem had been solved. The hotel has a fitness theme and has a full service spa on the second floor, which I never got to use. But I did use the fitness room, which was great. Each of the stairmasters, etc have a flat screen tv on it so you can watch whatever you want to. Also, in the lobby, they usually have a complimentary herbal tea, which was nice when we got back to the hotel after walking in the city- it was in the mid 90s when we were there.All in all this was one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in with very friendly people working there. I highly recommend it, whether it be for a business trip or a vacation.  
<Date>Jul 31, 2005

<Author>cinderellasmom
<Content>Great hotel, large rooms I have stayed in several hotels in New York City over the years and I have to say that price for value was fantastic here. We chose this hotel because I didn't want to stay in times square... and most of the hotels uptown either didn't have 2 bedroom suites or were way out of our price range. We rented a two bedroom suite for my parents, myself and my 5 month old. We wanted to have a middle area for us all to hang out in, plus more room to walk the baby about in the middle of the night. The rooms are one of the largest I've had in the city (comparable to the Doubletree in Times Square) . I think the studio would be just fine if I returned again. The fridge and sink were a great plus to keep my baby's bottles clean and stored and to keep snacks in, but I can see it being too much for a lot of guests. There's a huge Duane Reade across the street for any late night drugstore/ snack/ baby needs. The only negative (other than having to wait until 4:30 to check in) I have to mention is that we paid $50 more for a two bedroom suite which was just a studio and a queen suite combined. Next time I'll save money and ask for the two room adjacent to each other and just opened the door between them. Overall I loved this hotel. I hope to go back to experience the spa.  
<Date>Jul 31, 2005

<Author>Tachesderousseur
<Content>Very displeased I decided to stay in this hotel based on the superb reviews it received on Tripadvisor.com, my favourite travel website. This is one of the few times I can say that Tripadvisor steered me wrong. Very wrong.It's almost as though all the reviewers who have written glowing reports were staying at a different hotel than I. The problems were non-stop from my arrival 'til my departure. Just one example... my room was very warm even when I put the air conditioning to its coolest setting. Called downstairs to see if this could be remedied. Waited close to an hour in the room for a gentleman to come upstairs and try to fix it (and yes, I had plenty of other things I'd have preferred to do on a Manhattan afternoon). The maintenance person arrived, glanced at the air conditioning unit, then Opened the Windows! That was his solution. I was on the 5th floor. The sound of traffic was loud even with the windows shut! Of course it was too noisy to sleep with the window open, so I had to close it and sweltered through the night.Overall, this hotel gave me the amenities, service and quality I would have expected from a $130/night in total. Instead, I paid well more than double and feel really ripped off. I will never, ever stay here again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Excellent!! People who do not like the Dumont must have had a singularly bad experience. I was booked to stay 3 nights following July 4th. As many have said, the room size was larger than most other hotels I've stayed inthrought the country. The location was convenient to many subway stations, and Times Square was easily walkable. The staff were all super nice and helpful (I was given very specific subway direction more than once). To top it all off, I cut my stay short by one night (due to heavy rain moving in), and after letting the front desk know at 9:00 am the day I was checking out, they not only didn't charge me for the extra night, I also checked out at 1:30 with no problems. The staff never gave me an ounce of grief or ran me an attitude. Even though I'm sure there are many other nice hotels in NYC, I'll be staying at the Dumont in the future.

<Author>captmorgnsgrl
<Content>Great Hotel! On our return from Aruba, we decided to stop off and visit my sister in law who lives in Manhatten. She is around the corner from this hotel and reccomended it highly. We got a great internet rate and were only there for two nights. Upon our arrival we were greeted very proffesionally by the desk staff. The lobby if very small but comfortable. Our room was more than we had anticipated, the bed was very comfortable. There was an Ironing board, hair dryer, a full kitchen. There was fruit waiting for us and it was a treat. The view was spetacular and we really relaxed here. The doormen and porters were very helpful. I would like to add that these folks went above and beyond anything I could have asked for. On our last night, we needed a 3:45 am wake up call. I called down to the front desk and asked for a wake up call. Just to make sure the desk person called me back immediatly to make sure it was for 3:45 AM not PM. I really appreciated this person's attention. As we were sitting in JFK getting ready to depart, I realized I had left my camera charger pluged into the wall at the hotel. I called the hotel and the person at the desk stated that Chris the porter that had helped us with our bags would be getting it for us. He verified my mailing address and told me not to worry it would be mailed out to me. That put my mind to rest! I will be going back in October and will be staying here again!

<Author>Bunker_Dude
<Content>Efficient and Unpretentious Booked this expressly due to the reviews on this site. Managed to get a deal on a double queen room and wasn't disappointed. Asked for a high room and was given 31st floor with a great view south.Room size good - Kitchen OK, and came in useful as the 24 hour grocery store is only across the road. so no overpriced mini bar goodies.Not special but clean, efficient, and with that insincere friendliness that you get in such establishments. (But hey, it's better than rudeness).Check out Mr. Cool (Jessie) in the bar, has some great music reccomendations, trip reccomendations, and was everything that I imagined a proper New York bartender to be. Don't lose him Mgt. he's a gem!I wouldn't hesitate in staying again.

<Author>OregonMarkM
<Content>Large room, mediocre staff I would agree that this is a great value hotel in a good location. Seeing so many positive reviews I expected better service from the staff.A friend and I spent a week at a Priceline hotel in a very small room. I booked one night at the Dumont after we had to extend our trip by a day and couldn't get a room at the Priceline hotel (Morgans). Walking into the room at the Dumont was like being in heaven compared to the small room we had been in for a week. We were in a corner room on the top floor with a beautiful view of Manhattan. It was nice to have a kitchen. There was plenty of ice in the freezer. Our stove had one burner that wouldn't light. When turning on the others you kept hearing a clicking sound as it tried to turn on the one bad burner (?). I couldn't stand the noise so I ended up using the microwave to heat one serving of water instead of trying to use the stove to heat up more.The bathroom was alright. It was nice to have a place to soak my feet after walking in Manhattan for a week. I got a surprise when I sat on the toilet seat and it bent underneath me while soaking my feet in the tub. I'm only 185 pounds. The only place to sit in the bathroom while doing your nails or grooming would be on that toilet seat, so they really should have harder toilet seats that can support the weight of an average person without surprising them.I did not find the staff to be particularly helpful. They were average, some staff members were good, some were mediocre. There was no consistency to the service. I found one staff member very helpful, but some others made me wait to get change for a $20 even when no other guests were standing at the front desk. I looked at my $20 bill sitting on their side of the counter while they ran back and forth doing something. It took about 5 minutes just to get change. I'm patient but I thought it odd they would make a guest wait like that for something relatively simple. They seemed disorganized most of the time I interacted with them.I tried ordering some pillows from their pillow menu. It seemed like a nice idea, but even after calling twice over about 3 hours, we never received any pillows. We came back late that night and didn't bother calling a third time. When I mentioned it at checkout the next day, I thought they might offer a small discount on the room. All they said was that I'd be receiving a feedback form by email and that I could fill that out. The hotel is very close to a Starbucks, many restaurants and small groceries. A subway station is a few blocks away. Don't let them send you to Da Ciro, the Italian restaurant around the corner. The food and drinks are over priced, and service is not good. Instead go to Pasticcio on Third Avenue. I would definitely stay here next time because of the size of the rooms. It's a good value if you pay a discounted rate. I wouldn't expect good service from the staff though.  
<Date>Jul 1, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Relaxed We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights starting June 9th. Reception were very friendly and helpful and continued together with the doormen throughout the visit. This hotel is very relaxing and has non of that pompous air which you get in many places which really turns us off. The location is great with easy access to the subway at 33rd street and is busy without being frantic. Room sizes are excellent and give great value if you prefer space to stretch out rather than super luxury. Having a kitchen gave us a great choice between bringing food in (the farmers market at Union Square is superb) or eating out as there are some very good restaurants nearby (Da Ciro and Villa Berulia were particularly good). We would happily stay there again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very friendly, great location, highly recommended Stayed here for a four night holiday. Excellent location, very handy for shopping and the subway, but incredibly quiet - our room looked over 33rd St and while we didn't have the greatest view it was so quiet - quietest hotel I've found in NYC. All the hotel staff v friendly, room clean  well furnished with a handy kitchenette  fridge. The only minor complaint would be that the decor of our room was rather brown and gloomy. But otherwise a real find and would recommend it to any traveller.

<Author>mwillia
<Content>Great View Stayed at the Affinia Dumont for nine nights in May. 1st room had a view that was less than great, spoke with desk personnel and moved to a room on the 25th floor, great view of the city. The next day our new neighbor wanted our room so he would have two adjoining rooms. He traded us a corner suite on the 19th floor which was even nicer than the second room. After all the moving around was completed we enjoyed the stay very much. The hotel was clean, well kept, and the staff was quite helpful. The rooms are not as nice as rooms in 4star hotels in the south but I guess in New York they were excellent. Would gladly recommend this hotel to any travelers. One of the great things about the hotel is that it is not in the middle of an area that is too crowded, noise level was lower than in most parts of the city. This has nothing to do with the hotel but my wife and I were disappointed in the food in New York, as we tried expensive, midrange, and cheap, but were never quite satisfied. I guess being from South Louisiana it is hard to eat any where else and be happy.

<Author>SantaFean-7
<Content>Excellent value I stayed at the Affinia Dumont on my third business trip to New York, and this is the best hotel value for the money in NYC or anywhere else. It's perfect for those wanting to mix business and pleasure thanks to an enormous desk and Aeron chair as well as a lovely looking spa (I just used the yoga room one morning). Also a well-equiped fitness room, which I didn't need because I walked 6 to 10 miles a day! The elements that made this a standout for me were the excellent lighting (including some energy-efficient fixtures)--especially the reading lights over the bed, over the desk, and by the reading chair--and the great mirrors everywhere you could possibly want them. Overall, including its fully equipped galley kitchen, it's larger than some NYC studio apartments!

<Author>Nadel_08
<Content>Excellent hotel, will stay here again I picked this hotel for our first visit to NYC based on the reviews on this site, and it was pretty much on point with what everyone else mentioned. Lobby is small but comfortable. Front desk was helpful and very efficient. Ballet parking was $34 for 24 hrs but I guess thats the normal price for overnight.The room itself was excellent. I booked a studio suite and it was larger then some of the jr. suites I've stayed at in Vegas, SF, and Hawaii. The King size bed was very comfortable and the pillow menu added to the great sleep we had. Along with everyone else, I do recommend a higher floor (we stayed at the 27th facing the Crysler Building and the street noise was no problem) Furniture had a very modern feel and made the room feel it should have been more then the price we paid for the stay. the aveda products were great and when i called hotel services for (1) extra bottle of shampoo and conditioner, they gave us a whole bag full of everything else too! Location is great in Murry Hill. Within walking distance of most sites. Took a cab the first night we were there because of the weather but the next day, walked from hotel to central park with no problems. Next visit to NY, I would defin. stay at the hotel again. Each floor only has 6-8 rooms so it is very quite and intimate. kitchen a plus to store and reheat food. Bathroom could have been a little bigger but big enough to have a soothing bubble bath for 2 in. all in all, i highly recommend.  
<Date>Jun 6, 2005

<Author>BrentLoch
<Content>take along written confirmation! Just got back from three nights at the Affinia Dumont. Booked the roomearly January, requested a room with two beds and a sleeper sofa as therewere three women traveling together. I emailed the hotel before I booked the room to verify that we could reserve this particular bed arrangement. I made the final booking thru Small and Elegant Hotels and had them note that we were guarenteed two beds. Called to confirm everything a week before we arrived.At check in the receptionist tells me that they have only rooms available with one king bed but they could bring us a roll away bed. I kept telling her that it was not acceptable. I said that my friend and I did were not going to sleep in the same bed. She kept repeating that there was nothing she could do. She reviewed my written confirmation (so glad I took it!) but kept insisting that she could not accomadate us, did we want to go elsewhere?I called Small and Elegant Hotels and told them what was happening.The manager there called someone at the hotel. They finally solved the problem by giving us two adjoining rooms which had enough beds for all even though they were not suites as I had booked it all worked out.The receptionist tried to blame the reservation center but I emphasized that I spoke with numerous personnel at the hotel to confirm my request.So, in spite of my confirmation and booking six months in advance the hoteldid not have a room available that met our needs.Other than this very annoying problem the rest of the stay was uneventful.Would I stay there again? No.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great Hotel~Great Location This was my first trip to New York so I did a great deal of research. We chosethe Affinia due to the many positive reviews from this website. We were NOTdisappointed. We booked a jr. suite - which I recommend. The kitchen is tiny,but it is nice to have a fridge to put your leftovers in or store fruit, water,etc. It also had a stove and oven, which we used to heat up our leftovers fromCarmines Italian restaurant in the Theater District - excellent food. Thecheck-in was A service and the room does look like a hip apartment. Theyhave a pillow menu, which for me was a life- saver. I use a buckwheat pillow,which I forgot, but they had it. The bed was very large for a King and was verycomfortable. The bathroom was sufficient, clean, and cute. They use Avedaproducts. The jr. suite has a nice sitting area, which we used. The cost forthe internet service is very high, but I guess that is NY. The sitting area inthe hotel lobby is small but very nice. We did ask for room on a high floor anda view of the Chrysler Bldg. I would also ask for a high floor so you do nothave to hear the traffic/street noise. The hotel location is great. We walkedto 3rd Ave for several restaurant choices. Also, it is a short walk to thesubway or cab ride to anywhere you want to go. I like the neighborhood feel ofMurray Hill. We could go to Time Sq, 5th Ave shopping or SOHO but could returnto a quaint neighborhood. The staff were friendly and the front desk staff(they are also the concierge) gave a few good tips. We would recommend thePongol's for veg Indian food - very good on Lexington and East 27th Street. Wedidn't go to the spa, but I did go to the gym. It was very nice, but I felt I was ignored by some of the staff. I did report this to hotel mgmt. Wedidn't use room service nor eat at the Barking Dog. I would not want to go to ahotel rest. with all the choices in NY. I had a great trip and was extremelysatisfied with Affinia Dumont for my first trip to NY.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Large rooms, nice staff, good location I've stayed at the Affinia Dumont numerous times over the past two years. I keep coming back because of some basic things: nice room decor, warm staff, great prices, and good location. I usually stay in a one-bedroom suite and love the fact that there is a large living room with a comfortable desk to work at and a kitchen (fridge and microwave) to heat up leftovers. The bedroom is decorated in warm colors with great closet space (two separate closets!) and an incredibly comfortable bed. Dimmer switches for the lights and huge televisions - one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Now, I do love a nice bathroom but that's the one thing missing at the Affinia. This is your basic bath with ok water pressure - but they do offer nice bath toiletries. Need a room with a view - tell them upfront when making the reservation and they'll do their absolute best in trying to get you one. In fact, it's the warmth of the staff and their can do attitude that assures my return visits. NYC can be rather tough on the senses, it's nice to return to a place where the staff cares about you and does everything to make your stay pleasant.If you want one of the largest hotel rooms available at a great price, an attractive and comfortable room decor, warm and welcoming staff, and a good location on the East side (walk to Grand Central, UN, subway) then there is NO BETTER hotel than the Affinia Dumont.

<Author>Thewoodwards
<Content>We will come again This was our first time in New York - all our previous city breaks have been to historical European cities - and whilst we were excited at the prospect there was some nervousness too. Would we enjoy such a densley packed modern city? The omens weren't great when our Taxi from the airport was pulled over by the police for jumping a red light just after we arrived on Manhattan Island.It was a real relief therefore to arrive in the lobby of the Affinia Dumont to be greeted by friendly and helpful staff who immediately put us at ease. We've got a great room for you they told us - and we agree. we were in an L-shaped 21st floor junior studio, with great views of the Chrysler Building and across the East river. The room was spacious, with a decent bathroom and a small kitchen (with a huge fridge). Although by no means the fanciest or newest hotel room we've ever stayed in, the room was very comfortable and we couldn't fault the cleanliness of the room or hotel generally. I'd have to say that the room was great value.The location is great; we walked almost everywhere but it's no problem to catch the subway or get a cab. Although there's no Hotel restaurant, the Barking Dog on the ground floor of the building offered good quality, reasonably priced food and friendly service echoing that in the hotel itself. Having a gym and spa helped us to relax after each hectic day's sightseeing, and our time in New York flew by. Too quickly, in fact - We'll just have to visit again and when we do we'll stay at the Affinia Dumont.  
<Date>May 25, 2005

<Author>Go_Irish1
<Content>Magic Location I have to say that I was more than impressed with this hotel. Myself and girlfriend spent a week here at Easter time. The location is fantastic, in walking distance to Time Square and just down the other way is 3rd Avenue where there are plenty of nice bars for late drinks and food.Room was very big and was spotless and had a nice comfortable bed, needed after a tiring day pounding the streets and drinking up all the beers!! Also a great feature was having a little kitchen area with a a microwave for reheating cold pizza and a fridge to keep your gatorade cold for those hangovers the morning after!Seriously though, I would definately recommend this place, okay it doesn't have the big reception area like many of the more well known New York Hotels but what it does have is intimacy and privacy matched with great service and a friendly smile.
