<Author>mhheit01
<Content>Great Location, Average Stay at Best! The Good - I am originally from New York City, so I am well versed in the offerings downtown. The location of this hotel is outstanding being on the corner of Third Avenue, and 34th street. Away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square but close enough for a healthy walk if you plan on going to the Theatre District. If you are interested in the allure of downtown, including Union Square, Washington Square (NYU), SOHO, Tribeca, and the West Village, also a healthy but doable walk. As part of this downtown trek you will learn to love the offerings of the area between the Murray Hill District and downtown. Restaurants and shopping galore.The price is also right for this hotel having secured a 26th floor room (view not good from our vantage point, but not there for the view) for $215.00 a night. This is the place to stay if you are interested in what NYC has to offer, yet you dont want to pay truly high prices for a room.The Bad - When we stay in NY, the last thing we want to feel like is that we have rented a converted studio apartment and this is clearly what this hotel has to offer. Studio apartment rooms full with outdated equipment in the miniscule kitchen. I also found the bell staff to be somewhat persistent and annoying during our coming and going, and always felt I needed to tip them.The Ugly - For once I would like to arrive at a hotel and be offered a room with a view without having to ask given the fact that the rooms did not appear to be priced based on location or view. On our arrival, once again the staff offered us the typical 5th floor location, necessitating another inquiry into the availability of a room higher up. Initially she said that none were available, but having persisted she checked in the back with a manager and poof one came available on the 26th floor. Believe me, I know how the game is played being a seasoned traveler, but I will celebrate the day that I am offered a room on an upper floor with a view without asking or bargaining for one. This is a hotel not a new car showroomTough to understand how it got a # 3 popularity rating unless popularity is based on it being wonderfully located and reasonably priced

<Author>PDXDon
<Content>Great Hotel and an Amazing Value First off, let me qualify my review by saying that this is not a five star hotel, nor does it try to be. In terms of service and overall experience, I would give the Affinia Dumont a solid 3.75 stars. That being said, because it is such an amazing value and my experience was so positive, I rate my experience as Excellent without reservation.We stayed for four nights in a junior suite in the NE corner of the 28th floor. Views were terrific and traffic noise was a non-issue. The room was absolutely huge. Nice, comfortable couch and chairs. Excellent desk with an Aeron chair. Bed was among the most comfortable I've enjoyed -- very difficult to get up in the morning. Bathroom was spacious, and the shower pressure was excellent. The kitchen was really nice -- much more than we needed, but great to have a full sized fridge. I don't know who would be cooking in their hotel room in NYC, but there was a microwave and four burner stove, too.Everything was kept perfectly clean throughout our stay and the maid never bothered us. Doormen and front desk staff were helpful and friendly, but we really didn't need their help. We didn't get a chance to checkout the spa or gym.Hardly any negatives to report. The room was just strating to get to the point where it might need a minor renovation. Just a tiny bit worn down. The lobby is pretty small and unimpressive, but it gets the job done. Like I said, we didn't need much help, but the hotel might be a touch understaffed if things were really busy. Got room service from the restraunt only once for breakfast -- food was decent, cheap and delivered on time, but was packed in styrofoam, which is unfortunate. Again, this is not a five star hotel.The location is ideal -- lots of good bars and restaurants nearby. 24 hour drug store accross the street. Only a few avenue blocks from Penn Station. We walked almost everywhere, and it was really easy to get a cab when we needed to. Murray Hill is much more quiet than most mid-town locales, which is a big plus.Overall, the Affinia Dumont is a fantastic hotel. You really can't do any better for the price, especially if you like having a room that is bigger than a closet. I will definitely go back.  
<Date>May 20, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Unique Athletic Minded Hotel for Business Travelers! The hotel bills itself as an executive fitness suite hotel, and in NYC, having good workout options is my priority. I also like the convenience of a kitchen when I'm in town for longer stays.The rooms are nice, contemporary and get the job done. And I always need the desk and work space on business trips. I also like that there is a moderately priced restauarant connected. Another convenience.Midtown has lots of health clubs nearby but many don't allow visitors or charge a huge premium, so the small onsite fitness center here is a great deal. I knew before arriving what the club stocked in terms of equipment (my travel guide, The Athletic-Minded Traveler gives details). It's really full service with around 8 cardio machines, dumbbells and stack stations. Again, when in Midtown for business, hard to beat this place.

<Author>pb_67
<Content>I definitely recommend A Ritz Carlton it ain't. But for travelers who do not care much for gyms or bars in the lobby, etc. this is a pretty good place. I came to NY on a last minute trip and was stunned to find that hotel rooms were difficult to come by. I should have checked: it is graduation season in addition to the flux of tourists. I was quoted upwards of $500 per night for tiny rooms at a number of places and settled for this $239 studio suite at a hotel I had never stayed in before. I was quite apprehensive about the accommodations but they are well above average for NY in this price range:+ decent size bed - my suite had two queen size beds+ decent size room+ high-speed Internet access+ lots of closet space+ no rats or roaches, paint peeling off, A/C units that don't work :-)The bathroom in my unit was quite adequate. Room service is certainly a notch below what you get in other places in terms of form. It is more like your neighborhood restaurant delivery (food in plastic bag and styrofoam containers) than a regular hotel room service But guess what? It is fast, and the fare from the Barking Dog, the restaurant next door which is affiliated to the hotel, is quite tasty. Also, who really wants to eat room service in New York with so many restaurants around?The front Desk staff was extremely polite and helpful as were the doormen. I will have to come back to this property to verify the consistency of the service, but as of now, I highly recommend this place if you are not picky about some of the issues I mentioned above. It is probably more appropriate for tourists who have already been to NY and spend most of their time out, those on a budget looking for quality accommodations, and families looking for space rather than name properties.  
<Date>May 13, 2005

<Author>brycem
<Content>Agree that Reality Check needed My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 27 - 30 April 2005. I have to say that the previous review sums the place up particularly well. It is an average 3 star hotel for which you have to pay steep prices. The room was clean and spacious but we never used the desk or lounge area. The TV does actually swivel so you can watch it in bed! The bathroom is small and quite dated - no wow factor! The kitchen area likewise - we only used the fridge. The gym was a bonus but was once again average.The reception staff were pleasant and efficient.My major gripe was the over attentive door staff who epitomised the tips culture! By the end of our stay we were sick of being told to be well! The lack of sincerity from these tip hungry vultures was apparent for all to see. When leaving our bags on check out for collection later we were told I won't be here later by the swarthy suited doorman. His palm was greased. I have a suggestion for the US government and that is to put in place legislation which ensures that those in the service industry are paid an amount on which they can live and that would go some way to ensuring that tips are provided only where merited - i.e. for genuinenly good service and not as a matter of course where weary service industry workers half heartedly put on the insincere smarm! What in effect the US has is a tourist stealth tax.To finish on a positive note I would state that the location of the hotel is superb and the local amanities in third avenue excellent. The neighbourhood does not have a toristy feel which was great and there were some good bars and restaurants.

<Author>modoz
<Content>Hard to fault It the risk of sounding like a broken record.... I must agree with so many other reviewers in declaring the Affinia Dumont a great hotel. We chose it after reading all the glowing reports on tripadvisor am very pleased to say that the Affinia did not disappoint. Like others we had requested a high floor for the much talked about views but the hotel was very busy and we ended up on a low floor. But the room was huge - plenty of space for my husband and I - and very quiet. We weren't disturbed at all by noise from other guests or traffic outside. The location is superb. Walking distance to everything midtown and the subway is really close by. We used it the whole time. During our three night stay we only had one minor problem with the bathroom sink not draining. One call to front desk and it was fixed within minutes. The staff were very polite and eager to help. The doormen were perhaps a little too eager... all those 'have a nice days' seemed a bit over the top, but I'm just not used to it! Would definitely recommend the Affinia and will be going back!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Reality check I just thought I'd write a review to try and balance some of the rave reviews this hotel has received. I stayed here and agree on many of the good points mentioned on this website. We requested a room with a view as the last time I was in New York was when I was a child and I love to feel part of the city I am staying in. Affinia came up with the goods and gave us a corner room with a view of the river and the Chrysler building which is spectacular.As mentioned before the rooms are very big and although I haven't stayed in any other NY hotels the general feeling I got when shopping around for a hotel was that rooms are tiny and really expensive. We had a kitchen and a sofa and a huge bed in case we were super-sized by our stay in the Big Apple. The truth is though that although the rooms are pretty impressive, the bathroom was abit tired and needed updating and so did the little kitchen that we had. The kitchen sounds handy in theory but in reality we never used it and I don't see why you would unless you were in NY for a long stay and wanted to cut down on costs. The desk unit would be good for business travel but is no use for tourists unless your planning a marathon postcard writing session, it also looks abit dated. The TV was stuck squarely on the plinth it rested on so that it pointed out into the middle of the room meaning you could neither watch it comfortably on the bed or the sofa and had to lie on the floor to watch it head on. The corridors outside the rooms are abit pokey and tired as well and there is no bar or restaurant inside the hotel although the restaurant attached is good. The staff were very friendly and helpful and said be well everytime you walked in or out of the front door which sounds like something from Star Trek.This is a good solid top end three star hotel in a City that I thought had hugely over-priced accommodation; this place is so good because everything else looks just so pricey. If you've got any doubts about booking this hotel and your on a budget of some kind I'd book it up because I thought it offered the best value for money. However don't expect luxury for what is still pretty pricey. The rooms are large I agree but the bathroom/kitchen are functional at best and the gym is pretty average.I think it's hard to beat this place for value and the location is fine. We walked for hours on end using this place as a central hub. Walking is by far the best way to see this fascinating city that is a caricature of itself. I couldn't live in the place but then New Yorkers seem to pride themselves on managing to survive where no-one else could. It's a great place to visit.By the way on the taxi front I thought prices were fixed to the airport so you don't need to worry about getting stuck in traffic? I could be wrong though.  
<Date>May 11, 2005

<Author>DilbertAndFriends
<Content>Best Kept Secret in New York This hotel has to be one of the best hotels in New York. The hotel is located in the Murray Hill area of New York and although not central it is just a short walk to the subway (2 blocks) and buses stop outside the hotel.The room was enormous and had a separate kitchen area, sofa, computer desk and king sized bed. The view from the room was fantastic as I had a view of both the East River and the Chrysler building.The hotel can arrange for a car to take you back to the airport at a reasonable price. I would recommend this option especially if you are leaving mid afternoon for the airport as the traffic can get very busy and a taxi will charge you even when you are waiting in traffic!A couple of points for those visiting New York1. If you want to visit the Empire State building (which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel) then visit between 6 pm and 7 pm as the queues are at the shortest then.2. Go on the Circle Line 3 hour cruise as you get to see many places you would not see on other tours.  
<Date>May 9, 2005

<Author>UK-Stu
<Content>Beyond expectations This was our first visit to NYC and we chose our hotels purely on the recommendations and views expressed on this website.When we checked in, Iris (the duty manager) advised that our reservation (booked on Travelocity) was for four days from 1 May rather than four days checking out 1 May. {On returning home, we noted it was Travelocity's error and not ours!}. Iris read our note on the reservation which indicated this was our first visit to NYC and a request made for a room on a high floor. She found us a room on 34 (of 36) which faced the Chrysler building. The room was larger than we aniticipated with a moderate bathroom and convenient kitchen.We went to visit Grand Central Station and the United Nations building, both within a short walk of the hotel. On our return, we found a note from Iris attached to a bottle of white wine welcoming us to NYC!! Other hotels please note - small touches like this make a huge impact on guests.On our second night, we returned to the room and were greeted by the nauseating smell of cigarette smoke. Our new neighbours had taken no notice of the fact that 34 was a no smoking floor and decided to smoke. We immediately called reception who despatched security. The guests were moved the next day. Smokers please note - my non-smoking does not affect you, so why indulge in your disgusting habit which affects us? When a room and floor are marked as non-smoking, there is a clue. The dish in the bathroom with a bar of soap on is called a soapdish not ashtray. If you want to smoke, ask for a smoking room.The staff on reception are immensely helpful as too are the doormen. Like most hotels in NYC, there are limos available outside the hotel which obviously pay bonuses to the staff. When we checked out we stated that we were off to JFK. The doorman stated that he could arrange the limo but suggested we take a cab as the cost would be considerably cheaper. Now, how many other hotels would have been that honest?We would certainly consider staying at this hotel again on our next trip to NYC.  
<Date>May 8, 2005

<Content>We will never stay anywhere else in New York... I hope to see Affinia Dumont reach #1. Best kept New York secret! My partner and I spent one night at Dumont for her birthday. We arrived for an early check-in to friendly, accommodating, and professional personnel at the front deak--after I mentioned my partner's birthday the woman who checked us in sent a complimentary bottle of wine to our room. When does THAT ever happen?Our room was spacious and clean -- the views were spectacular. I read another posting from someone in a room on the 36th floor who recommended requesting a room higher up. Thanks for the tip -- we ended up on the 36th floor as well in a corner room -- incredible skyline!We loved the fitness center, Aveda products in the rooms, and the healthy feel of the place. We'll stay no where else in the future.

<Author>lunabelle
<Content>What a delight! We chose the Affinia Dumont because it came so highly recommended on tripadvisor. Well, that reputation is well deserved. The room was large, everything was great. We had a kitchenette, a big bathtub with enough hot water to fill it, a pillow menu and Aveda toiletries. The staff was kind and friendly, they had elixers at the front desk, and a lovely spa. It even smelled good! They offer a fitness kit so you can work out in your room, free of charge! The in-room beverages were really expensive ($2.50 for 1/2 a can of coke!) but everyone knows to expect that. The location was gr8... easy access to everything. The restaraunt is not attached and there is no breakfast buffet. We had a quick check in and check out and no problems with unwarranted charges. A+!

<Author>newfoundlander
<Content>Fantastic Just got back from a 2 night trip, first time in NYC. Me and my girlfriend stayed at the Dumont and were both really impressed. Here's a quick breakdown on what to expect:Super friendly service - staff were very helpful and friendly. They'd help make reservations, hail cabs, suggest things to do, places to eat, etc... Super clean, spacious rooms - staff keeps the room really clean. Lots of room and great views (at least from the 35th floor where we stayed). Very comfortable bed!!Wonderful Lemonade - They serve lemonade in the front lobby. It's free, I think my girlfriend drank about 20 glasses.The hotel is very very welcoming. If you're snooty and want to be treated that way, don't bother... if you're a down to earth, friendly person who wants to enjoy the best of NYC - try the Dumont.

<Author>BugPowderDust
<Content>Good location, great hotel Very pleased with the hotel for our long weekend in NY.Upon arrival, they told us they had to give us a slightly smaller room (which was still massive as it turned out) but would knock off $40 a night and gave us breakfast and drinks coupon for the bar/ cafe next door.The hotel was very nicely decorated, and the room was lovely. I would expect to pay 150- 200 for a similar room in the UK. Great view, nice minibar, comfy bed, great service from lobby staff.The location of the hotel is pretty good as well. 5 blocks from the Empire State Bldg, and one block from the nearest Metro stop (on the 6 line). All in all, I was so impressed, I'll be recommending this to anyone I know who is going to NY.

<Author>Weekend_getaways
<Content>Great but not wow ! Have just come back from 5 nights at the Affinia Dumont.My first impression was that it was not as upmarket as I had hoped, and I too was a little disappointed, but they had our reservation and had met our request for a quiet room.We had a one bedroom suite - and it was large - by any standard, and we paid $258 per night ( booked via the Affinia Website in January ).However over the five nights I got to like it more and more. I was staying with my husband and two boys, who fought on the first night about sharing the double sofa bed in the sitting room. I mentioned it to reception, and they arranged for an extra rollaway bed to be brought to the room for the following four nights ( and didnt charge for this!! ). We requested extra pillows - and they were there within 15 minutes ( and a call half an hour later to see if we had them and if we needed anything else ).The room was very quiet, and I like the fact that there were only 6 rooms on a floor - so you dont get a lot of noise of people in the hallways. There was lots of hot water and the showers were good and everything was very clean.The weather was awful when we were there, and they provide umbrellas, and go and stand in the rain to get you a taxi, whilst you wait in the warmth of the lobby. The Barking Dog next door did good breakfast and evening meals when the weather was so foul that we couldnt venture further.It was clean, well located, quiet, comfortable, in a 'safe' neighbourhood and a good price. I would definately stay there again, and would recommend it to others.  
<Date>Apr 5, 2005

<Author>fielding
<Content>Just about right We booked into the Affinia Dumont last week based largely on the positive reviews on tripadvisor -- and we were not disappointed. No, this is not a luxury hotel and for those who might be expecting a more elegant or fussier place, then there's plenty of those in New York. But the Dumont is an excellent value, with spacious rooms and extremely pleasant service. To be sure, there's some evidence of whatever prior incarnation the building had -- some threadbare carpeting and so on. The lobby is small and simply functional. This was all easily overlooked since we had no expectation that we had booked a luxury hotel. We had a corner room on an upper floor with good views of the East River and the Chrysler Building. Let me tell you -- you can pay twice as much in New York for half the space and none of the view. The room itself had a king bed and a queen pullout sofa. There was a kitchenette and a sizeable work area. The furnishings and appointments were contemporary, and the room was spotless. The bathroom was small but perfectly acceptable for a place like this, with hair dryer, phone and Aveda products. We booked directly with the hotel and paid $249 -- probably right on the nose in terms of a good midrange price for New York, and we got good comfort for it. The hotel has attempted to pitch itself as an executive fitness hotel and there is a spa (which we did not use) and the rooms come with his and hers health magazines and a health products basket. But do not be misled -- the room we had would be a great room for a family visit as well as business. In fact, I would recommend the Dumont's suites for a family because of the kitchenette. Although the 34th Street Murray Hill location may not be ideal for some visitors, it is just around the corner from the Empire State building and within walking distance of both Penn and Grand Central Stations. The local east side subway line stops a block away and will get you within walking distance of the major museums uptown or the sights in lower Manhattan, and cabs were plentiful on either 34th or Lexington. The neighborhood has any number of moderately priced restaurants, coffee shops and bars. The restaurant/bar next to the hotel (the Barking Dog) provides room service and casual dining. We had a perfectly good quick meal there once. But for us, the Dumont's chief selling point was comfort and value, at least with the room we had. Plus good service. We would have no hesitation in returning.  
<Date>Apr 5, 2005

<Author>DDWelsh
<Content>Disappointed Did not think the hotel lived up to the reviews.Slightly shabby entrance and not very welcoming on arrival.The suite while large was dark and the large desk area, while no doubt useful to business travellers, made the sitting area feel like a corporate area and was not inviting.Having paid about $380 dollars per night via expedia, it seemed very expensive for what it was.There had obviously been some effort to smarten the place up but the bathroom needed attention with flaking paint at the foot of the door.Attempts to book restaurants through reception were probably the worst feature. Restaurants being full is fine but twice returning to find no information about bookings was poor. On the first occasion reception did not even call back when advice was sought as to the status of the booking.An extra remote found under the bed made me question the thoroughness of the cleaning regime but the bedroom was clean and by far the best feature.On the final day the sight of someone eating fast food from polystyrene containers in an otherwise pleasant seating area just about summed up the experience. Acceptable if overpriced and would not rush back.

<Author>SeattleSojourner
<Content>Great staff, nice hotel A 2 night stay in mid-March, all requests were met (2 queen beds, above 15th floor, late check out). Had gotten a rate of $180/night through Orbitz when several of the other sites, including the hotels OWN site indicated no rooms available. The staff was outstanding. Christopher (bellman) was a delight, full of information and very cheery. The front desk staff was very polite and capable, and quickly responded to one small problem we had. Would definitely stay there again.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Very Disappointing We have just come back from a week at the Affinia Dumont. Prior to going I had trawled the internet etc to choose the best hotel for our stay. I was impressed by all the reviews here and thought I had chosen well. What a disappointment. On arrival the lobby is really small and dark. Our room was a studio suite which was also quite small. I asked for a view of the East River if possible and got a view of the rooftop car park!. On our first evening there someone came banging into the room and only I had the latch on it would have simply burst into the room. The bathroom was small and the handle on the toilet was broken. The TV remote broke the first day. The walls looked like they were in need of a coat of paint. There was a huge bubble in the carpet as though someone had wet the floor and thus stretched the carpet. On our last morning they sent us up our bill, as well as the bill for a suite several doors down. There is no bar in the hotel so if you want a drink you have to go elsewhere. I know they are pretty small things but overall we were very disappointed. The location is good however for the money I think you can do so much better.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>A delightful experience We recently stayed at the Affinity for a one nights' stay and had the most delightful experience. Upon entering the lobby we were greeted with an entusiastic staff whose main concern seemed to be sure we were satisfied customers - all of my special requsts were not only considered but we were actually upgraded to a beautiful one bedroom suite. We were given a tour of the spa and would have loved to use the services but we had a full schedule of events to do - next time we will certainly avail ourselves to the wonders of the spa. Upon getting into the room - Christopher gave us a wonderful orientation to the services offered and other amenities - we were about to make some tea - only to find one tea bag so we called room service - in 5 minutes we were given a tray full of teas and etc. The choice of pillows for the evening was an added pleasure - the linens and bathroom toilitries were of excellent quailty - all in all I would rate this one of the most enjoyabel experiences we have had in the city and have all intentions of returning soon. I have highly recommended this to all of my friends.

<Author>foofoo28
<Content>Lovely Having trawled the internet for accomodation for a 3 night stay with 2 girlfriends, i decided to book the Affinia Dumont hotel. Out of all the reviews on trip advisor, theirs seemed the most consistent. When we arrived we were not dissapointed. The staff are really friendly and helped us out with maps and trains. Room service for extra towels was very prompt. The room was spacious and very comfortable - especially the bed which was bliss. It was important to me to have somewhere to sit other than a bed after a hard day out shopping and the Affinia fitted the bill. We were able to relax in our lounge and use the kitchenette facilities which was great. The whole place was spotless. The bathroom was everything a girl could have wanted - a tub big enough to soak in with lovely Aveda products.The area around the Affinia is great, not too hustle and bustle but relaxed with some good restaurants. We ate at the Barking Dog a couple of times and the food and the service was very good. Also try Blockheads around the corner - great fun.All in all the Affinia was excellent and we have all decided that this is the place that we will return to.

<Author>vlady
<Content>Great for dogs, but watch out for dust bunnies! My wife, baby, dog, and I spent three nights at the Affinia Dumont (March 7 to 9, 2005) and found the hotel above average and a great place for our dog. First the dog, our American Eskie was well received by the hotel's excellent doormen and front desk staff. A bit annoying was that we were among 3 guests who had to wait until 4pm for our rooms (check-in at 3pm). Our baby had just gotten sick crossing through the Lincoln Tunnel, and it was not pleasant waiting with a sick baby in the hotel's nice, but not extraordinary lobby. Nonetheless, doggie had a nice room on the 27th floor with us, overlooking the Chrysler Building; another faux pas was that the promised dog dish and maps to local doggie friendly restaurants was no where to be found--eventually the helpful staff found a dish but no maps. In short, there is a nice dog run on 26th and Madison in the park near 5th Avenue (we just asked dog owners on the street to find out dog walks). During our stay we met so many New Yorkers with dogs, and had a great time talking about dogs and the city. Kudos to Affinia Dumont, regardless of the oversights for accepting dogs in the property. The dust bunnies, if you have a kid, you know the drill of moving the hotel bed over to the wall to prevent the baby from falling out of the bed. After traveling in Africa, Europe and the US with our baby (toddler), we are always surprised to find what treasures are under hotel beds. Well at the Affinia Dumont, we found a dollar coin, many dust bunnies and tissues of unknown origin. Some other complaints were that the dishwasher was not working well, several light fixtures were missing, and I suspect that a deep cleaning was not done on my room in weeks. But after working in Africa, most places I stayed at there, had not been cleaned in decades. So Affinia Dumont is a great choice for doggie, with a great staff, fastest elevators at any NYC hotel I ever stayed at. The location is great, restaurants everywhere, subway 2 blocks away, the 34 bus within steps, supermarket two blocks down; all in all, you cannot go wrong. My dog thanks you Affinia. But Affinia management, just pay attention to the small stuff; I hate dirty rooms and waiting in lobbies well past check-in time, and at over $200 a night, provide the stuff you promise (doggie bowl and maps) or just don't promise them, I also don't expect to be picking up dust bunnies and tissues upon arrival and looking for dog bowls and maps.  
<Date>Mar 9, 2005

<Author>scruffty
<Content>Good Hotel! Stayed here for 3 nights in January. The room was warm and the windows opened for ventilation. There was a small kitchen which was great for boiling water for tea, storing beer / things in the fridge and gas stove and oven (which was immaculate!) if you fancied to cook! The room was big and the decor was good, although it was a bit dodgy in places, not that it spoiled anything! The bathroom was nice but the water pressure from the shower was a bit toooo much! There is a mini bar, big TV, loads of amenities for business people such as CD player built into the alarm clock, fax, printer, Internet Access etc. We stayed on the 32nd floor, and we had a reasonable view - it was just faciniating watching New York go by :-) The hotel's location isn't that bad - be prepared for walking, although this didn't bother us as we think it is the best way to explore, and is healthy. The BlockHeads Mexican restaurant down the block, to the right of the hotel which is a great place for youngsters llike us to get drunk and eat nice food. I'd come here again - staff were friendly and helpful and didn't bother us at all. The Barking Dog was good for food and drinks, and if you're smokers like us, it wasn't too bad going outside for a sneaky cigarette even though the temperature was -5! All in all, it was great! 6 Stars!  
<Date>Feb 23, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Terrific My wife and 21 year old daughter just finished a three day stay at the Affinia Dumont. It was a wonderful experience. We arrived early on Sunday, checked our bags and set off to see the sights. We covered a lot of ground by foot, starting at the Empire State Building (go early and get your tickets online, it saved a lot of time). The hotel is within easy walking distance of many things and the subway connections were pretty good (once you find the entrances which are not well mark compared to Paris and London). Going uptown or downtown was easy.The suite was roomy, clean and comfortable. We had a spectacular view from the north east corner of the 35th floor (the only problem we encountered in our stay was the wait for this room to be ready- it was worth it just to see the Chrysler Building at night).There are markets and restaurant aplenty on Third Avenue just a half a block away and The Barking Dog (the restaurant attached to the hotel) offers pretty good fare too. The staff was very helpful and polite. We highly recommend it and we would definitely stay here again.  
<Date>Feb 17, 2005

<Author>Dolly1964
<Content>Fantastic, Superb, YOU MUST STAY HERE. December 27th - 3rd January 2005My partner and I were moved to this hotel as we had been double-booked by our agent in the UK 5 days before departure date! What can I say we were the lucky ones!!! Our suite was on the 35th Floor overlooking downtown Manhattan, bed was huge and so comfy, room was spotless and to have the use of a fridge to put your personal goodies in fantastic. The staff were superb so helpful and polite. Location of the hotel brilliant, Empire and Macey's on your doorstop, close to the subways. We love walking and so we did!!! Rockerfeller Centre, Central Park and all the way to China Town, Battery Park (you name it we we did it) all on foot and a what a joy. This was my partner's first trip to NY and my 5th. I fall in love with it more everytime I visit. Highlight this trip was walking across Brooklyn Bridge on a wonderful, unseasonally warm sunny day for January and just staring back at the skyline. lunch Alfresco at the Pier afterwards, who could ask for more.Local InfoIf you love a hearty breakfast in the morning try the Diner in the next street 3 min walk, Joanne the Waitress simply a delight and the food, well we didn't eat again until late afternoon. The Italian also round the corner wonderful, full of noisy Italians, made you feel like you were on the set of the Sopranos and the house red gorgeous!!! Also try the Raw Bar (Shelburne hotel) 37st  Lexington, food wonderful, staff  atmosphere wonderful (great value for money too). Try the sweet potato fries with dip, great stuff.In a nutshell, WONDERFUL.Jeanette  John Romford Essex

<Author>JayColorado
<Content>Stop researching. Book it. Spent the last 4 days of January at the Dumont with my lady. It is an outstanding well run hotel. The Affinia group runs a small group of hotels throughout the city. The rooms, as many have attested to, are of outstanding size by NYC standards. The beds  linens are of great quality. Bathrooms are spacious. Great water pressure. Oustanding views. The staff (thank you Christopher) is outstanding. Didn't use the kitchen (it's NYC!!!) but the fridge kept the beer cold. The immediate neighborhood is very safe. It has everything you need - great breakfast/coffee places, great places to get a drink, get your laundry/dry cleaning done in a couple of hours, lots  lots of cabs, all right there. My lady loved the spa. The green subway line at 34th street took us uptown to the Park and downtown to dinner off of Spring Street - don't understand those who have a problem with this line, for $2 it'll take you as far as you want to go North/South from 34th. This is the move. Book the room. Thanks Affinia, see you soon...

<Author>crzychk01
<Content>loved my stay! I highly recommend it {stayed Feb 4 - Feb 8} I decided to stay at the Affinia Dumont after reading the reviews. I had actually booked a room at another place, but after hearing the reviews for there I decided to stay somewhere else, so I chose the Affinia Dumont. I am so glad that I did! I was very pleased with my stay there. The staff was so friendly! We arrived early, at about 11:00am, and they let us check in early, as soon as we got there no problem. They were very helpful about helping us around the city, and especially hailing us cabs. We were traveling with our 4 month old son and they helped us put the stroller in the taxi and everything. The room service and room bar is a little pricey, but the room looked exactly like the picture on the internet. They kept it pretty clean during our stay, and even the maid service was friendly. The view out of our room was gorgeous! We were on the corner of the 26th floor, and looked right at the chrysler building. I am so glad we stayed there for our first time in New York. If your thinking about staying here do it! You will be happy you did!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>tourist in NYC I put lots of research in to the perfect place for my girlfriend and I to stay for our 4day stay in NY. THe reviews on the site were spot on. We had a fantastic experience. I totally recommend the hotel. The next time I go to New York, whilst its nice to 'try somewhere new' I shall be do my best to stay in the Dumont.We asked for a view of the Chrysler building, Id recommend this. What a site! The only other point Id make apart from all the other ones on the site are that the Kingsize bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Having a bad back and being 6ft 4 in height, I can be quite particular about the bed. I could have slept for years. Infact it was so comfortable that at times its hard to get up at all! Also I used the gym. Its the first Hotel Gym I have been in that actually provides enough good equipment to work out with!If youre like me and you spends ages researching a hotel online before you book it, stop researching, the reviews ring true. This is a fantastic place to stay.We stayed over the third weekend in January having travelled over from Ireland.Finally theres a great Italian restaurnat on 3rd avenue. Take a right as you go out the door and its just across the street.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great value - but wait until you get a bill We stayed at Affinia Dumont in Dec '04, and was quite happy until we checked out. The room is spacious as a New York standard, and people were very friendly. But, we were surprised to find a mini-bar charge on our bill when we were going to check out. In general, my husband and I would never touch on anything from a mini-bar because we always get drinks and snakes from outside before we head back to the hotel. And that was the case for this stay as well. We told them we did not consume anything, and they checked with housekeeping and took out the charge from our bill. Well, a months later when we got our credit card bill, we found another attempted charge!! Of course, we insisted that it has to be mistake, but the person we spoke to said that she had to get back to us, so they have not yet cleared this charge. Be sure you check your hotel bill and the credit card! I would hope that this hotel is not trying to trick their customers, but it is wired that it happened twice for our one stay. Its a nice hotel, but only pay cash so they can't sneak charges to your credit card after you've left!.

<Author>sawlman
<Content>Great stay at the Affinia Dumont: you get your money's worth I give the Affinia Dumont an excellent rating for its value though I will try not to overstate it as a luxury hotel which to some it would be categorized while others might find it a bit disappointing. Overall, it's a great value.My wife and I stayed at the Affinia Dumont Jan. 19-23 (Wed-Sun) in a Jr. Suite. (we were originally booked for a studio suite but we upgraded because of unavailability). We paid $219 per night for the Junior suite. I'd recommend to check out the (---) website to look at pictures and read about what they offer. This would be better rated a 3 - 3 1/2 star hotel if you are one accustomed to the Ritz, Hiltons and other high end hotels. Overall we were very happy with our stay though my interior design wife picked up on small things the hotel does to keep prices low (veneers on the furniture instead of solid woods, old kitchen, etc.). My wife and I would stay again though I'd recommend a higher floor than our 7th floor suite so you could have a better view and less street noise.My wife and I were impressed with:1. Closeness to the subway: 33rd and Park Ave is just a block west and south of the hotel which makes for a short 2-5 minute walk. The 6 line runs north/south out of this station and it's easy to get just about anywhere in Manhattan and the greater New York area. Penn Station is only 1 mile east of the Affinia Dumont which made it convenient for us to take the AirTrain from JFK into Manhattan (we took a cab ride from the hotel to JFK on our outbound and it only took us 30 minutes on a low traffic day).2. Pleasantness of the staff: everyone from the doorman, bellhop, front desk and maid service were kind and helpful. They tried to meet our every request and did so with a smile. We had a small problem with our heater the first night that was quickly fixed after a couple phone calls. They even gave us an extra space heater for my wife who gets really cold. 3. Quality of the rooms: We had a Jr. Suite that looked just like the pictures online. It was clean, spacious and seemed in good shape. There is a full but small kitchen that is nothing to write home about but we were able to get great use out of it by buying groceries and reheating leftovers, etc. The bathroom is nicely done with hot water and good water pressure. The soaps and lotions are from Aveda.4. Extras: hi-speed internet is offered though we did not use for $10/day. It is known as a health/fitness hotel though we didn't take advantage of that either. A nice touch was their choice of pillows: down, synthetic, buckwheat or memory foam. Nice touch. No real downsides if you are looking for a spacious midtown Manhattan hotel with good service and nice rooms for a fair price. This is not the Ritz but then again, you're not paying Ritz prices either! I would highly recommend it for a weekend getaway, corporate event or any visit where you want to be in midtown Manhattan for a reasonable price.  
<Date>Jan 24, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic Experience! The hotel experience was wonderful from start to finish. From the minute we entered the doors, we knew this visit would be special. The check-in was extremely easy, and we were struck by the friendliness and competence of the staff. As soon as we entered the room, we felt like VIP's thanks to the thoughtfulness of the manager, Joe, since he made sure to welcome us with champagne to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary. Joe does a truly wonderful job in making everyone's stay a fabulous experience. The room was beautiful and all our requests were met (corner room, DVD player). Every member of the hotel staff was cordial and knowledgeable. Customer service seemed to be a top priority, something not too common these days in many businesses. The cleanliness of the hotel was particularly striking. The location was wonderful, especially since we are familiar with the area restaurants, the Barking Dog, in particular. We had a great time.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Best Choice in NY! I just spent MLK Weekend at the Affinia Dumont in NY and was pleasantly surprised that such excellent service could exist in NY!My stay required an early check-in, a late check-out, and a third person staying in a 2-queen room, and the A.D. staff did not charge me for any of these accomodations, which most hotels would charge a fee, or give you attitude for. Our room had a kitchen with stove, refrigerator, and microwave, as well as complimentary coffee and tea. The water pressure in the shower was the best of any hotel I've ever stayed in!The location was extremely convenient to the Empire State, Macy's, Grand Central Station, and the Flat Iron building. Not as close to 5th Ave, Central Park and Times Square, but still just a $6-8 cab ride away.The spa has outstanding staff and facilities. The restaurant below the hotel has excellent breakfast, and is as charming as you can get.I can't recommend this place enough. Check out the specials on their website or try Travelocity for a good price.  
<Date>Jan 20, 2005

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>an ordinary hotel I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights based on the reviews, and I would like to say this is one of the over rated hotels out there, for my 190 bucks/night, I don't think this hotel is that great, here is why:* the location is not very convinient: the closest subway station is green line on 33rd st, which was not too far, but you will then almost always need to transfer to other routes to get to major attractions/shopping districts. As for walking, it's a bit ou of walking distance from anywhere*hotel is not as clean as it should be: I found left over peanuts(from the last guest) in my kitchen.*my kitchen creaks, this was particularly annoying at night, I guess this is due to the fact that this is an old building, and renovation was done on the old building on the plus side: the service was goodI would probably give it a 3 or 4 stars on usual bases, but just to alert some of you out there who is looking for a great hotel at reasonable price in NYC, this one may well be under your expectation, for me, if I would make the choice again, I would rather stay in a budget hotel and save the money for some other things.I hope this review(based on my experience) helps.

<Content>SHHHH...Best Kept Secret in the City!!!!! Let's Keep it that way!!!! I visited the Dumont from 12/29 - 12/31/04. I needed to get away from Hotlanta to reflect on the old and prepare myself for the new year. On previous trips to NYC, my hotel of choice was the Millineum Broadway, which is right in the heart of TS. Because of the holiday, everything in TS was already booked or the prices were outrageous. After speaking with Otto (the Affinia reservationist) and having him tell me that if I ever stayed at any of the 9 Affinia hotels, I would never want to stay anywhere else. I had my doubts, especially since the suite room was $179 per night during the holiday season. Well Otto was right, I was completely blown away by the quality of the spacious studio suite, the fully equipped gym, and the kindness of the staff. The Affinia Dumont definitely felt like a home away from home....Affinia Hotels for life.....

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>If your hubby snores.. or if you're a smoker... We travel all over the world and normally stay in 5 star hotel suites where ever we go. Because of the high occupancy rate in NYC during the Christmas holiday 2004, we made the choice to stay at the Affinia Dumont based on TripAdvisor reviews.We reserved a one-bedroom suite (smoking.. which is so rare in the city now) and were extremely pleased with our suite (2301)! HUGE! Absolutely over the top for the amount of space for the price! (A comparable room at the St. Regis would be well over $1500 a night at that time of year.) I would recommend a higher floor (38 in all) so you get some view and away from street traffic. (We had no noise in our room; very quiet!)The staff did all our grocery shopping beforehand (I faxed a list before we arrived) and made certain that everything was as ordered. So nice to fix a light breakfast in our kitchen before hitting the town for shopping. Plus, room service for late night desserts and coffee is super quick and very, very good!Christoper the doorman was a true delight to see each morning! He bent over backwards to make certain we had a taxi when needed. And he remembered us each time we saw him. Definitely a great asset to that hotel! Matter of fact, the entire staff was SO ACCOMODATING... very unpretentious! The nicest we've encountered in NYC!!!The beds devine and the staff handled turn down service as well as making up the plush pull out sofa. (My husband snores terribly so this was a great get away sleep space!) Down pillows, comforters and flowers. The gym (a REAL gym) and elegant spa services were great!Never having taken the subway in the city before, we hopped on the No. 6 train and were on the upper east side in minutes and in the midst of great shopping and then hop back on the subway back to a very quiet and very neighborhood feel. Great to be off those crowded 5th Ave. sidewalks!We will definitely make the Affinia Dumont our place to stay in the City from now on!  
<Date>Dec 6, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>The Best Stay Ever! We stayed at the Affinia Dumont for three nights and it was everything I expected  everything that was written as Excellent here on Tripadvisor.com. I really wanted to make sure I was choosing a comfortable, spacious, and not too close to the NYC noise. And that's what we got. We were walkin distance to the subway, a taxi was always easy to get from the hotel, the hotel offered many amenities, the front desk/doorman/housekeeping was superb! It made being away from the kids easy....especially being on our wedding anniversary trip the best couple's trip! :) Also, the Empire State Bldg was only a couple blocks away, along with many shopping...and the blocks around there are short. Even walking to Times Square would have been easy (20-25 min?) I just can't say enough of this place. We would definitely come back here.  
<Date>Dec 5, 2004

<Author>Sarahms
<Content>Great hotel, great staff! I picked the Dumont from the reviews on this web site and we were not disappointed.We stayed in a studio room which was huge. It had everything we needed.The kitchen had a microwave, huge fridge freezer, full size oven and hob and plenty of utensils - it was immaculately clean.The bathroom had a marble top sink, great bath and powerful shower. The toiletries were Aveda - shampoo, conditioner, mouth wash, soap, shower cap and moisturiser. Nice and plentiful towels.The room had a huge bed which was extremely comfortable. The room lighting was great and the heating just right(you could adjust it to what you wanted). Massive desk with internet connections. Plenty of storage and an in room safe.The reception area is small but comfy and the staff are really good and helpful - nothing too much trouble.I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

<Author>CDOJ
<Content>Fantastic Hotel, early reviews were right... We've just come back from a fantastic stay in NY over Thanksgiving. From first booking the hotel until we left the staff at the hotel have been fantastic, it seemed like nothing was too much trouble for them. The room was spacious and very clean with great views across the city. The Barking Dog restaurant was great, only $7 + tip for a big breakfast. Try Cinema restaurant (out the hotel turn tight and on the junction) for dinner.Got to know the door staff, met Christopher who was a friendly guy and always welcomed us back to the hotel and even gave info about our flight being delayed etc, they seemed to know who we were, when we were leaving etc. If you want to book a car through them they can organise that too which we did although in hindsight we'll probably use Carmel next time.We're hoping to go back next year and will definitely be staying at the Affinia again, money very well spent, enjoy!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Pros and Cons Recently spent 5 nights here in a one-bedroom. Chose this hotel because we needed space and kitchen facilities while one of us recuperated from surgery at a local hospital.Pros: spacious layout, very convenient location, well-equipped clean kitchen, very nice toiletries (Aveda), friendly staff, large screen tvCons: hallways and apt. walls really needed painting--starting to look shabby; furniture a bit worn; one bedspread had 2 large holes in it and was stained; tub caulking was moldy; heating in apt. was difficult to adjust; apt. did not have dining table and meals had to be taken sitting on the sofa or at the desk.Would recommend this hotel mainly for those who really need space and cooking facilities--good value.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Doesn't Get Better Than This!!!! Stayed at Ritzs, The Bellevue in Phila, NY Hyatt, and many Marriots but nothing compares to The Affinia Dumont. My husband and I just stayed there last night. I mentioned via online reservation that we were celebrating our anniversary. We arrived to check in and was welcomed with Happy Anniversary by front desk staff. We were immediately upgraded to a corner suite on the 34th floor, a large room with amazing views of the city, Aveda bath products AND a dozen pink roses compliments of the hotel. This just doesn't happen to the not rich and famous. From the moment we stepped in to the time we left, our stay was phenominal. The spa was great and breakfast at the Barking Dog was tasty. Andrey at the front desk was so helpful. He got us reservations to a great restaurant and hailed us a taxi. We were treated like royalty. Being a people watcher, I noticed the other guests were treated the same way. Many were referred to by name and one gentleman said he only stays at the Dumont when in NYC. Unfortunately, with all the great reviews, it will probably be tough to get reservations but I can't imagine staying anywhere else!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great suite with a view After countless hours searching for a good hotel deal for our first trip to New York, and based on reviews here, we choose the Affinia Dumont. Boy, are we glad we did. We booked our trip Wednesday and arrived Sunday for four days. The people at the front desk were all friendly and helpful, holding our bags until there was a room ready (we were early). We had a large suite with kitchenette, large living room, bedroom and bath on the 36th floor overlooking the East River. There were great restaurants and the subway nearby. 34th is a two-way street which made us feel safer walking at night. We did not see the inside of any of the other hotels we were considering but we did see the outside of quite a few. Some were on small dark streets and did not look very appealing. Our room was $370 a night and after comparing prices and size we would stay at the Dumont again in a flash. Great Job done by everyone there!!!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>We were very, very happy! After HOURS of internet hotel shopping, I somehow stumbled upon the Affinia Dumont on this site. Well, what a relief! I wasn't finding anything in our price range that didn't have a horror story or two associated with it. Whether it was dirty rooms, bugs, rude staff, or simply the size, everything I looked at had problems - until I reviewed the Affinia, which had consistenly good reviews! This was our first overnight stay in NYC, so I can't compare it to anything else in the city, but we were very pleased. The location isn't in the heart of things, which we appreciated. But, we were able to walk or take the subway everywhere we wanted to go, up and down Manhattan, and even walked to the hotel from Penn Station when we arrived by Amtrak. (We took a cab back b/c after 4 days of pounding the pavement, we needed the break! With tip, it was $10 in heavy traffic.) Even after a late show (11PM), the subway was great - a big change from memories of the city 20 years ago. As for the hotel, we had a suite that we got for $248/night. I used the price comparisons on this site, and for some reason, tavelocity gave a much lower rate than all the others (the prices were always consistent for other hotels; I think this was a fluke!). I contacted the hotel directly and they honored the price. We weren't able to get a room with a view, but for the price, we couldn't complain. It's still hard to think this was a deal, but I think it really was. And, we were surprised that everything else in NY seemed reasonably priced. As others have said, the suite was huge, clean, and nicely furnished (contemporary, but warm, with fun art and a simple little kitchenette). There were nice extras like a halltree for coats, and an umbrella (which we used!), a velour throw for curling up on the sofa, and a shaving mirror in the shower. Our suite had great built-in armoire, with plenty of closet space, drawers, and a safe. There were beverages and snacks in the room, but as in all hotels, the prices were high. We stopped at the mini-market on the corner for stuff, and there was a real grocer on Lexington and 35th. NOTE: While there's a kitchenette, there's no dining table, so if traveling with kids, they should be old enough to eat on the couch. I used the fitness center, which had treadmills, bikes, and eliptical trainers, all good quality and in great shape, with their own TVs. There was also some weight equipment. The spa looked nice, though we didn't use it. The hotels offers fit kits to use during your stay, which we never did request - for strength training, walking, running, or yoga. They even include a CD or MP3 player. I regret not asking for the walking kit, which included a pedometer. It would have been interesting to know how much walking we did during our stay. As others have said, the staff were all very friendly and welcoming. There were several great places right on 34th to grab a bagel and fresh juice or coffee in the AM or a sandwich, soup /or salad for a lite dinner in your room. (We tried Guy  Gallard, GiGi's,  Austin's - all good). There's also a good Jewish deli on Lexington  36th or 37th. I've written way too much, but want everyone to know this is a safe bet. I know it's tough to plan a trip to NYC, especially if you're not familiar with the area. And if this property doesn't work for you, check out some of the other Affinia properties, all in Manhattan ---------. Some a little cheper, some more spendy. One even accepts pets!  
<Date>Oct 23, 2004
<Rating>5	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1	-1

<Author>TexasPam
<Content>Best Kept Secret in New York Just came back from spending 4 nights at the Dumont (Oct 4-8), and it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had in New York.I got a one bedroom suite that overlooked the east river, the living room and bedrooms were very large, and it had a small kitchen that came in very handy...I felt like I was in my own New York apartment. The bed was heavenly, on the scale of the Westin or W hotels, and the furnishings in the rest of the apartment were modern and clean. The staff at the hotel was exceptional and responded immediately to any little thing I needed (restaurant menus, a vase for the flowers I bought, etc). Housekeeping was there every morning and came back whenever I asked.One day, after walking most of the morning, my tired body decided to just stop on the spa floor and check it out. They could immediately take me in for a massage which turned out to be the best thing I did for myself that day! After the massage, I used the steam room, then took a shower and I was mellowed out for the rest of the day.I especially loved the location... it's in a residential area, instead of the hustle and bustle of midtown or times square, which means the restaurants are less expensive and there are grocery stores, laundries, nail salons all within blocks of the hotel. Yet, it is close to the lexington avenue subway @ 33rd Street.... and the 34th St crosstown bus is right outside the door. It is also an easy walk to Grand Central and Macy's.Would I stay there again... in a heartbeat!  
<Date>Oct 9, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Family-friendly to a T I'm usually a denizen of grubby, shared-bath hotels downtown, but with the family joining me for a weekend night (and with an expense account to burn) I splurged for a junior suite at the Affinia Dumont for $289 plus tax (which brought it to $329.)Knowing very well what a dollar buys in terms of NYC hotels, I have to say that I was really floored with what we got for our money. The room was large -- not just large-for-New-York -- but large, period. Compare to Amerisuites or Embassy Suites elsewhere. The bed was comparable to the Westin or W, the bath was stocked with Aveda products, and the multiple dimmers for lighting were great. The desk and workspace were top notch and heavily used by us -- the Aeon chair was sharp.I had the presence of mind to ask for a Chrysler Building view, which we got and then some. We were on the 34th Floor in a corner room overlooking the heart of midtown *and* the East River. My almost two-year-old loved climbing up to the windows, looking out and saying Noo Yorchhh!The kitchenette was fully stocked and had everything we'd need to all-out cook if we wanted to: gas range, microwave, large refrigerator, plates, glasses and silverware. It was great for warming up milk for my daughter, at the very least, and handy when we ordered from the nearby Barking Dog and had leftovers.A word about the restaurant -- decent value for money and even a good deal if you ordered it as room service! Room service just adds $2 and a 17% tip on the market prices on the menu. Since I tip 20% in restaurants anyway, that's a good deal. (But since I'm a cheapskate, I called in my order and picked it up personally!)I didn't end up using the gym, but I checked it out and was pleased to discover that there were enough machines for me to do the same workout I usually do at my local Y. Awesome for a hotel gym.All in all, really unbeatable at the sub-$300 level. I'm hard pressed to think how you could do better in NYC.  
<Date>Oct 4, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great fitness hotel! The theme for this hotel is fitness (other Affinias have relaxation or location as themes) and it had a great fitness kit that could be used in the room, as well as a very good gym (open to guests 24 hrs.) and a great steam room. The staff were all super friendly and helpful. The rooms (we had a one bedroom suite - 2 dbl beds and another roomw/foldout couch) were reminiscent of the ones at the Sofitel in NYC, but more spacious. Great beds (almost seemed like the Westin heavenly beds!)!! Housekeeping was a bit odd, but ask at the desk if you need anything (or the room done at a certain time) and they'll get it done. Also, I like to walk and found the location just far enough from the theatre area to make a decent walk. Took about 20 - 25 minutes. Also - the Madison Bistro, on Madison, a few blocks up from the hotel, was a great spot for dinner. There's a place called something like GiGi's, around Madison and 34th (on 34th) that's very good for breakfast.Very impressive hotel, overall.

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Fantastic I just returned from NYC yesterday after my first stay at the Affinia Dumont, and the entire experience was fantastic! The lobby was welcoming and calming (fruit and juice for guests); the view from the room was spectacular; the suites were contemporary and comfortable; the fitness room actually looked like one (lots of hotels have a few machines in varying working conditions but NOT here: weight machines; free weights; mats; medicine balls; 2-3 stability balls; 3 treadmills; 3 stairclimbers; 3 bikes--treadmills had their own monitors with complimentary headphones) and I simply cannot compliment the hotel's staff enough! Gina, Glen and Alex in particular are outstanding--very personable AND professional. This hotel really suited my needs because I was visiting the city with my parents and two young nieces. We stayed in a one-BR suite. I requested two full-sized beds in the bedroom (which they said were available) but the hotel called me a few days before, saying they only had king-sized beds available. I asked for a roll-away bed and they accommodated me without extra charge (usually a $20/night fee). My parents slept in the BR; my nieces on the roll-away bed; and I slept on the sofa/pull-out bed. And having a kitchen was a lifesaver! I've visited lots of hotels for both work and leisure, but this was far away the best hotel experience I've ever had. When visiting the city, we usually stay at another hotel--but not any longer! The Affinia Dumont will be our new home when we visit the city.  
<Date>Jul 12, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Wow...phenomenal hotel!! This hotel is the best that I have ever stayed in...and I am a frequent business traveler. I did at least two weeks of research before booking a room at the Affinia Dumont. I really wanted to find a place that would be contemporary, spacious, a great value and a good location. I have very expectations, but since this was my first time, I told myself to not such high expectations. Boy, was I in for a surprise!! The staff was exceptional, the room was amazing and the location of the hotel was outstanding. One of the biggest things that I experienced was a great feeling of comfort. I felt like the hotel was my second home and I have never experienced this before in any other hotel. My husband who is incredibly picky and has a great eye for detail was floored by how much better the executive desk and chair was compared to at home and he especially appreciated the use of lights, extra plugs and dimmer switches throughout the room. The attention to detail in the room's layout and decor was very apparent.Anyways, if you are reading this, stop researching and book a room at this fine hotel...you will not be disappointed!!

<Author>zamom
<Content>Nice, but not as nice as expected After reading the reviews here on tripadvisor, I cancelled the reservation I had at another hotel and reserved here. I was travelling on business, but with my family (husband and two small kids).I had a few problems. I had requested early check-in so that I could dress and prepare for a business meeting, but this request was not honored. When I asked about internet cables, maps of NYC, and coupons to the Empire State Building, the staff claimed to be out of all of these. They did not offer to accommodate me in any other way. Also, the door to the bathroom was broken and could not close, a problem because we were four people in the room. The bedspread on the bed was stained on the side closest to the bed. The staff did not seem to be knowledgeable about things to do with kids in New York (didn't know where the zoo was, couldn't recommend restaurants, etc.). The front desk, while very personable, was not very efficient. While my small kids and I waited in line for assistance, one staff member spent at least 15 minutes helping a young guest choose a club to go out to that night. Finally, when I called the hotel the week before my stay and asked for concierge help with getting a theater ticket, she said she would do so, but never ended up calling me back. The plusses: The room was spacious and had a wonderful view. The staff was very friendly to my children. The location of the hotel was terrific (near Macy's, lots of shopping, etc.). There was a really good Chinese restaurant right around the corner from the hotel -- go left out of hotel, turn left on Lexington, it's on the left. However, I usually stay at the Casablanca, and I'll probably go back there.  
<Date>Jun 28, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Great place overall Loved the Affinia Dumont Suites. Desk staff and doormen very friendly and helpful. Rooms were terrific, spacious (NY spacious) and clean. It's in a great location in Manhatten. Easy access to lower Manhatten or Midtown. Our only issue was, we had booked non-smoking and upon arrival there were no more non-smoking available. We were assured the rooms were freshened however, they still wreaked of cigarette smoke, despite the best efforts of housekeeping. I'd definitely stay at this hotel again if I were guaranteed a non-smoking room.No offense but the no smoking restaurant laws should be extended to hotels!Definitely worth a try!

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Believe all the great things you've heard about Affinia Dumont. The Affinia Dumont must be NYC's best value. The accommodations and perks are impressive for the money paid, especially when I read horrible reviews of much more expensive hotels. I recently returned from a three-night stay and can't say enough good things about the Dumont. My husband and I got a one-bedroom suite. The room was stylish, cozy and very clean. We had great views of the city from both the living area and bedroom. The bedroom had built-in storage with plenty of room for clothes and other belongings. We could control the temperture separately for the bedroom and living area. We even had our own remote-controlled stereo. The Thai restaurant next door was great and had very reasonable prices. The Barking Dog, which is in the same building as the Dumont and provides room service, was also good and had a quaint courtyard. (The BD did seem a little pricey to me for what you got, but was probably average for NYC.)With a subway stop a block up, a corner grocery and drugstore, and several restaurants nearby, it felt like our own private neighborhood in the big city.The elevators were always available and very efficient. Also, the staff were extremely courteous and professional.One note: The locals and cab drivers seem to know the place as the Dumont Plaza, which I assume is a former name. This can cause some confusion when taking a cab, so keep that in mind.  
<Date>May 28, 2004

<Author>A TripAdvisor Member
<Content>Can't Wait to Get Back! We JUST got back from the Affinia Dumont, and all I can say is WOW! Checking in was easy, the people were unbelievably friendly, courteous, and helpful, and the room was great! We got in early, and Gina at the front desk told us if we could check in later she'd get us a room up high. We checked our luggage in, and took off to do some touring! When we came back, she was true to her word. We were on the highest floor, the 37th, with an unbelievable view of the Chrysler Building! We stayed in the studio suite, with the king sized bed. It was great!! The bathroom had all of the amenities and more, and the room was spacious with a desk area, and 2 comfortable extra chairs!We will DEFINATELY be staying here again!

<Author>BJr970
<Content>Spacious, Gracious and Well Located We just returned from a weekend stay at the Affinia Dumont. Our adjoining 8th floor rooms afforded us over 1,000 square feet of space. Plush bedding with padded leather headboards. Well-outfitted marble baths were compact, but with a plethora of accessories and conveniences. Toiletries were signature blends from the Affinia Spa on the premises. Rooms feature a fully stocked galley style kitchen. I have never seen so much workable desk space in a hotel before, although the faux black leather-look desktop was cheezy. An comfortable Aeron desk chair was a nice surprise. The modern decor featured many unique lighting opportunities, all with dimmer switches. Large screen TVs (maybe 32 inch?) and a stereo system were on hand, as well as Sony Dream Machine bedside alarm clock and CD players. Materials in the room were in good condition with minimal signs of wear and tear. An on site restaurant, The Barking Dog, supplies the room service, which appeared to be decently priced. A total of only 7 rooms on our floor provided plenty of quiet and privacy for our group of six. Street noises were mild and were of the of police siren variety. Heavy cream draperies and mesh sheers were on the wall to wall windows. The bellstaff, especially Christopher, was great. Christopher was most helpful and friendly. The rate for the two suites was $429. In comparison to what you get in a standard hotel room for $250-$400 a night, it was a good value. Parking for an SUV was $42. We kept our vehicle parked and our luggage checked in until 8 PM on the day we checked out. Upon our return, Christopher swiftly gathered our bags and our SUV was waiting out front for us in no time. Just a few blocks from the Empire State Building and Macy's, and with nice restaurants nearby, the Affinia Dumont is a good choice for a weekend trip or a romantic getaway.  
<Date>Mar 22, 2004
